name: act
trans: n. 行为，行动；法令，法案；（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕，段；装腔作势,vt. 扮演；装作，举动像,vi. 行动；扮演，充当；表现，举止；假装，演戏；起作用，见效

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

name: active
trans: n. 主动语态；积极分子,adj. 积极的；活跃的；主动的；有效的；现役的

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: actively
trans: adv. 积极地；活跃地

sentences.english: You can actively argue with your mind.
sentences.chinese: 你可以积极地和你的思想争论。

name: activate
trans: vt. 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性,vi. 激活；有活力

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: transact
trans: vt. 办理；处理,vi. 交易；谈判

sentences.english: Most deals are transacted over the phone.
sentences.chinese: 大多数生意都是在电话里成交的。

detailed_translations.english: to do business with someone

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: interact
trans: n. 幕间剧；幕间休息,vt. 互相影响；互相作用,vi. 互相影响；互相作用

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: interaction
trans: n. 相互作用； 交互作用,n. 互动

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

detailed_translations.english: a process by which two or more things affect each other

name: interactive
trans: adj. 交互式的；相互作用的

sentences.english: interactive computer systems
sentences.chinese: 交互式电脑系统

sentences.english: the museum’s interactive exhibits
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的互动展品

detailed_translations.chinese: 互相作用的，互相影响的
detailed_translations.english: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions

name: react
trans: vi. 反应；影响；反抗；起反作用,vt. 使发生相互作用；使起化学反应

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: reaction
trans: n. 反应，感应；反动，复古；反作用

sentences.english: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
sentences.chinese: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时，他是什么反应？

detailed_translations.english: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said

name: agency
trans: n. 代理，中介；代理处，经销处

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: agent
trans: n. 代理人，代理商；药剂；特工,adj. 代理的,vt. 由…作中介；由…代理

sentences.english: Our agent in Rio deals with all our Brazilian business.
sentences.chinese: 我们在里约热内卢的业务代表处理我们在巴西的全部业务。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

name: agenda
trans: n. 议程；日常工作事项；日程表

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

name: insect
trans: n. 昆虫；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: section
trans: n. 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节,vt. 把…分段；将…切片；对…进行划分,vi. 被切割成片；被分成部分

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: sector
trans: n. 部门；扇形，扇区；象限仪；函数尺,vt. 把…分成扇形

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: segment
trans: n. 段；部分,vt. 分割,vi. 分割

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: contact
trans: n. 接触，联系,vt. 使接触，联系,vi. 使接触，联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: intact
trans: adj. 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: contagion
trans: n. 传染病；蔓延；触染

name: integrate
trans: n. 一体化；集成体,adj. 整合的；完全的,vi. 求积分；取消隔离；成为一体,vt. 使…完整；使…成整体；求…的积分；表示…的总和

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: integrity
trans: n. 完整；正直；诚实；廉正

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: disintegrate
trans: vi. 瓦解；碎裂；衰变,vt. 使分解；使碎裂；使崩溃；使衰变

sentences.english: The plane just disintegrated in mid-air.
sentences.chinese: 飞机就在半空中解体了。

detailed_translations.english: to break up, or make something break up, into very small pieces

name: elect
trans: n. 被选的人；特殊阶层；上帝的选民,adj. 选出的；当选的；卓越的,vi. 作出选择；进行选举,vt. 选举；选择；推选

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: election
trans: n. 选举；当选；选择权；上帝的选拔

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: collect
trans: vt. 收集；募捐,adj. 由收件人付款的,vi. 收集；聚集；募捐,adv. 由收件人付款地

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: collection
trans: n. 采集，聚集； 征收；收藏品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: collective
trans: n. 集团；集合体；集合名词,adj. 集体的；共同的；集合的；集体主义的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: select
trans: n. 被挑选者；精萃,adj. 精选的；挑选出来的；极好的,vt. 挑选；选拔,vi. 挑选

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

name: selection
trans: n. 选择，挑选；选集；精选品

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

name: delegate
trans: n. 代表,vt. 委派…为代表

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: delegation
trans: n. 代表团；授权；委托

sentences.english: A trade delegation will visit Kuwait.
sentences.chinese: 一个贸易代表团将访问科威特。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who represent a company, organization etc

name: elegant
trans: adj. 高雅的，优雅的；讲究的；简炼的；简洁的

sentences.english: a tall, elegant young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材高挑、举止优雅的年轻女子

sentences.english: You can dine in elegant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在雅致的环境中进餐。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful, attractive, or graceful

name: neglect
trans: vt. 疏忽，忽视；忽略,n. 疏忽，忽视；怠慢

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negligible
trans: adj. 微不足道的，可以忽略的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: intellect
trans: n. 智力，理解力；知识分子；思维逻辑领悟力；智力高的人

sentences.english: He combined a formidable intellect with a talent for speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他不但智力超群，而且口才出众。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand things and to think intelligently

name: intellectual
trans: n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者,adj. 智力的；聪明的；理智的

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；情报工作；情报机关；理解力；才智，智慧；天分

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: reflect
trans: vt. 反映；反射，照出；表达；显示;反省,vi. 反射，映现；深思

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: reflection
trans: n. 反射；沉思；映象

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: flexibility
trans: n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: relation
trans: n. 关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: relationship
trans: n. 关系；关联

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: relate
trans: vt. 叙述；使…有联系,vi. 涉及；认同；符合；与…有某种联系

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: relative
trans: n. 亲戚；相关物； 关系词；亲缘植物,adj. 相对的；有关系的；成比例的

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relativity
trans: n. 相对论；相关性；相对性

sentences.english: They teach the relativity of all ethical ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他们宣扬一切道德观念的相对性。

sentences.english: Einstein put forward his new theory of relativity.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦提出了相对论的新学说。

sentences.english: Everyone was talking about relativity, not only the scientists, but the philosophers and the writers of columns in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都在谈论相对论，不仅仅是科学家，甚至哲学家和报纸的专栏作者也是如此。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship in  physics  between time, space, and movement according to Einstein’s  theory

name: respond
trans: n. 应答；唱和,vi. 回答；作出反应；承担责任,vt. 以…回答

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: correspond
trans: vi. 符合，一致；相应；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: correspondence
trans: n. 通信；一致；相当

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

name: correspondent
trans: n. 通讯记者；客户；通信者；代理商行

sentences.english: The result was correspondent with my wishes.
sentences.chinese: 结果与我的愿望是一致的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通讯员，记者；异地代理商；代理银行
detailed_translations.english: someone who is employed by a newspaper or a television station etc to report news from a particular area or on a particular subject

name: corresponding
trans: adj. 相当的，相应的；一致的；通信的,v. 类似（correspond的ing形式）；相配

sentences.english: The war and the corresponding fall in trade have had a devastating effect on the country.
sentences.chinese: 战争以及由此所导致的贸易量下降对这个国家产生了致命的影响。

sentences.english: Sales are up 10% on the corresponding period last year.
sentences.chinese: 销售比去年同期增加了10%。

detailed_translations.english: caused by or connected with something you have already mentioned

name: response
trans: n. 响应；反应；回答

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: responsible
trans: adj. 负责的，可靠的；有责任的

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: sponsor
trans: n. 赞助者；主办者；保证人,vt. 赞助；发起

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: spontaneous
trans: adj. 自发的；自然的；无意识的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: arrange
trans: vi. 安排；排列；协商,vt. 安排；排列；整理

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: rearrange
trans: vt. 重新排列；重新整理

sentences.english: She set about rearranging the furniture in the living room.
sentences.chinese: 她开始重新摆放起居室的家具。

detailed_translations.english: to change the position or order of things

name: arrangement
trans: n. 布置；整理；准备

sentences.english: Have you made all your travel arrangements?
sentences.chinese: 你的旅行都安排好了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 整理， 排列； 安排； 准备工作
detailed_translations.english: plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉,vt. 漫游；放牧；使并列；归类于；来回走动,vi. （在...内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: rank
trans: n. 排；等级；军衔；队列,adj. 讨厌的；恶臭的；繁茂的,vt. 排列；把…分等,vi. 列为；列队

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: consider
trans: vi. 考虑；认为；细想,vt. 考虑；认为；考虑到；细想

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大的；重要的，值得考虑的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: considerably
trans: adv. 相当地；非常地

sentences.english: It’s considerably colder today.
sentences.chinese: 今天冷多了。

sentences.english: Conditions have improved considerably over the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 过去几年里条件已经得到了很大的改善。

detailed_translations.english: much or a lot

name: considerate
trans: adj. 体贴的；体谅的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: consideration
trans: n. 考虑；原因；关心；报酬

sentences.english: proposals put forward for consideration
sentences.chinese: 提请考虑的建议

sentences.english: They’ve got no consideration for others.
sentences.chinese: 他们一点都不为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: careful thought and attention, especially before making an official or important decision

name: considering
trans: conj. 考虑到,prep. 考虑到；就...而论,v. 考虑到（consider的ing形式）

sentences.english: Considering the strength of the opposition, we did very well to score two goals.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到对方实力强大，我们能攻进两球已经很不错了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鉴于， 考虑到， 顾及
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you are thinking about a particular fact when you are giving your opinion

name: produce
trans: n. 农产品，产品,vt. 生产；引起；创作；生育，繁殖,vi. 生产，创作

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: producer
trans: n. 制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器

sentences.english: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
sentences.chinese: …沙特阿拉伯，世界上最重要的石油生产国。

sentences.english: Hollywood producers and movie stars
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

name: produce
trans: n. 农产品，产品,vt. 生产；引起；创作；生育，繁殖,vi. 生产，创作

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果； 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: production
trans: n. 成果；产品；生产；作品

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现,vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: part
trans: n. 部分；角色；零件；一些；片段,adj. 部分的,vt. 分离；分配；分开,adv. 部分地,vi. 断裂；分手

sentences.english: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

sentences.english: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
sentences.chinese: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

name: participate
trans: vi. 参与，参加；分享,vt. 分享；分担,

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: participant
trans: n. 参与者；关系者,adj. 参与的；有关系的

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: participation
trans: n. 参与；分享；参股

sentences.english: Thank you for your participation.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的参与。

sentences.english: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
sentences.chinese: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking part in an activity or event

name: participatory
trans: adj. 供人分享的；吸引参与的

sentences.english: a participatory democracy
sentences.chinese: 公众参与的民主

detailed_translations.chinese: 供人分享的；吸引参与的
detailed_translations.english: a participatory way of organizing something, making decisions etc is one that involves everyone who will be affected

name: partial
trans: adj. 局部的；偏爱的；不公平的

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: partly
trans: adv. 部分地；在一定程度上

sentences.english: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。

sentences.english: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。

sentences.english: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
sentences.chinese: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作，部分原因是母亲病了。

sentences.english: The group is funded partly by the government.
sentences.chinese: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

detailed_translations.english: to some degree, but not completely

name: particle
trans: n. 颗粒； 质点；极小量；小品词

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

name: particular
trans: n. 详细说明；个别项目,adj. 特别的；详细的；独有的；挑剔的

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: particularly
trans: adv. 特别地，独特地；详细地，具体地；明确地，细致地

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

name: portion
trans: n. 部分；一份；命运,vt. 分配；给…嫁妆

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: proportion
trans: n. 比例，占比；部分；面积；均衡,vt. 使成比例；使均衡；分摊

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: proportional
trans: n.  比例项,adj. 比例的，成比例的；相称的，均衡的

sentences.english: The fee charged by the realtor is directly proportional to the price of the property.
sentences.chinese: 房产代理人收取的费用和房产价格是成正比的。

sentences.english: a proportional increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的相应提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 比例的，成比例的；相称的，均衡的
detailed_translations.english: something that is proportional to something else is in the correct or most suitable relationship to it in size, amount, importance etc

name: apart
trans: adj. 分离的；与众不同的,adv. 相距；与众不同地；分离着

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: apartment
trans: n. 公寓；房间

sentences.english: She lives in a small apartment.
sentences.chinese: 她住在一套小公寓里。

detailed_translations.english: a set of rooms on one floor of a large building, where someone lives

name: depart
trans: adj. 逝世的,vi. 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世

sentences.english: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世
detailed_translations.english: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

name: departed
trans: n. 死者,v. 离去；去世（depart的过去分词）,adj. 过去的；死去的；以往的

name: departure
trans: n. 离开；出发；违背

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: department
trans: n. 部；部门；系；科；局

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰,vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期,vt. 夸耀；挥舞

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: erode
trans: vt. 腐蚀，侵蚀,vi. 侵蚀；受腐蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: zoology
trans: n. 动物学，动物学课程; （某一地区的）全部动物，（某种动物的）动物特性

sentences.english: The scholarship money she won helped her attend Cornell University, where she majored in zoology.
sentences.chinese: 她赢得的奖学金帮助她上康奈尔大学，在那里他主修动物学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

name: transit
trans: n. 运输；经过,vt. 运送,vi. 经过

sentences.english: baggage that is lost or damaged in transit
sentences.chinese: 在运输过程中丢失或损坏的行李

sentences.english: transit by air or sea
sentences.chinese: 空运或海运

detailed_translations.english: the process of moving goods or people from one place to another

name: suburb
trans: n. 郊区；边缘

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

name: rural
trans: adj. 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: episode
trans: n. 插曲；一段情节；插话；有趣的事件

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: proverb
trans: n. 谚语，格言；众所周知的人或事

sentences.english: An old Arab proverb says, "The enemy of my enemy is my friend."
sentences.chinese: 有一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说：“我敌人的敌人是我的朋友。”

detailed_translations.english: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议,adj. 表示抗议的；抗议性的,vt. 抗议；断言,vi. 抗议；断言

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的,n. 军队；军人

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: accuse
trans: vt. 控告，指控；谴责；归咎于,vi. 指责；控告

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: torture
trans: n. 折磨；拷问；歪曲,vt. 折磨；拷问；歪曲

sentences.english: He died after five days of excruciating torture.
sentences.chinese: 遭受了五天的严刑拷打之后，他死了。

sentences.english: The waiting must be torture for you.
sentences.chinese: 这样的等待对你来说肯定是一种煎熬。

sentences.english: Political opponents of the regime may be tortured.
sentences.chinese: 这个政权的政治异己可能会遭受酷刑。

detailed_translations.english: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel
to deliberately hurt someone in order to force them to give you information, to punish them, or to be cruel

name: discriminate
trans: vi. 区别；辨别,vt. 歧视；区别；辨别

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: deprive
trans: vt. 使丧失，剥夺

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: exile
trans: n. 流放，充军；放逐，被放逐者；流犯,vt. 放逐，流放；使背井离乡

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分,vt. 使成碎片,vi. 破碎或裂开

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: conquer
trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取,vi. 胜利；得胜

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: supplement
trans: vt. 增补，补充,n. 增补，补充；补充物；增刊，副刊

sentences.english: vitamins and other dietary supplements
sentences.chinese: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

detailed_translations.chinese: 增补， 补充； 增刊， 副刊
detailed_translations.english: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

name: remedy
trans: n. 补救；治疗；赔偿,vt. 补救；治疗；纠正

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: arm
trans: n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门,vt. 武装；备战,vi. 武装起来

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

name: tour
trans: n. 旅游，旅行；巡回演出,vt. 旅行，在……旅游；在……作巡回演出,vi. 旅行，旅游；作巡回演出

sentences.english: We met on a coach tour in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我们是在意大利乘长途客车旅游时相识的。

detailed_translations.english: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc

name: raise
trans: n. 高地；上升；加薪,vt. 提高；筹集；养育；升起,vi. 上升

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: modest
trans: adj. 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: tailor
trans: n. 裁缝,vt. 剪裁；使合适,vi. 做裁缝

sentences.english: In his youth his father bound him out to a tailor.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时他父亲叫他去给一个裁缝当学徒。

sentences.english: Treatment is tailored to the needs of each patient.
sentences.chinese: 治疗方案是针对各个病人的需要而制订的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make men’s clothes, that are measured to fit each customer perfectly
to make something so that it is exactly right for someone’s particular needs or for a particular purpose

name: spot
trans: n. 地点；斑点,adj. 现场的；现货买卖的,vt. 认出；弄脏；用灯光照射,vi. 沾上污渍；满是斑点,adv. 准确地；恰好

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: way
trans: n. 方法；道路；方向；行业；习惯,adj. 途中的,adv. 大大地；远远地

sentences.english: My family was in a bad way financially.
sentences.chinese: 我家当时经济窘迫。

sentences.english: The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it.
sentences.chinese: 这鸡肉很脆，正是我喜欢的口味。

sentences.english: It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 你应该想想如何让现状变得更好。

detailed_translations.english: a particular state or condition

name: expressway
trans: n. （美）高速公路

sentences.english: He barreled along the expressway.
sentences.chinese: 他沿高速公路高速行驶。

sentences.english: Then he swung the car onto the expressway.
sentences.chinese: 然后他便转弯把车驶入了高速公路。

sentences.english: The car collision succeeded on the expressway due to a dense fog.
sentences.chinese: 因为浓雾，在高速公路上发生了连续撞车事件。

detailed_translations.english: a wide road in a city on which cars can travel very quickly without stopping

name: freeway
trans: n. 高速公路

sentences.english: the Central Freeway
sentences.chinese: 中央高速公路

detailed_translations.english: a very wide road in the US, built for fast travel

name: convey
trans: vt. 传达；运输；让与

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: vehicle
trans: n.  车辆；工具；交通工具；运载工具；传播媒介；媒介物

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: obvious
trans: adj. 明显的；显著的；平淡无奇的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的,adv. 在先；在…以前

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: previously
trans: adv. 以前；预先；仓促地

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: via
trans: prep. 渠道，通过；经由

sentences.english: We flew to Athens via Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们经由巴黎飞往雅典。

detailed_translations.english: travelling through a place on the way to another place

name: want
trans: n. 需要；缺乏；贫困；必需品,vt. 需要；希望；应该；缺少,vi. 需要；缺少

sentences.english: She spent her life pandering to the wants of her children.
sentences.chinese: 她一生都在设法满足子女的需要。

sentences.english: The gallery closed down for want of funding.
sentences.chinese: 那家画廊由于缺乏资金关闭了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you need or want

name: vanish
trans: n. 弱化音,vi. 消失；突然不见；成为零,vt. 使不见，使消失

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: vain
trans: adj. 徒劳的；自负的；无结果的；无用的

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

name: vacation
trans: n. 假期；（房屋）搬出,vi. 休假，度假

sentences.english: What will you do this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 你这个假期将干什么？

sentences.english: Do you have any vacation plans?
sentences.chinese: 您假期有什么安排吗？

sentences.english: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 这个假期你有什么想法吗？

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere for a holiday
a holiday, or time spent not working

name: vacant
trans: adj. 空虚的；空的；空缺的；空闲的；茫然的

sentences.english: Only a few apartments were still vacant.
sentences.chinese: 只有几套公寓仍然空着。

sentences.english: There was only a vacant lot (= empty unused area of land in a city ) where her house used to be.
sentences.chinese: 她以前房子所在的地方只剩下一块空地了。

detailed_translations.english: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

name: vacuum
trans: n. 真空；空间；真空吸尘器,adj. 真空的；利用真空的；产生真空的,vt. 用真空吸尘器清扫

sentences.english: I vacuumed the carpets today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集； 用真空吸尘器打扫
detailed_translations.english: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

name: win
trans: n. 赢；胜利,vt. 赢得；在…中获胜；劝诱,vi. 赢；获胜；成功

sentences.english: Who’s winning (= who is most successful at this point in the game )?
sentences.chinese: 现在谁领先？

detailed_translations.english: to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
a success or victory, especially in sport

name: convince
trans: vt. 说服；使确信，使信服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: victory
trans: n. 胜利；成功；克服

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: convict
trans: n. 罪犯,vt. 证明…有罪；宣告…有罪

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: conviction
trans: n. 定罪；确信；证明有罪；确信，坚定的信仰

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: victim
trans: n. 受害人；牺牲品；牺牲者

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

name: employ
trans: n. 使用；雇用,vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: employee
trans: n. 雇员；从业员工

sentences.english: a government employee
sentences.chinese: 政府雇员

detailed_translations.english: someone who is paid to work for someone else

name: employer
trans: n. 雇主，老板

sentences.english: The shoe factory is the largest employer in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or organization that employs people

name: employment
trans: n. 使用；职业；雇用

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业率；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: unemployed
trans: adj. 失业的；未被利用的

sentences.english: an unemployed actor
sentences.chinese: 没戏演的演员

sentences.english: I’ve only been unemployed for a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 我只失业了几个星期。

detailed_translations.english: without a job

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: commit
trans: vt. 犯罪，做错事；把...交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

name: commitment
trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金；犯；委任；委任状,vt. 委任；使服役；委托制作

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: contribute
trans: vt. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献,vi. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献,

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: contributor
trans: n. 贡献者；投稿者；捐助者

sentences.english: campaign contributors
sentences.chinese: 竞选捐助人

name: contribution
trans: n. 贡献；捐献；投稿

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: tribute
trans: n. 礼物； 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: attribute
trans: n. 属性；特质,vt. 归属；把…归于

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: distribute
trans: vt. 分配；散布；分开；把…分类

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: distributor
trans: n. 经销商；批发商； 分配器；分配者；散布者； 配电盘

sentences.english: ...Spain's largest distributor of petroleum products.
sentences.chinese: …西班牙最大的石油产品经销商。

detailed_translations.chinese: 经销商；批发商；[电] 分配器；分配者；散布者；[电] 配电盘
detailed_translations.english: a company or person that supplies shops and companies with goods

name: distribution
trans: n. 分布；分配

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: stick
trans: n. 棍；手杖；呆头呆脑的人,vi. 坚持；伸出；粘住,vt. 刺，戳；伸出；粘贴

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: sticky
trans: adj. 粘的；粘性的

sentences.english: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
sentences.chinese: 你的头发上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: a sticky floor
sentences.chinese: 黏糊糊的地板

detailed_translations.english: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

name: stick
trans: n. 棍；手杖；呆头呆脑的人,vi. 坚持；伸出；粘住,vt. 刺，戳；伸出；粘贴

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金,vt. 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌,vi. 打赌

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: stack
trans: n. 堆；堆叠,vt. 使堆叠；把…堆积起来,vi. 堆积，堆叠

sentences.english: stacks of dirty dishes
sentences.chinese: 一摞摞脏盘子

sentences.english: Mrs. Cathiard was stacking the clean bottles in crates.
sentences.chinese: 卡提亚夫人当时正在把干净的瓶子堆放到板条箱里。

detailed_translations.english: a neat pile of things
If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles

name: stock
trans: n. 股份，股票；库存；血统；树干；家畜,adj. 存货的，常备的；平凡的,vt. 进货；备有；装把手于…,vi. 囤积；办货；出新芽

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: tend
trans: vt. 照料，照管,vi. 趋向，倾向；照料，照顾

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: tendency
trans: n. 倾向，趋势；癖好

sentences.english: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
sentences.chinese: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

detailed_translations.chinese: 趋向， 趋势， 倾向
detailed_translations.english: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

name: tender
trans: n. 偿付，清偿；看管人；小船,adj. 温柔的；柔软的；脆弱的；幼稚的；难对付的,vt. 提供，偿还；使…变嫩；使…变柔软,vi. 投标；变柔软

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: attend
trans: vi. 出席；致力于；照料；照顾,vt. 出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: attendance
trans: n. 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

sentences.english: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

sentences.english: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
sentences.chinese: 去年的交易会有3.2万人参加。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤
detailed_translations.english: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc

name: attendant
trans: n. 服务员，侍者；随员，陪从,adj. 伴随的；侍候的

sentences.english: a cloakroom/parking/museum attendant
sentences.chinese: 衣帽间 / 停车服务员；博物馆接待员

sentences.english: The Prince was followed by his attendants.
sentences.chinese: 王子由其侍从陪同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侍者；（要人的）侍从；（病人的）护理人员
detailed_translations.english: a person whose job is to serve or help people in a public place

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争；奋斗；斗争；争论,vt. 主张；为...斗争

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: contender
trans: n. 竞争者；争夺者

sentences.english: Her trainer said yesterday that she would be a strong contender for a place on the Olympic team.
sentences.chinese: 她的教练昨天说，她会是取得奥运代表队里一个席位的一名强有力的竞争者。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is in competition with other people or things

name: extend
trans: vt. 延伸；扩大；推广；伸出；给予；使竭尽全力；对…估价,vi. 延伸；扩大；伸展；使疏开

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: extent
trans: n. 程度；范围；长度

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: extensive
trans: adj. 广泛的；大量的；广阔的

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

name: intensive
trans: n. 加强器,adj. 加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: intend
trans: vi. 有打算,vt. 打算；想要；意指

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: intentionally
trans: adv. 故意地，有意地

sentences.english: Or you can choose to accelerate your growth and intentionally devour life and all it offers .
sentences.chinese: 或者你可以选择加速你的成长，有意地吞噬生活及生活所赐予你的一切。

sentences.english: But in the past, we almost never intentionally or successfully utilized such wealth of information in creating, and reusing our knowledge and developed capability.
sentences.chinese: 但是在过去，我们几乎从未有意或成功地利用这些丰富的信息创建、重用我们的知识和拓展我们的能力。

sentences.english: Before it was fired, it was perfectly round, but the artist intentionally roughed up the edges.
sentences.chinese: 在它被烧制出来前，它相当的圆润。 但艺术家有意地把它的边缘弄粗糙。

name: tense
trans: n. 时态,adj. 紧张的；拉紧的,vt. 变得紧张；使拉紧,vi. 拉紧，变得紧张

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: tension
trans: n. 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压,vt. 使紧张；使拉紧

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: intense
trans: adj. 强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

name: intensify
trans: vt. 使加强，使强化；使变激烈,vi. 增强，强化；变激烈

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: intensity
trans: n. 强度；强烈； 亮度；紧张

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: defend
trans: vi. 保卫；防守,vt. 辩护；防护

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: defence
trans: n. 防御；防卫；答辩；防卫设备

sentences.english: soldiers who died in defence of their country
sentences.chinese: 为保卫祖国而献身的战士

sentences.english: The harbour's sea defences are in poor condition.
sentences.chinese: 港口的海防工事状况很差。

sentences.english: He wanted to conduct his own defence.
sentences.chinese: 他想自己为自己辩护。

detailed_translations.english: the act of protecting sb/sth from attack, criticism, etc.

name: defense
trans: n. 防卫，防护；防御措施；防守,vt. 谋划抵御

sentences.english: Of course, we'll consult closely with our allies every step of the way, because the security and defense of our allies, both in Europe and Asia, is not negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们将在前行道路上就每一步骤与我们的盟国密切磋商，因为我们欧洲和亚洲盟国的安全与防卫是不容讨价还价的。

name: defensive
trans: n. 防御；守势,adj. 自卫的；防御用的

sentences.english: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.

to commit a crime or crimes

name: offence
trans: n. 犯罪；违反；过错；攻击

sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

name: offense
trans: n. 犯罪，过错；进攻；触怒；引起反感的事物

sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result

name: check
trans: n. <美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对,vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；将一军,vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

name: course
trans: n. 科目；课程；过程；进程；道路；路线，航向；一道菜,vt. 追赶；跑过,vi. 指引航线；快跑

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: stream
trans: n. 溪流；流动；潮流；光线,vt. 流出；涌出；使飘动,vi. 流；涌进；飘扬

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts

name: call
trans: n. 电话；呼叫；要求；访问,vi. 呼叫；拜访；叫牌,vt. 呼叫；称呼；召集

sentences.chinese: 你可能会说这是无恶意的小玩笑，但是我却认为这是色情。

sentences.english: I heard someone calling in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我听到远处有人在叫。

detailed_translations.english: to use a word or name to describe someone or something in a particular way

trans: n. 召回；回忆；撤消,vt. 召回；回想起，记起；取消

sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

trans: adj. 所谓的；号称的

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑,vt. 向…挑战；对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问

name: reconcile
trans: vt. 使一致；使和解；调停，调解；使顺从

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

name: council
trans: n. 委员会；会议；理事会；地方议会；顾问班子

sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

name: counsel
trans: n. 法律顾问；忠告；商议；讨论；决策,vt. 建议；劝告,vi. 商讨；提出忠告

sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

name: car
trans: n. 汽车；车厢

sentences.chinese: 丹下了车，锁上车门。

sentences.english: He isn’t old enough to drive a car.
sentences.chinese: 他还未到可以开车的年龄。

sentences.english: Coughlan was killed in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 科赫兰死于一场车祸。

trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速,adj. 作为毕生职业的,vi. 全速前进，猛冲

sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .

sentences.chinese: 我小时候曾给木匠当过学徒。

sentences.english: That carpenter wanted to become a lawyer， but he was advised to stick to his last.
sentences.chinese: 那个木匠想当律师， 但别人劝他安分守己地干他自己的老本行。

name: carriage
trans: n. 运输；运费；四轮马车；举止；客车厢

sentences.chinese: 新当选的总统紧随其后，坐着6匹灰色骏马开道的敞篷马车。

sentences.english: a railway carriage

sentences.chinese: 农民在火车上装满稻草。

name: caravan

sentences.chinese: 吉卜赛人的大篷车

detailed_translations.chinese: （可供居住的）拖车，大篷车；（穿过沙漠地带的）旅行队（如商队）；<英>活动住宅；<美>移民列车
detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that a car can pull and in which people can live and sleep when they are on holiday

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘拖车度假；参加旅行队旅行

trans: n. 先锋；厢式货车；增值网,vt. 用车搬运

sentences.chinese: 运货车

sentences.chinese: 小型货车司机

trans: n. 排放；卸货；解雇,vt. 解雇；卸下；放出；免除,vi. 排放；卸货；流出

sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

sentences.chinese: 一张卡片纸

sentences.chinese: 我叫亚当•卡弗，这是我的名片。

trans: n.  硬纸板；纸板箱；卡纸板,adj. 不真实的；硬纸板制的

sentences.english: a sheet of cardboard
sentences.chinese: 一张卡纸

detailed_translations.chinese: [纸] 硬纸板；纸板箱；卡纸板

made from cardboard

trans: n. 明信片

sentences.chinese: 别忘了给我们寄张明信片！

detailed_translations.english: a card that can be sent in the post without an envelope, especially one with a picture on it

sentences.chinese: 迪斯尼动画片

sentences.english: ...one of Britain's best-loved cartoon characters, Rupert the Bear.
sentences.chinese: 英国最受欢迎的漫画形象之一——鲁珀特熊

sentences.chinese: 显示去年销售情况的一份图表

sentences.chinese: 天气图

sentences.chinese: 剧场的座位图

detailed_translations.english: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

trans: n. 变化； 变异，变种

sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid

name: variable
trans: n.  变量；可变物，可变因素,adj. 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的， 畸变的

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: various
trans: adj. 各种各样的；多方面的
