sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

name: invariably
trans: adv. 总是；不变地；一定地

sentences.english: It invariably rains when I go there.
sentences.chinese: 我每次去那儿都下雨。

sentences.english: The security guards were invariably ex-servicemen.
sentences.chinese: 保安人员毫无例外地都是退伍军人。

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: foundation
trans: n. 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

name: fund
trans: n. 基金；资金；存款,vt. 投资；资助

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则,adj. 基本的，根本的

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

name: position
trans: n. 位置，方位；职位，工作；姿态；站位,vt. 安置；把……放在适当位置

sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

name: compose

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

name: composer
trans: n. 作曲家；作家，著作者；设计者

sentences.english: ...music by Strauss, Mozart, Beethoven, and other great composers.
sentences.chinese: …施特劳斯、莫扎特、贝多芬及其他伟大作曲家创作的音乐。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes music

name: composition
trans: n. 作文，作曲，作品； 构成；合成物；成分

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

name: composure
trans: n. 镇静；沉着

sentences.english: He has lost his composure under the pressure of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他不堪形势的压力，失去了冷静。

detailed_translations.english: the state of feeling or seeming calm

name: deposit
trans: n. 存款；押金；订金；保证金；沉淀物,vt. 使沉积；存放,vi. 沉淀

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: dispose
trans: n. 处置；性情,vi. 处理；安排；（能够）决定,vt. 处理；处置；安排

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

name: disposition
trans: n. 处置； 性情； 部署；倾向

sentences.english: The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性格；排列,部署；倾向,意向
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

name: disposal
trans: n. 处理；支配；清理；安排

sentences.english: bomb disposal experts
sentences.chinese: 拆弹专家

detailed_translations.english: when you get rid of something

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: impose
trans: vt. 强加；征税；以…欺骗,vi. 利用；欺骗；施加影响

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: oppose
trans: vt. 反对；对抗，抗争,vi. 反对

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: pose
trans: vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作,vt. 造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论,n. 姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: preposition
trans: n. 介词；前置词

sentences.english: There is nothing in the rules of grammar to suggest that ending a sentence with a preposition is wrong.
sentences.chinese: 在语法规则中没有哪一条表明以介词结束一个句子是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: a word that is used before a noun,  pronoun  , or  gerund  to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.

name: propose
trans: vi. 建议；求婚；打算,vt. 建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: proposal
trans: n. 提议，建议；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: proposition
trans: n.  命题；提议；主题；议题,vt. 向…提议；向…求欢

sentences.english: He telephoned Stuart with a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 他打电话给斯图尔特提了个建议。

sentences.english: I’ve got a proposition to put to you.
sentences.chinese: 我要向你提个建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion, or something that is suggested or considered as a possible thing to do
to suggest to someone that they have sex with you

name: purpose
trans: n. 目的；用途；意志,vt. 决心；企图；打算

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: component
trans: n. 成分；组件； 元件,adj. 组成的，构成的

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手；反对者；敌手,adj. 对立的；敌对的

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: postpone
trans: vt. 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面,vi. 延缓，延迟；延缓发作

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: postponement
trans: n. 延期；延缓

name: compound
trans: n.  化合物；混合物；复合词,adj. 复合的；混合的,v. 合成；混合；恶化，加重；和解，妥协

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: office
trans: n. 办公室；政府机关；官职；营业处

sentences.english: The department occupies an office just a mile from the White House.
sentences.chinese: 该部门就在离白宫一英里远的地方有个办公楼。

sentences.english: Did you go to the office (= the office where you work ) today?
sentences.chinese: 今天你去办公室了吗？

sentences.english: the increased demand for office space
sentences.chinese: 对办公室空间日益增长的需求

sentences.english: the Foreign Office
sentences.chinese: 外交部

detailed_translations.english: a building that belongs to a company or organization, with rooms where people can work at desks

name: efficient
trans: adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: efficiency
trans: n. 效率；效能；功效

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: proficient
trans: n. 精通；专家，能手,adj. 熟练的，精通的

sentences.english: a proficient typist
sentences.chinese: 熟练的打字员

detailed_translations.english: able to do something well or skilfully

name: proficiency
trans: n. 精通，熟练

sentences.english: I brought her proficiency up to the required level.
sentences.chinese: 我把她的熟练程度提高到所规定的水平。

sentences.english: With study and practice, almost anyone can do it with some level of proficiency, but most people don't learn how to think critically or analytically—nor are they even aware of its value.
sentences.chinese: 通过学习和实践，几乎任何人都能以不同的熟练程度来掌握它，但是大多数人都不会去学习如何进行批判性或分析性思维，或者说，他们根本意识不到其价值。

sentences.english: How do you think of your proficiency in written and spoken English?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你的书面 英语和 口语熟练程度如何？

detailed_translations.english: a good standard of ability and skill

name: sufficient
trans: adj. 足够的；充分的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: sufficiency
trans: n. 足量，充足；自满

sentences.english: The war has affected the country’s economic sufficiency.
sentences.chinese: 战争已经影响到了这个国家的经济富足。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being or having enough

name: deficient
trans: adj. 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的

sentences.english: Women who are dieting can become iron deficient.
sentences.chinese: 节食的女性有可能缺铁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的
detailed_translations.english: not containing or having enough of something

name: deficiency
trans: n. 缺陷，缺点；缺乏；不足的数额

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

name: deficit
trans: n. 赤字；不足额

sentences.english: the country’s widening budget deficit
sentences.chinese: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字

sentences.english: the US’s foreign trade deficit
sentences.chinese: 美国的对外贸易逆差

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

name: benefit
trans: n. 利益，好处；救济金,vt. 有益于，对…有益,vi. 受益，得益

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: profit
trans: n. 利润；利益,vt. 有益于,vi. 获利；有益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的；赚钱的；有益的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的；可能的；可实行的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: feature
trans: n. 特色，特征；容貌；特写或专题节目,vt. 特写；以…为特色；由…主演,vi. 起重要作用

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: depend
trans: vi. 依赖，依靠；取决于；相信，信赖

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

detailed_translations.english: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

name: dependent
trans: n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者,adj. 依靠的；从属的；取决于…的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: dependence
trans: n. 依赖；依靠；信任；信赖

sentences.english: ...the city's traditional dependence on tourism.
sentences.chinese: …这个城市对旅游业的传统依赖。

detailed_translations.english: when you depend on the help and support of someone or something else in order to exist or be successful

name: independent
trans: n. 独立自主者；无党派者,adj. 独立的；单独的；无党派的；不受约束的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: independently
trans: adv. 独立地；自立地

sentences.english: In each of these cases, one of the models evolved independently of the other.
sentences.chinese: 在这里的每种情况下，其中一个模型独立于另一个模型而发展。

sentences.english: Service each copy independently: You can update one copy without affecting any of the other ones.
sentences.chinese: 独立维护每个副本： 可以独立更新某一个副本，而不影响其他的副本。

sentences.english: We have two motors, one on each rear wheel, so the control system has to control each motor independently.
sentences.chinese: 而且我们有两个，每一个后轮都有一个，说以控制系统必须独立地控制每一个电机。

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: economy
trans: n. 经济；节约；理财

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: economist
trans: n. 经济学者；节俭的人

sentences.english: This led me, as a behavioral economist, to an intriguing hypothesis.
sentences.chinese: 这让我，作为一个行为经济学家，想到一个有趣的假设。

sentences.english: However, the economist cannot simply give those answers and leave it at that.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经济学家不能仅仅给出那样的答案就算了事。

sentences.english: Make sail: Define and explain an idea, it is economist commonly or Mr. MBA does.
sentences.chinese: 张帆： 定义和解释一个概念，一般是经济学家或者MBA老师做的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies the way in which money and goods are produced and used and the systems of business and trade

name: economics
trans: n. 经济学；国家的经济状况

sentences.english: a Harvard professor of economics
sentences.chinese: 哈佛大学的经济学教授

detailed_translations.english: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used

name: economic
trans: adj. 经济的，经济上的；经济学的

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

name: economical
trans: adj. 经济的；节约的；合算的

sentences.english: A small car is more economical to run.
sentences.chinese: 开小型汽车比较省油。

sentences.english: good-quality clothes at economical prices
sentences.chinese: 物美价廉的衣服

detailed_translations.english: using money, time, goods etc carefully and without wasting any

name: maintain
trans: vt. 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: maintenance
trans: n. 维护，维修；保持；生活费用

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

name: retain
trans: vt. 保持；雇；记住

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: retention
trans: n. 保留；扣留，滞留；记忆力；闭尿

sentences.english: Many people with heart problems suffer from fluid retention.
sentences.chinese: 很多有心脏病的人都有体液潴留。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保留；扣留，滞留；记忆力；闭尿
detailed_translations.english: the act of keeping something

name: sustain
trans: vt. 维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: sustainable
trans: adj. 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

name: religion
trans: n. 宗教；宗教信仰

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: n. 修道士；尼姑,adj. 宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；修道的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: liable
trans: adj. 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: oblige
trans: vt. 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成；义务,vi. 帮忙；施恩惠

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: obligation
trans: n. 义务；职责；债务

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: collapse
trans: n. 倒塌；失败；衰竭,vt. 使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠,vi. 倒塌；瓦解；暴跌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作；勾结，通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: context
trans: n. 环境；上下文；来龙去脉

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: confine
trans: n. 界限，边界;约束；限制,vt. 限制；禁闭

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: derive
trans: vt. 源于；得自；获得,vi. 起源

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: detail
trans: n. 细节，详情,vt. 详述；选派,vi. 画详图

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: decay
trans: n. 衰退， 衰减；腐烂，腐朽,vt. 使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落,vi. 衰退， 衰减；腐烂，腐朽

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: emerge
trans: vi. 浮现；摆脱；暴露

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: exert
trans: vt. 运用，发挥；施以影响

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: ingredient
trans: n. 原料；要素；组成部分,adj. 构成组成部分的

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: inherit
trans: vt. 继承；遗传而得,vi. 成为继承人

sentences.english: inherited wealth
sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: innovate
trans: vi. 创新；改革；革新,vt. 改变；创立；创始；引人

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

name: innovation
trans: n. 创新，革新；新方法

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: intrude
trans: vi. 闯入；侵入；侵扰,vt. 把…强加；把…硬挤

sentences.english: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

name: illusion
trans: n. 幻觉，错觉；错误的观念或信仰

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: infant
trans: n. 婴儿；幼儿；未成年人,adj. 婴儿的；幼稚的；初期的；未成年的

sentences.english: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的皮肤非常敏感。

sentences.english: infant formula milk
sentences.chinese: 婴(幼)儿配方奶

detailed_translations.english: a baby or very young child
intended for babies or very young children

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: inevitably
trans: adv. 不可避免地；必然地

sentences.english: The decision will inevitably lead to political tensions.
sentences.chinese: 该决定必然导致政治局势的紧张。

sentences.english: Inevitably, the situation did not please everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况必定不能让所有人都感到满意。

detailed_translations.english: used for saying that something is certain to happen and cannot be avoided

name: insane
trans: adj. 疯狂的；精神病的；极愚蠢的

sentences.english: That’s an insane risk.
sentences.chinese: 那是疯狂的冒险之举。

sentences.english: The whole idea sounds absolutely insane to me.
sentences.chinese: 整个主意在我看来荒谬至极。

sentences.english: Why did you do that? Have you gone insane?
sentences.chinese: 为什么这么做？你疯了吗？

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原,vt. 恢复；修复；归还

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: retail
trans: n. 零售,adj. 零售的,vt. 零售；转述,adv. 以零售方式,vi. 零售

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: renovate
trans: vt. 更新；修复；革新；刷新

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: mass
trans: n. 块，团；群众，民众；大量，众多；质量,adj. 群众的，民众的；大规模的，集中的,vi. 聚集起来，聚集,vt. 使集合

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

name: post
trans: n. 岗位；邮件；标杆,vt. 张贴；公布；邮递；布置,vi. 快速行进

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

name: tear
trans: vi. 流泪, 撕破,n. 眼泪, （撕破的）洞或裂缝, 撕扯,vt. 撕掉, 扯下, 扰乱

sentences.english: The children were all in tears .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们全都哭了。

sentences.english: She came home in floods of tears .
sentences.chinese: 她泪流满面地回到家里。

sentences.english: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
sentences.chinese: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。

sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

detailed_translations.english: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying

name: cover
trans: n. 封面，封皮；盖子；掩蔽物;幌子，借口,vt. 包括；采访，报导；涉及,vi. 覆盖；代替

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合,vt. 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: fare
trans: n. 票价；费用；旅客；食物,vi. 经营；进展；遭遇；过活

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.chinese: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc

name: tap
trans: n. 水龙头；轻打,vt. 轻敲；轻打；装上嘴子,vi. 轻拍；轻击；轻叩,vt. 采用，利用

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: feed
trans: n. 饲料；饲养；（动物或婴儿的）一餐,vt. 喂养；供给；放牧；抚养（家庭等）；靠…为生,vi. 吃东西；流入

sentences.english: Have you fed the cat?
sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: visit
trans: n. 访问；参观；逗留,vt. 访问；参观；视察,vi. 访问；暂住；闲谈

sentences.english: Eric went to Seattle to visit his cousins.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克到西雅图去看望他的表兄弟。

detailed_translations.english: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

name: visible
trans: n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目,adj. 明显的；看得见的；现有的；可得到的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: vision
trans: n. 视力；美景；眼力；幻象；想象力；幻视（漫威漫画旗下超级英雄）,vt. 想象；显现；梦见

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: visual
trans: adj. 视觉的，视力的；栩栩如生的

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: revise
trans: n. 修订；校订,vi. 修订；校订；复习功课,vt. 修正；复习；校订

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: supervise
trans: vt. 监督，管理；指导,vi. 监督，管理；指导

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

name: vision
trans: n. 视力；美景；眼力；幻象；想象力；幻视（漫威漫画旗下超级英雄）,vt. 想象；显现；梦见

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: devise
trans: n. 遗赠,vt. 设计；想出；发明；图谋；遗赠给

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: device
trans: n. 装置；策略；图案

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: evident
trans: adj. 明显的；明白的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: evidently
trans: adv. 显然，明显地；清楚地

sentences.english: She was evidently a heavy smoker.
sentences.chinese: 她显然烟瘾很大。

sentences.english: He was evidently in pain.
sentences.chinese: 他显然很痛。

sentences.english: She was evidently upset by what she saw.
sentences.chinese: 她显然对所见到的事情感到不快。

sentences.english: Evidently, the builders had finished and gone home early.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，建筑工人干完活后早早回家了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is true because you can see that it is true

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显,vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: provide
trans: vt. 提供；规定；准备；装备,vi. 规定；抚养；作准备

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: provision
trans: n. 规定；条款；准备； 供应品,vt. 供给…食物及必需品

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: provided
trans: conj. 假如；倘若,v. 提供；给予（provide的过去式）

sentences.english: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 只要他付自己的饭钱，就可以跟我们一起来。

name: wise
trans: adj. 明智的；聪明的；博学的,vt. 使知道；教导,vi. 了解

sentences.english: a wise precaution
sentences.chinese: 明智的预防措施

sentences.english: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (= not be a sensible thing to do ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

detailed_translations.english: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: wit
trans: n. 智慧；才智；智力,v. <古>知道；即

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

name: witty
trans: adj. 诙谐的；富于机智的

sentences.english: His plays were very good, very witty.
sentences.chinese: 他的那些剧作非常好，非常诙谐。

detailed_translations.english: Someone or something that is witty is amusing in a clever way

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据,vt. 目击；证明；为…作证,vi. 作证人

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: expect
trans: vi. 期待；预期,vt. 期望；指望；认为；预料

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: expectancy
trans: n. 期望，期待

sentences.english: I saw the look of expectancy in the children’s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我从孩子们的眼神中看到了期盼。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something pleasant or exciting is going to happen

name: expectation
trans: n. 期待；预期；指望

sentences.english: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: unexpected
trans: adj. 意外的，想不到的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: unexpectedly
trans: adv. 出乎意料地，意外地

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面；方向；形势；外貌

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: inspect
trans: vt. 检查；视察；检阅,vi. 进行检查；进行视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图,adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: prospect
trans: n. 前途；预期；景色,vt. 勘探，勘察,vi. 勘探，找矿

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: spectacle
trans: n. 景象；场面；奇观；壮观；公开展示；表相，假相 n.（复）眼镜

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: spectacular
trans: adj. 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的

sentences.english: a mountainous area with spectacular scenery
sentences.chinese: 景色壮丽的山区

sentences.english: a spectacular success
sentences.chinese: 辉煌的成就

sentences.english: a television spectacular
sentences.chinese: 场面盛大的电视节目

detailed_translations.english: very impressive
an event or performance that is very large and impressive

name: suspect
trans: n. 嫌疑犯,adj. 可疑的；不可信的,vi. 怀疑；猜想,vt. 怀疑；猜想

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: speculate
trans: vi. 推测；投机；思索,vt. 推断

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: suspicion
trans: n. 怀疑；嫌疑；疑心；一点儿,vt. 怀疑

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: sight
trans: n. 视力；景象；眼界；见解,adj. 见票即付的；即席的,vt. 看见；瞄准,vi. 瞄准；观看

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

name: foresight
trans: n. 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑

sentences.english: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
sentences.chinese: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑
detailed_translations.english: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力；洞悉

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: sightseeing
trans: n. 观光；游览,v. 观光（sightsee的ing形式）；游览,adj. 观光的；游览的

sentences.english: She swam and sunbathed, went sightseeing and relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 她游泳，晒日光浴，观光，放松。

detailed_translations.english: when you visit famous or interesting places, especially as tourists

name: command
trans: n. 指挥，控制；命令；司令部,vt. 命令，指挥；控制；远望,vi. 命令，指挥；控制

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: commander
trans: n. 指挥官；司令官

sentences.english: the American Commander, General Otis
sentences.chinese: 美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.english: our platoon commander
sentences.chinese: 我们的排长

detailed_translations.english: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

name: demand
trans: n.  需求；要求；需要,vt. 要求；需要；查询,vi. 需要；请求；查问

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

name: demanding
trans: v. 要求；查问（demand的ing形式）,adj. 苛求的；要求高的；吃力的

sentences.english: a demanding job
sentences.chinese: 高要求的工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 苛求的；要求高的；吃力的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of ability, effort, or skill

name: form
trans: n. 形式，形状；形态，外形；方式；表格,vt. 构成，组成；排列，组织；产生，塑造,vi. 形成，构成；排列

sentences.english: We oppose racism in all its forms.
sentences.chinese: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

sentences.english: The female form is a thing of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 女性形体是一种美。

sentences.english: The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。

detailed_translations.english: the way something is or appears to be
to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process

name: conform
trans: adj. 一致的；顺从的,vi. 符合；遵照；适应环境,vt. 使遵守；使一致；使顺从

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: formal
trans: n. 正式的社交活动；夜礼服,adj. 正式的；拘谨的；有条理的

sentences.english: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.chinese: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.english: a formal agreement between the countries
sentences.chinese: 两国间的正式协议

sentences.english: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.chinese: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

detailed_translations.english: made or done officially or publicly

name: format
trans: n. 格式；版式；开本,vt. 使格式化；规定…的格式,vi. 设计版式

sentences.english: The courses were run to a consistent format.
sentences.chinese: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计，安排；格式，样式，版式
detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged
to organize the space on a computer  disk  so that information can be stored on it

name: formation
trans: n. 形成；构造；编队

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: formula
trans: n.  公式，准则；配方；婴儿食品

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

name: formulate
trans: vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

name: perform
trans: vt. 执行；完成；演奏,vi. 执行，机器运转；表演

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: performer
trans: n. 演出者；执行者；演奏者

sentences.english: circus performers
sentences.chinese: 马戏演员

sentences.english: He was a better songwriter than performer.
sentences.chinese: 他更擅长写歌，而不是演唱。

detailed_translations.english: an actor, musician etc who performs to entertain people

name: performance
trans: n. 性能；绩效；表演；执行；表现

sentences.english: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的演出8点开始。

sentences.english: the performance of his official duties
sentences.chinese: 履行他的职务

sentences.english: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。

detailed_translations.english: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

name: reform
trans: n. 改革，改良；改正,adj. 改革的；改革教会的,vt. 改革，革新；重新组成,vi. 重组；改过

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变，使…变形；转换,vi. 变换，改变；转化

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: uniform
trans: n. 制服,adj. 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的,vt. 使穿制服；使成一样

sentences.english: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的
detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料；知识；情报；通知

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: inform
trans: vi. 告发；告密,vt. 通知；告诉；报告

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: strain
trans: n. 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘,vt. 拉紧；滥用；滤去；竭力,vi. 拉紧；尽力,n. （植物、动物的）品种；种类

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: constrain
trans: vt. 驱使；强迫；束缚

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: constraint
trans: n.  约束；局促，态度不自然；强制

sentences.english: the constraints of family life
sentences.chinese: 家庭生活的约束

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制
detailed_translations.english: something that limits your freedom to do what you want

name: restrain
trans: vt. 抑制，控制；约束；制止

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: restraint
trans: n. 抑制，克制；约束

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

name: strict
trans: adj. 严格的；绝对的；精确的；详细的

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

name: restrict
trans: vt. 限制；约束；限定

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: restricted
trans: v. 限制（restrict的过去式和过去分词）,adj. 受限制的；保密的

name: restriction
trans: n. 限制；约束；束缚

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: centre
trans: n. 中心,adj. 中央的,vt. 集中；将…放在中央,vi. 以…为中心

sentences.english: lines radiating out from the centre
sentences.chinese: 从中心向外辐射的线条

sentences.english: chocolates with soft centres
sentences.chinese: 软夹心巧克力

sentences.english: The title isn’t quite centred on the page, is it?
sentences.chinese: 标题并不在这页的正中间，是吗？

detailed_translations.english: the middle of a space, area, or object, especially the exact middle
to move something to a position at the centre of something else

name: center
trans: n. 中心，中央；中锋；中心点,adj. 中央的，位在正中的,vt. 集中，使聚集在一点；定中心,vi. 居中，被置于中心

sentences.english: In this example, you rotate a square on its center, but do not fill the square.
sentences.chinese: 在这个例子中，您会以中心为原点旋转一个正方形，但不填充这个正方形。

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆心， 正中； 中心

name: central
trans: n. 电话总机,adj. 中心的；主要的；中枢的

sentences.english: He lives in central London.
sentences.chinese: 他住在伦敦市中心。

sentences.english: The roof is supported by a central column.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶由一根中心柱支撑着。

sentences.english: Owen played a central role in the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 欧文在谈判中担任了重要角色。

detailed_translations.english: in the middle of an area or an object

name: concentrate
trans: n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液,vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集,vt. 集中；浓缩

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: concentration
trans: n. 浓度；集中；浓缩；专心；集合

sentences.english: She needed all her powers of concentration to stop herself from slipping on the icy road.
sentences.chinese: 她需要集中全部注意力才能不让自己在结冰的路上滑倒。

sentences.english: Lack of concentration was a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 注意力不集中是个大问题。

sentences.english: I lost my concentration and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我精神一放松就睡着了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中； 专注， 专心； 浓缩； 浓度
detailed_translations.english: the ability to think about something carefully or for a long time

name: normal
trans: adj. 正常的；正规的，标准的,n. 正常；标准；常态

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: abnormal
trans: adj. 反常的，不规则的；变态的

sentences.english: abnormal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 反常行为

sentences.english: an abnormal level of cholesterol
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇水平异常

sentences.english: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
sentences.chinese: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

detailed_translations.english: very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous

name: norm
trans: n. 标准，规范

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: enormous
trans: adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: line
trans: n. 路线，航线；排；绳,vt. 排成一行；划线于；以线条标示；使…起皱纹,vi. 排队；站成一排

sentences.english: Draw a straight line across the top of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在这一页的上方画一条直线。

sentences.english: Sign your name on the dotted line (= line made up of a series of dots ).
sentences.chinese: 在虚线上签名。

sentences.english: The edges of the pitch are marked by white lines.
sentences.chinese: 球场的四边画着白线。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper just managed to stop the ball going over the line.
sentences.chinese: 守门员刚好把球截住，没有让它越过球门线。

sentences.english: He raced towards the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 他朝终点线冲刺。

sentences.english: The four men were standing in a line on the other side of the table.
sentences.chinese: 那四个男人在桌子的另一边站成一排。

sentences.english: Light travels in a straight line.
sentences.chinese: 光沿直线传播。

sentences.english: A boat came into my line of vision (= direction I was looking in ).
sentences.chinese: 一艘船进入了我的视线。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin mark on a piece of paper, the ground, or another surface

name: deadline
trans: n. 截止期限，最后期限

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: guideline
trans: n. 指导方针,参考

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: headline
trans: n. 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻,vt. 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

name: online
trans: adj. 联机的；在线的,adv. 在线地

sentences.english: All the city’s schools will be online by the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 到年底，市里的所有学校都会连接因特网。

sentences.english: ...the cool stuff you find online.
sentences.chinese: …你在网上找到的好东西。

detailed_translations.english: connected to other computers through the Internet, or available through the Internet
While connected to a computer or under computer control.

name: outline
trans: n. 轮廓；大纲；概要；略图,vt. 概述；略述；描画…轮廓

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

name: skyline
trans: n. 地平线；空中轮廓线；架空索,vt. 天空映衬出…的轮廓

sentences.english: the famous New York skyline
sentences.chinese: 著名的纽约天际线

detailed_translations.chinese: 地平线；空中轮廓线；架空索
detailed_translations.english: the shape made by hills or buildings against the sky

name: underline
trans: n. 下划线；下期节目预告,vt. 强调；在…下面划线；预告

sentences.english: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
sentences.chinese: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important

name: file
trans: n. 文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀,vt. 提出；锉；琢磨；把…归档,vi. 列队行进；用锉刀锉

sentences.english: We will keep your details on file (= store them for later use ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.english: The contracts are filed alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject
to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

name: profile
trans: n. 侧面；轮廓；外形；剖面；简况,vt. 描…的轮廓；扼要描述,vi. 给出轮廓

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: under
trans: prep. 低于，少于；在...之下,adj. 下面的；从属的,adv. 在下面；在下方

sentences.english: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。

sentences.english: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
sentences.chinese: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。

sentences.english: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
sentences.chinese: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

sentences.english: He took a deep breath before he went under.
sentences.chinese: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。

detailed_translations.english: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

name: underestimate
trans: n. 低估,vt. 低估；看轻

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历，经受；忍受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: undergraduate

sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

name: technical
trans: adj. 工艺的，科技的；技术上的；专门的

sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

name: technician
trans: n. 技师，技术员；技巧纯熟的人

sentences.chinese: 医院技术人员

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: technological
trans: adj. 技术的；工艺的

sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

detailed_translations.english: related to technology

trans: n. 技术专家；工艺学家

sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

sentences.chinese: 对于每一个参数化问题的近似结果，这个程序也会显示误差的边界。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动

living

sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

name: dictionary

sentences.chinese: 一本德英词典

detailed_translations.english: the choice and use of words and phrases to express meaning, especially in literature

sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
