detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: perfection
trans: n. 完善；完美

sentences.chinese: 父亲期望我们都尽善尽美。

sentences.english: the search for technical perfection

detailed_translations.english: the state of being perfect

trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；不足之处,vi. 变节；叛变

sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

name: defection
trans: n. 背叛；缺点；变节；脱党

name: infect
trans: vt. 感染，传染

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: factory
trans: n. 工厂；制造厂；代理店

sentences.english: a car factory
sentences.chinese: 汽车制造厂

sentences.english: factory workers
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人

detailed_translations.english: a building or group of buildings in which goods are produced in large quantities, using machines

name: manufacture
trans: n. 制造；产品；制造业,vt. 制造；加工；捏造,vi. 制造

sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

trans: n. 制造商； 厂商

sentences.chinese: 使用新洗碗机之前，请先阅读厂家的说明书。

sentences.english: The fridge was sent back to the manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 那台冰箱被退还给厂家了。

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴；连队,vt. 陪伴,vi. 交往

sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

trans: vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏,vi. 伴奏，伴唱

sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

trans: n. 同伴；朋友；指南；手册,vt. 陪伴

sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion

sentences.chinese: 炒锅

sentences.chinese: 锅碗瓢盆

sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放在一大锅开水里煮。

sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.chinese: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

sentences.chinese: 每月新闻摘要

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: registered
trans: adj. 注册的；记名的；登记过的；（家畜等）附有血统证明的

sentences.english: He asked his mother to send it by registered mail.
sentences.chinese: 他让他妈妈用挂号邮件寄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 已登记的； 已注册的； 挂号的
detailed_translations.english: A registered letter or package is sent by a special postal service, for which you pay extra money for insurance in case it gets lost

name: registration
trans: n. 登记；注册；挂号

sentences.english: Student registration (= for a course of study ) starts the first week in September.
sentences.chinese: 学生注册在9月份的第一个星期开始。

sentences.english: The registration fee is $75.
sentences.chinese: 注册费是75美元。

detailed_translations.english: the act of recording names and details on an official list

name: second
trans: num. 第二,n. 秒；第二名；瞬间；二等品,adj. 第二的；次要的；附加的,vt. 支持,adv. 第二；其次；居第二位

sentences.english: Any proposal must be seconded by two other members of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 任何提案须有委员会其他两位委员附议。

name: secondary
trans: n. 副手；代理人,adj. 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的

sentences.chinese: 这本小说中的次要人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as something else

name: second
trans: num. 第二,n. 秒；第二名；瞬间；二等品,adj. 第二的；次要的；附加的,vt. 支持,adv. 第二；其次；居第二位

sentences.english: Any proposal must be seconded by two other members of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 任何提案须有委员会其他两位委员附议。

detailed_translations.english: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting

name: consecutive
trans: adj. 连贯的；连续不断的

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: execute
trans: vt. 实行；执行；处死

sentences.english: 13 people were summarily executed (= killed without any trial or legal process ) by the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 有13人被游击队员就地处决。

sentences.english: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作包括拟订和实施一个护理计划。

detailed_translations.english: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

name: execution
trans: n. 执行，实行；完成；死刑

sentences.english: a public execution
sentences.chinese: 当众处死

sentences.english: The two men face execution (= They will be killed as a punishment ).
sentences.chinese: 两名男子面临处决。

sentences.english: Torture and summary execution (= execution without a trial or any legal process ) are common.
sentences.chinese: 严刑拷打和不经审判就地处决相当普遍。

sentences.english: He was granted a stay of execution (= delay in carrying out an execution ).
sentences.chinese: 他被准予缓期处决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 死刑； 实行， 执行， 履行； 演奏， 表演
detailed_translations.english: when someone is killed, especially as a legal punishment

name: executive
trans: n. 总经理；执行委员会；执行者；经理主管人员,adj. 行政的；经营的；执行的，经营管理的

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

sentences.chinese: 如果我们的论述中有如果,我们在主张先行词，假设条件句或者结果，然后从句，或者我们说如果P那么。

sentences.english: the flag of Kenya

sentences.english: the Spanish flag
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国旗

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

trans: vt. 发动革命；彻底改革；宣传革命,vi. 革命化；从事革命

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.

trans: vt. 使彻底变革

name: revolutionary
trans: n. 革命者,adj. 革命的；旋转的；大变革的

sentences.english: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

detailed_translations.english: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

trans: n. 反抗；叛乱；反感,vt. 使反感；使恶心,vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

name: revolve
trans: n. 旋转；循环；旋转舞台,vt. 使…旋转；使…循环；反复考虑,vi. 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑

sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

name: evolve
trans: vi. 发展，进展；进化；逐步形成,vt. 发展，进化；进化；使逐步形成；推断出

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: evolution
trans: n. 演变；进化论；进展

sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

trans: vt. 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于

sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

sentences.chinese: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

trans: v. 涉及；使参与；包含（involve的过去式和过去分词）,adj. 有关的；卷入的；复杂的

sentences.english: The plot was so involved that very few people knew what was going on.
sentences.chinese: 情节太复杂，几乎没人知道是怎么回事。

trans: n. 量；体积；卷；音量；大量；册,adj. 大量的,vt. 把…收集成卷,vi. 成团卷起

sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

trans: n. 一般概念；普通性,adj. 普遍的；通用的；宇宙的；全世界的；全体的

sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

trans: vt. 通知；为…做广告；使突出,vi. 做广告，登广告；作宣传

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

sentences.chinese: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事，出高薪寻找合适的人选。

sentences.chinese: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
sentences.chinese: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

trans: n. 周年纪念日

sentences.chinese: 1月，杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

name: convert
trans: n. 皈依者；改变宗教信仰者,vt. 使转变；转换…；使…改变信仰,vi. 转变，变换；皈依；改变信仰

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败,adj. 反面的；颠倒的；反身的,vt. 颠倒；倒转,vi. 倒退；逆叫

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

trans: n. 逆行，逆向；倒；相反的事物,adj. 相反的，逆向的；颠倒的,vi. 交谈，谈话；认识,n. 匡威（服装品牌）

sentences.english: It lets me converse with the distinct voices of my past and quilt together a narrative about movement in place.
sentences.chinese: 它让我能够用可以彰显我的过去的独特声音与人交谈，并拼凑出一通有关地点变换的叙述。

sentences.chinese: 来自外界，来自那些你爱的、与你谈话的、与你团结在一起并告诉你你属于他们的人，只要你将放弃那些恼人的、无法接受的部分。

opposite
the converse of a fact, word, statement etc is the opposite of it

sentences.chinese: 电话交谈

sentences.chinese: 儿童对成年人的谈话很快就会厌倦。

sentences.chinese: 他们用德语说了一会儿，好像对什么事有分歧。

sentences.chinese: 在这么喧闹的环境中进行谈话是不可能的。

sentences.chinese: “你旅途愉快吗？”他问道，试图找话谈。

sentences.chinese: 无论索菲娅怎么引他说话，他就是一声不吭。

sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，话题就转到一个朋友即将举行的婚礼上去了。

sentences.chinese: 他们谈得很投入，很放松，脸上带着微笑。

name: converse
trans: n. 逆行，逆向；倒；相反的事物,adj. 相反的，逆向的；颠倒的,vi. 交谈，谈话；认识,n. 匡威（服装品牌）

sentences.english: It lets me converse with the distinct voices of my past and quilt together a narrative about movement in place.
sentences.chinese: 它让我能够用可以彰显我的过去的独特声音与人交谈，并拼凑出一通有关地点变换的叙述。

sentences.english: From outside, from those who you love, converse, and make community with, telling you that you belong with them, if only you will give up those annoying, unacceptable parts, please.
sentences.chinese: 来自外界，来自那些你爱的、与你谈话的、与你团结在一起并告诉你你属于他们的人，只要你将放弃那些恼人的、无法接受的部分。

opposite
the converse of a fact, word, statement etc is the opposite of it

sentences.chinese: 美国的消费者喜欢白色的鸡蛋，而英国的消费者却相反，他们喜欢棕色的鸡蛋。

sentences.chinese: 纽约尼克斯队对洛杉矶湖人队

sentences.chinese: 最高法院关于罗诉韦德案的判决

sentences.chinese: 他还是以前那个彼得——喜怒无常且爱发火。

sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

trans: n. 装配；集会，集合

sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

trans: n. 相似；相似之处；相似物；肖像

sentences.chinese: 苏珊和她的姐姐十分相像。

sentences.chinese: 他们来了就告诉我。

sentences.english: Can you come here for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 你到这里来一会儿好吗？

sentences.english: Come a bit closer and you’ll be able to see better.
sentences.chinese: 靠近一些就能看得更清楚。

sentences.english: What time will you be coming home ?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候能回家？

trans: n. 收入，收益；所得

sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

name: prevent

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

name: convene
trans: vt. 召集，集合；传唤,vi. 聚集，集合

sentences.english: a report by experts convened by the National Institutes of Health
sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting
if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

name: convention
trans: n. 大会； 惯例； 约定； 协定；习俗

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: conventional
trans: adj. 符合习俗的，传统的；常见的；惯例的

sentences.english: Internet connections through conventional phone lines are fairly slow.
sentences.chinese: 通过传统的电话线来连接因特网速度很慢。

sentences.english: Bake for 20 minutes in a conventional oven; 8 in a microwave.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的烤炉中烘烤20分钟，在微波炉里则烤8分钟。

name: avenue

sentences.chinese: 第五大街

sentences.english: Shaftesbury Avenue
sentences.chinese: 沙夫茨伯里街

sentences.english: a tree-lined avenue
sentences.chinese: 林荫道

detailed_translations.english: used in the names of streets in a town or city

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: compute

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

name: dispute
trans: n. 辩论；争吵,vt. 辩论；怀疑；阻止；抗拒,vi. 争论

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: deputy
trans: n. 代理人，代表,adj. 副的；代理的

sentences.english: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副职， 副手； 代表， 代理人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: adopt
trans: vi. 采取；过继,vt. 采取；接受；收养；正式通过

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: opt
trans: vi. 选择

sentences.english: Depending on your circumstances you can opt for one method or the other.
sentences.chinese: 根据自己的情况，你可以选择这种或那种方法。

detailed_translations.english: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another

name: option
trans: n.  选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: optional
trans: adj. 可选择的，随意的,n. 选修科目

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: optimism
trans: n. 乐观；乐观主义

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: patient
trans: n. 病人；患者,adj. 有耐心的，能容忍的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: patience
trans: n. 耐性，耐心；忍耐，容忍

sentences.english: He doesn't have the patience to wait.
sentences.chinese: 他没有耐心等。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or sth annoying without complaining

name: impatient
trans: adj. 焦躁的；不耐心的

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: inpatient
trans: n. 住院病人,住院的

name: compatible
trans: adj. 兼容的；能共处的；可并立的

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: bar
trans: n. 条，棒；酒吧；障碍；法庭,prep. 除……外,vt. 禁止；阻拦

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: barrel
trans: n. 桶；枪管，炮管,vt. 把……装入桶内,vi. 快速移动

sentences.english: The wine is aged in oak barrels.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒是用橡木酒桶放陈的。

detailed_translations.english: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线,vt. 把…关入栅栏

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: embarrass
trans: vt. 使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: embarrassing
trans: adj. 使人尴尬的；令人为难的

sentences.english: She asked a lot of embarrassing questions.
sentences.chinese: 她问了许多令人尴尬的问题。

sentences.english: an embarrassing situation
sentences.chinese: 令人难堪的处境

detailed_translations.chinese: 使人尴尬的；令人为难的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable

name: value
trans: n. 值；价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义,vt. 评价；重视；估价

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: valuable
trans: n. 贵重物品,adj. 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的

name: invaluable
trans: adj. 无价的；非常贵重的

sentences.english: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
sentences.chinese: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常宝贵的， 极为贵重的， 无价的
detailed_translations.english: extremely useful

name: evaluate
trans: vt. 评价；估价；求…的值,vi. 评价；估价

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: equivalent
trans: n. 等价物，相等物,adj. 等价的，相等的；同意义的

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: valid
trans: adj. 有效的；有根据的；合法的；正当的

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: invalid
trans: n. 病人；残疾者,adj. 无效的；有病的；残疾的,vt. 使伤残；使退役,vi. 变得病弱；因病而奉命退役

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: available
trans: adj. 可获得的；可购得的；可找到的；有空的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: prevail
trans: vi. 盛行，流行；战胜，获胜

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

name: press
trans: n. 压；按；新闻；出版社； 印刷机,vt. 压；按；逼迫；紧抱,vi. 压；逼；重压

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫， 压强,vt. 迫使；密封；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: compress
trans: vt. 压缩，压紧；精简,vi. 受压缩小

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: compression
trans: n. 压缩，浓缩；压榨，压迫

sentences.english: The following example shows how to create partition table with compression.
sentences.chinese: 下面的例子展示如何创建采用压缩的分区表。

sentences.english: Custom programming of every compression is not always desirable or possible.
sentences.chinese: 但是，每次压缩定制编程并非总是值得或可能的。

sentences.english: If so, they still generate a compression dictionary, but in this case, there is no compressed record, as all data has already been moved into the table.
sentences.chinese: 如果有，那么它们仍然生成一个压缩字典，但是在这里，没有被压缩的记录，因为所有数据已经被移到表中。

name: depress
trans: vt. 压抑；使沮丧；使萧条

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: impress
trans: n. 印象，印记；特征，痕迹,vi. 给人印象,vt. 盖印；强征；传送；给予某人深刻印象

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想；曝光（衡量广告被显示的次数。打开一个带有该广告的网页，则该广告的impression 次数增加一次）

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: impressive
trans: adj. 感人的；令人钦佩的；给人以深刻印象的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: express
trans: n. 快车，快递，专使；捷运公司,vt. 表达；快递,adj. 明确的；迅速的；专门的

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: interrupt
trans: n. 中断,vt. 中断；打断；插嘴；妨碍,vi. 打断；打扰

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: abrupt
trans: adj. 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: bankrupt
trans: n.  破产者,adj. 破产的,vt. 使破产

sentences.english: The firm went bankrupt before the building work was completed.
sentences.chinese: 建筑工程尚未竣工，公司就破产了。

sentences.english: In 1977 he was declared bankrupt (=  by a court  ) .
sentences.chinese: 1977年，他被宣布破产。

sentences.english: Mr Trent lost his house when he was made bankrupt .
sentences.chinese: 特伦特先生破产以后房子也没有了。

sentences.english: Seventeen years of war left the country bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 17年的战争把国家耗空了。

sentences.english: a bankrupt electrical company
sentences.chinese: 一家破产的电力公司

sentences.english: The move to the market nearly bankrupted the firm and its director.
sentences.chinese: 走向市场的行动几乎使这家公司及其董事破产。

sentences.english: Johns had been nearly bankrupted through a failed business venture.
sentences.chinese: 约翰斯因为商业投资失败几近破产。

sentences.english: In total, 80% of bankrupts are men.
sentences.chinese: 总体来看，有80%的破产者为男性。

detailed_translations.english: without enough money to pay what you owe
To bankrupt a person or organization means to make them go bankrupt
someone who has officially said that they cannot pay their debts

name: bankruptcy
trans: n. 破产

sentences.english: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 1999年他被披露几近破产。

sentences.english: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀加剧，破产个案也会增加。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to pay your debts

name: corrupt
trans: adj. 腐败的，贪污的；堕落的,vt. 使腐烂；使堕落，使恶化,vi. 堕落，腐化；腐烂

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

name: corruption
trans: n. 贪污，腐败；堕落

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

name: disrupt
trans: vt. 破坏；使瓦解；使分裂；使中断；使陷于混乱,adj. 分裂的，中断的；分散的

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: disruption
trans: n. 破坏，毁坏；分裂，瓦解

sentences.english: The strike caused widespread disruption .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成了大规模的混乱。

name: disruptive
trans: adj. 破坏的；分裂性的；制造混乱的

sentences.english: Mike’s parents thought I was a disruptive influence (= a person who causes disruption ) .
sentences.chinese: 迈克的父母认为我是个捣蛋分子。

sentences.english: ways to handle disruptive pupils
sentences.chinese: 对付捣乱学生的办法

detailed_translations.english: causing problems and preventing something from continuing in its usual way

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙,vt. 爆发；喷出

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: eruption
trans: n. 爆发，喷发；火山灰；出疹

sentences.english: The last eruption of this volcano lasted over a year, so this cannot be ruled out.
sentences.chinese: 该火山上次爆发持续了一年，所以现在也不能排除这个可能性。

sentences.english: Our work was like that of geologists who compile the signs of an imminent earthquake or volcanic eruption.
sentences.chinese: 我们的工作如同地质学家，我们收集一场即将到来的地震或火山爆发的迹象。

sentences.english: If a volcanic eruption wipes out all of the plain mice, the island will be repopulated by striped mice.
sentences.chinese: 假设一次火山爆发消灭了所有的普通老鼠，那么这个小岛将是斑纹鼠的天下。

name: cast
trans: n. 投掷，抛；铸件， 铸型；演员阵容；脱落物,vt. 投，抛；计算；浇铸；投射（光、影、视线等）,vi. 投，抛垂钓鱼钩；计算，把几个数字加起来

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

name: broadcast
trans: n. 广播；播音；广播节目,adj. 广播的,vt. 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）,vi. 广播，播送；播放

sentences.english: The interview was broadcast live across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这次采访向整个欧洲进行了现场直播。

detailed_translations.chinese: 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）

a programme on the radio or on television

trans: n. 网络广播；网络直播；网路广播

sentences.chinese: 高中毕业文凭

sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

trans: adj. 外交的；外交上的；老练的

sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

name: multiple
trans: adj. 多重的；多样的；许多的,n. 倍数； 并联

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

name: multiply
trans: vt. 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘,vi. 乘；繁殖；增加,adv. 多样地；复合地,adj. 多层的；多样的

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: therapy
trans: n. 治疗，疗法

sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: therapist
trans: n. 临床医学家；治疗学家

sentences.english: a speech therapist
sentences.chinese: 言语治疗师

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been trained to give a particular form of treatment for physical or mental illness

name: dose
trans: n. 剂量；一剂，一服,vt. 给药；给…服药,vi. 服药

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the use of living things such as cells,  bacteria  etc to make drugs, destroy waste matter etc

name: sore

sentences.chinese: 我喉咙疼，四肢酸痛。

sentences.chinese: 马克还在因为我没邀请他而生气呢。

sentences.chinese: 他们在挨饿，身上长满了疮。

detailed_translations.english: a part of your body that is sore is painful, because of infection or because you have used a muscle too much

trans: n.  细菌

sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

name: cholesterol
trans: n.  胆固醇

sentences.english: So why would you want to lower your cholesterol?
sentences.chinese: 那么为什么你想降低你的胆固醇呢？

sentences.english: If it does, you should discuss with your physician other approaches to cholesterol control.
sentences.chinese: 若确实如此，您应该与您的医生讨论其他控制胆固醇方法。

sentences.english: "In order to prevent this oxidation of cholesterol, we need to consume antioxidants, preferably natural antioxidants that you get from fruits and vegetables, " he said in an interview.
sentences.chinese: “为了防止这种胆固醇氧化，我们需要消耗抗氧化剂，最好是从水果和蔬菜得到的天然抗氧化剂， ”他在接受采访时说道。

trans: n. 肿瘤；肿块；赘生物

sentences.english: The tumor in his prostate gland was caught at an early and very likely curable stage.
sentences.chinese: 由于他的前列腺肿瘤是在早期被发现的，处在很有可能治愈阶段。

trans: n.  瘤；肿瘤；肿块

sentences.english: a brain tumour

detailed_translations.english: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly

sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )

sentences.chinese: 那个衣衫褴褛的人拉著一货车破布碎片.

sentences.english: They mounted in front of the waggon, and Abraham grew reflective.
sentences.chinese: 他们上了车，坐在马车的前面，亚伯拉罕开始沉思起来。

sentences.chinese: 他把那匹小马套上拉蜂箱的马车，代替了王子的位置，往卡斯特桥方向驶去了。

sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

sentences.chinese: 超市购物手推车

sentences.english: Eddie returned to the flight deck (= the part of an aircraft where the pilot sits ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃迪回到了驾驶舱。

sentences.chinese: 地面铺砌过的院子

name: cement

sentences.chinese: 一袋水泥

sentences.english: Most artificial joints are cemented into place.

trans: n. 性格，品质；特性；角色； 字符,vt. 印，刻；使具有特征

sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

trans: n. 工作； 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品,vt. 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进,vi. 工作；运作；起作用

sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

name: work
trans: n. 工作； 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品,vt. 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进,vi. 工作；运作；起作用

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进

name: stick

sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

trans: n. 洪水；泛滥；一大批,vt. 淹没；充满；溢出,vi. 涌出；涌进；为水淹没

sentences.english: The village was cut off by floods.
sentences.chinese: 那个村子因洪水而与外界中断了联系。

sentences.english: the worst floods for over fifty years
sentences.chinese: 五十多年来最严重的水灾

sentences.english: Towns and cities all over the country have been flooded.
sentences.chinese: 全国各地的城镇都被淹没了。

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准,adj. 现在的；出席的,vt. 提出；介绍；呈现；赠送,vi. 举枪瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

trans: vt. 介绍；引进；提出；采用

sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

trans: n. 介绍；引进；采用；入门；传入

sentences.chinese: 皮特，你来作一下介绍吧。

sentences.english: Our first contestant needs no introduction (= everyone already knows the person ).
sentences.chinese: 我们的第一位参赛者就不用介绍了。

sentences.chinese: 约2,000年前佛教传入中国

sentences.english: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
sentences.chinese: 在引言里，他解释了写这本书的原因。

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导

name: misconduct
trans: n. 不端行为；处理不当,vt. 处理不当；行为不检

sentences.chinese: 被指控玩忽职守的医生

sentences.chinese: 他因严重失职被解雇。

sentences.english: She was found guilty of gross misconduct (= very serious misconduct ) .
sentences.chinese: 她被裁定犯有严重失职罪。

trans: n. 导体；售票员；领导者；管理人

sentences.chinese: 他向检票员出示了车票，然后上了车。

sentences.english: The conductor's eyes darted to Wilfred, then fixed on Michael again.
sentences.chinese: 乐队指挥飞快地扫了威尔弗雷德一眼，然后视线又落回到迈克尔身上。

sentences.chinese: 在半导体收音机中晶体管代替了真空管。

sentences.english: What was happening was this: in its pure state of repeating units of one titanium and two oxygen atoms, titanium dioxide is a semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 发生的事是这样的：在纯净的一个钛和两个氧原子组成的重复单位下，二氧化钛是一种半导体。

sentences.english: They can then be printed onto a roll of metal foil that becomes a continuous semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们可以把这种墨水印刷在一卷金属箔上，从而制成连续的半导体。

sentences.chinese: 公司从他的补偿金中扣除了这笔款项。

sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

trans: conj. 一…就,adv. 直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

sentences.chinese: 我们朝湖中央划去。

sentences.english: They spent the middle part of their vacation in Florida.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：假期的中间一段他们是在佛罗里达州度过的。

trans: prep. 在其中，在其间

sentences.chinese: 在一片美国经济疲软的传言中，美元贬值了。

sentences.chinese: 示威者在“处死暴君！”的叫喊声中将国旗撕得粉碎。

sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

trans: n.  中间物；媒介,adj. 中间的，中级的,vi. 起媒介作用

sentences.english: an intermediate coursebook
sentences.chinese: 中级课本

sentences.english: an intermediate stage/step in a process
sentences.chinese: 中间阶段 / 步骤

name: medium
trans: adj. 中间的，中等的；半生熟的,n. 方法；媒体；媒介；中间物

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

name: prince
trans: n. 王子，国君；亲王；贵族

sentences.chinese: 威廉王子

sentences.english: Prince Rainier of Monaco
sentences.chinese: 摩纳哥的兰尼埃亲王

detailed_translations.english: the son of a king, queen, or prince

name: princess
trans: n. 公主；王妃；女巨头

sentences.chinese: 安妮公主

sentences.english: the Princess of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士王妃

detailed_translations.english: a close female relation of a king and queen, especially a daughter

name: principal
trans: adj. 主要的；资本的,n. 首长；校长；资本；当事人

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: rare
trans: adj. 稀有的；稀薄的；半熟的,adj. 杰出的；极度的；非常好的,adv. 非常；极其,vi. 用后腿站起；渴望

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的,adv. 仅仅；几乎不；几乎没有

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: scarcity
trans: n. 不足；缺乏

sentences.english: ...an ever increasing scarcity of water.
sentences.chinese: …越来越匮乏的水资源。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something

name: rarely
trans: adv. 很少地；难得；罕有地

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: scarcely
trans: adv. 几乎不，简直不；简直没有

sentences.english: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。

sentences.english: The country had scarcely any industry.
sentences.chinese: 该国几乎没有工业。

sentences.english: He scarcely ever left the region.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

sentences.english: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他刚坐下就有人敲门。

trans: n.  基因，遗传因子

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

name: genetic
trans: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

name: genius
trans: n. 天才，天赋；精神

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius
sentences.chinese: 天才之作

detailed_translations.english: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

name: gender
trans: n. 性；性别；性交,vt. 生（过去式gendered，过去分词gendered，现在分词gendering，第三人称单数genders，形容词genderless）

sentences.english: people of the same gender
sentences.chinese: 同性别的人

sentences.english: Discrimination on grounds of race or gender is forbidden.
sentences.chinese: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。

sentences.english: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.
sentences.chinese: 对待有偿劳动的态度可能存在着性别差异。

sentences.english: traditional gender roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的性别角色

sentences.english: toys that do not reinforce gender stereotypes
sentences.chinese: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具

sentences.english: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
sentences.chinese: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being male or female

name: genuine
trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: generate
trans: vt. 使形成；发生；生殖；产生物理反应

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: generation
trans: n. 一代；产生；一代人；生殖

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

name: generator
trans: n. 发电机；发生器；生产者

sentences.english: an emergency generator
sentences.chinese: 应急发电机

sentences.english: The company has been a very good cash generator.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是台非常出色的赚钱机器。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that produces electricity

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的，大方的；宽宏大量的；有雅量的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: hydrogen
trans: n.  氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: nitrogen
trans: n.  氮

sentences.english: Well, we know nitrogen has what?
sentences.chinese: 对于氮气我们知道什么？

sentences.english: The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质。

sentences.english: All of these from the group one and two through the group five and six elements, but what about elements, what about molecules like hydrogen, or nitrogen, or maybe oxygen?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是来自于第一主族和第二组主族,到第五主族和第六组主族的悬殊，那么元素呢，比如氢气，氮气或氧气那样的分子呢？

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N

name: oxygen
trans: n.  氧气， 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: pregnant
trans: adj. 怀孕的；富有意义的

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: radio
trans: n. 收音机；无线电广播设备,vt. 用无线电发送,vi. 用无线电进行通信

sentences.english: We’ve lost radio contact with the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们和这架飞机失去了无线电联络。

sentences.english: I sat down and turned on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我坐下来打开收音机。

detailed_translations.english: when messages are sent or received in this way

name: radar
trans: n.  雷达，无线电探测器

sentences.english: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
sentences.chinese: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。

sentences.english: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

name: radiate
trans: adj. 辐射状的，有射线的,vi. 辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展,vt. 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播

sentences.english: He radiated calm confidence.
sentences.chinese: 他身上散发着沉稳自信的气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播
detailed_translations.english: if someone radiates a feeling, or if it radiates from them, it is very easy to see that this is how they feel

name: radiation
trans: n. 辐射；发光；放射物

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

name: radius
trans: n. 半径，半径范围； 桡骨；辐射光线；有效航程

sentences.english: The shock of the explosion was felt over a radius of forty miles.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.english: an area that covers a particular distance in all directions from a central point

name: ray
trans: n. 射线；光线；鳐形目(Rajiformes)鱼,vt. 放射；显出,vi. 放射光线；浮现

sentences.english: The room darkened as a cloud hid the sun’s rays.
sentences.chinese: 一朵云挡住了阳光，房间暗了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射线；光线；【鱼类】鳐形目(Rajiformes)鱼
detailed_translations.english: a straight narrow beam of light from the sun or moon

name: X-ray
trans: 找不到解释

sentences.english: The X-ray showed that her leg was not broken.
sentences.chinese: X光片显示她的腿没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: a beam of radiation1 that can go through solid objects and is used for photographing the inside of the body
to photograph the inside of someone’s body using X-rays

name: radical
trans: n. 基础；激进分子； 原子团； 根数,adj. 激进的；根本的；彻底的

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往,vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: immigrate
trans: vi. 移入,vt. 使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: emigrate
trans: vi. 移居；移居外国,vt. 移民

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: migrant
trans: n. 候鸟；移居者；随季节迁移的民工,adj. 移居的；流浪的

sentences.english: The government divides asylum seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.
sentences.chinese: 政府将寻求政治庇护的人划分为经济移民和真正的难民。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移居者， 移民； 候鸟， 迁移动物
detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: immigrant
trans: n. 移民，侨民,adj. 移民的；迁入的

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: emigrant
trans: n. 移民；侨民,adj. 移民的；移居的

sentences.english: I happened to be a young, unwilling emigrant, yanked from my happy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 当时，我碰巧是个年轻的、不情愿的移民，被从快乐的儿童时代一把拽走。

sentences.english: What attachment can a poor European emigrant have for a country where he had nothing?
sentences.chinese: 一个贫苦的欧洲移民对一个他一无所有的国家会有什麽感情?

sentences.english: I began idly reading verses describing the shore of Ireland as seen by a returning, dying emigrant.
sentences.chinese: 无所事事时，我还开始阅读诗歌，读到一位返乡的爱尔兰移民在垂死时所见的海岸景象。

detailed_translations.english: someone who leaves their own country to live in another

name: horrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；极讨厌的

sentences.english: The weather has been really horrible all week.
sentences.chinese: 整个星期天气都很糟。

sentences.english: a horrible smell
sentences.chinese: 极难闻的气味

sentences.english: The food looked horrible, but it tasted OK.
sentences.chinese: 那食物看上去很糟，可吃起来还不错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人恐惧的， 可怕的； 骇人听闻的； 极讨厌的， 使人不愉快的； 糟透的
detailed_translations.english: very bad - used, for example, about things you see, taste, or smell, or about the weather

name: horror
trans: n. 惊骇；惨状；极端厌恶；令人恐怖的事物

sentences.english: People watched in horror as the plane crashed to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 人们惊恐地看着飞机坠落到地面上。

sentences.english: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.
sentences.chinese: 想到被孤零零地留下，她就不寒而栗。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great shock, fear or disgust

name: terrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；很糟的；令人讨厌的,adv. 很，非常

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: terror
trans: n. 恐怖；恐怖行动；恐怖时期；可怕的人

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

name: terrorist
trans: n. 恐怖主义者，恐怖分子

sentences.english: We refuse to talk to terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

sentences.english: a terrorist bomb that left 168 people dead
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands

name: terribly
trans: adv. 非常；可怕地；极度地

sentences.english: I’m terribly sorry to have kept you waiting.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，让你久等了。

sentences.english: The coach was not terribly worried about his team’s poor performance.
sentences.chinese: 教练对他所执教球队的糟糕表现并不是十分担忧。

detailed_translations.english: very

name: terrific
trans: adj. 极好的；极其的，非常的；可怕的

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 解散；解雇；开除；让...离开；不予理会、不予考虑,vi. 解散

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: missile
trans: n. 导弹；投射物,adj. 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

sentences.english: a nuclear missile
sentences.chinese: 核导弹

sentences.english: a missile attack
sentences.chinese: 导弹袭击

detailed_translations.english: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at

detailed_translations.chinese: 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道,vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: emit
trans: vt. 发出，放射；发行；发表

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: emission
trans: n. （光、热等的）发射，散发；喷射；发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: omit
trans: vt. 省略；遗漏；删除；疏忽

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: omission
trans: n. 疏忽，遗漏；省略；冗长

sentences.english: Copies of the lists were posted so that omissions could be corrected.
sentences.chinese: 多份名单被张贴出来，以便更正遗漏之处。

detailed_translations.english: when you do not include or do not do something

name: submit
trans: vi. 提交；服从,vt. 使服从；主张；呈递

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: submission
trans: n. 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭

sentences.english: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
sentences.chinese: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。

sentences.english: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
sentences.chinese: 计划已起草，要提交给住房委员会。

sentences.english: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
sentences.chinese: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
detailed_translations.english: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve

name: transmit
trans: vt. 传输；传播；发射；传达；遗传,vi. 传输；发射信号

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: transmission
trans: n. 传动装置， 变速器；传递；传送；播送

sentences.english: worldwide data transmission
sentences.chinese: 全球数据传输

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending out electronic signals, messages etc, using radio, television, or other similar equipment

name: set
trans: n.  集合；一套；布景； 装置,adj. 固定的；规定的；固执的,vi. (日,月)落沉；凝固；结果,vt. 树立；点燃；点缀；

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: outset
trans: n. 开始；开端

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: upset
trans: n. 混乱；翻倒；颠覆,adj. 心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的,vt. 使心烦；颠覆；扰乱,vi. 翻倒

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: setback
trans: n. 挫折；退步；逆流

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

name: setting
trans: n. 环境；安装；布置； 沉落,v. 放置；沉没；使…处于某位置（set的ing形式）

sentences.english: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我在许多地方教过孩子，主要是在中学。

sentences.english: The heating system was already on its highest setting.
sentences.chinese: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

name: settle
trans: n. 有背长椅,vi. 解决；定居；沉淀；下陷,vt. 解决；安排；使…定居

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理； 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: point
trans: n. 要点；得分；标点； 尖端,vt. 指向；弄尖；加标点于,vi. 表明；指向

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: checkpoint
trans: n. 检查站，关卡

sentences.english: They had to cross five military checkpoints.
sentences.chinese: 他们得通过五个军事检查站。

detailed_translations.english: a place, especially on a border, where an official person examines vehicles or people

name: viewpoint
trans: n. 观点，看法；视角

sentences.english: Try and think of it from the child’s viewpoint.
sentences.chinese: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

name: appoint
trans: vt. 任命；指定；约定,vi. 任命；委派

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: appointment
trans: n. 任命；约定；任命的职位

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: punctual
trans: adj. 准时的，守时的；精确的

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: punch
trans: n. 冲压机；打洞器；钻孔机,vt. 开洞；以拳重击,vi. 用拳猛击

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: describe
trans: vt. 描述，形容；描绘

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

name: description
trans: n. 描述，描写；类型；说明书

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

name: prescribe
trans: vt. 规定；开处方,vi. 规定；开药方

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: script
trans: n. 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母,vt. 把…改编为剧本,vi. 写电影脚本

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

name: transcript
trans: n. 成绩单；抄本，副本；文字记录

sentences.english: A transcript of this PBS programme is available through our website, pbs.com.
sentences.chinese: 这个公共广播公司节目的文字本可通过我们的网址查阅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成绩单；抄本，副本；文字记录
detailed_translations.english: a written or printed copy of a speech, conversation etc

name: scrape
trans: n. 刮掉；擦痕；困境；刮擦声,vt. 刮；擦伤；挖成,vi. 刮掉；刮出刺耳声

sentences.chinese: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

sentences.english: The two of them scraped their dishes clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

sentences.english: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

sentences.english: the scrape of iron on stone

sentences.chinese: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。

name: case
trans: n. 情况；实例；箱,vt. 包围；把…装于容器中

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

trans: n. 公文包

sentences.chinese: 没有人和我提过什么公文包。

sentences.english: If you ask about my impression on him, I feel he looks like a typical businessman, you know, dark suit and briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问我对他的印象如何，我感觉他看起来像是个典型的商人，你知道，黑西装和公文包的那种。

sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯窥视着房间里的一举一动，只见她从公文包里拿出一个红色的小东西，快速地把它藏在梳妆台最底下的抽屉里。

detailed_translations.english: a flat case used especially by business people for carrying papers or documents

name: cassette
trans: n. 盒式磁带；暗盒；珠宝箱；片匣

sentences.chinese: 他以磁带形式发行的两张专辑已售出1000万份。

detailed_translations.english: a small flat plastic case containing  magnetic tape  , that can be used for playing or recording sound

name: case
trans: n. 情况；实例；箱,vt. 包围；把…装于容器中

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

name: casual
trans: n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵,adj. 随便的；非正式的；临时的；偶然的

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由,vt. 引起，惹起

sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

trans: adj. 偶然的；临时的；特殊场合的

sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的

name: fertile
trans: adj. 富饶的，肥沃的；能生育的

detailed_translations.english: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

name: paddy

sentences.english: ...the paddy fields of China.
sentences.chinese: …中国的稻田。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稻田（复数paddies）；爱尔兰人；Patrick（男子名）和Patricia（女子名）的昵称
detailed_translations.english: a field in which rice is grown in water

name: straw
trans: n. 稻草；吸管；一文不值的东西,adj. 稻草的；无价值的

sentences.english: She sipped her lemonade through a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她用吸管吸着柠檬水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稻草；吸管；一文不值的东西

having little value or substance

trans: n. 犁；耕地（等于plow）,vi. 用犁耕田；开路,vt. 犁；耕

sentences.english: In those days the land was plowed by oxen.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代是用公牛来犁地的。

sentences.english: a ploughed field
sentences.chinese: 犁过的地

a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted

name: irrigate

sentences.english: The water in Lake Powell is used to irrigate the area.
sentences.chinese: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

detailed_translations.english: to supply land or crops with water

name: ditch
trans: n. 沟渠；壕沟,vt. 在…上掘沟；把…开入沟里；丢弃,vi. 开沟；掘沟

sentences.english: The government has ditched plans to privatise the prison.
sentences.chinese: 政府放弃了监狱私有化的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上掘沟；把…开入沟里；丢弃

a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water

name: bud

sentences.english: rose buds
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花苞

to produce buds

name: flock

sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

name: horn
trans: n. 喇叭，号角；角,vt. 装角于
