sentences.chinese: 成年母牛头上长有角。

detailed_translations.english: a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying  gunpowder  etc

name: dew
trans: n. 珠，滴；露水；清新,vt. （露水等）弄湿,vi. 结露水

sentences.english: The dew gathered on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 露水在叶片上聚集。

detailed_translations.english: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night

name: lawn
trans: n. 草地；草坪

sentences.english: I spent all morning mowing the lawn (= cutting the grass ).
sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.english: a carefully tended lawn
sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

name: rack
trans: n.  齿条；架子；拷问台,vt. 折磨；榨取,vi. 变形；随风飘；小步跑

sentences.english: a wine rack
sentences.chinese: 酒架

sentences.english: a magazine rack
sentences.chinese: 杂志架

sentences.english: His already infirm body was racked by high fever.
sentences.chinese: 他已经很孱弱的身体受到高烧的折磨。

detailed_translations.english: a frame or shelf that has bars or hooks on which you can put things

detailed_translations.chinese: 使痛苦， 折磨； 尽力使用
detailed_translations.english: If someone is racked by something such as illness or anxiety, it causes them great suffering or pain

name: liquor
trans: n. 酒，含酒精饮料；溶液；液体；烈酒,vi. 喝酒，灌酒,vt. 使喝醉

sentences.english: The room was filled with cases of liquor.
sentences.chinese: 房间里满是一箱箱的烈性酒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 酒，含酒精饮料；溶液；液体；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky

name: tray
trans: n. 托盘；文件盒；隔底匣；（无线电的）发射箱

sentences.english: The waiter brought drinks on a tray.
sentences.chinese: 服务员用托盘端来饮料。

sentences.english: a cat litter tray
sentences.chinese: 猫砂盘

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of plastic, metal, or wood, with raised edges, used for carrying things such as plates, food etc

name: oven
trans: n. 炉，灶；烤炉，烤箱

sentences.english: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees C.
sentences.chinese: 把烤箱预热至200摄氏度。

sentences.english: Press the mixture onto the bread and bake in a hot oven for ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 把混合料抹在面包上，然后在烤箱内高温烘烤10分钟。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that food is cooked inside, shaped like a metal box with a door on the front

name: sauce
trans: n. 酱油；沙司；调味汁,vt. 使增加趣味；给…调味

sentences.english: spaghetti sauces
sentences.chinese: 意大利面酱

detailed_translations.english: a thick cooked liquid that is served with food to give it a particular taste

name: napkin
trans: n. 餐巾；餐巾纸；尿布

sentences.english: ...taking tiny bites of a hot dog and daintily wiping my lips with a napkin.
sentences.chinese: …小口咬着热狗并用餐巾文雅地擦着我的嘴唇。

detailed_translations.english: a square piece of cloth or paper used for protecting your clothes and for cleaning your hands and lips during a meal

name: lick
trans: vt. 舔；卷过；鞭打,vt. （非正式）战胜,vi. 舔；轻轻拍打,n. 舔；打；少许

sentences.english: The dog jumped up and licked her face.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗跳起来舔她的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to move your tongue across the surface of something in order to eat it, wet it, clean it etc
when you move your tongue across the surface of something

name: mug
trans: n. 杯子；脸；苦读者,vi. 扮鬼脸，做怪相,vt. 行凶抢劫

sentences.english: Something scared him. Probably your ugly mug !
sentences.chinese: 什么东西吓着他了，很可能是你这张丑八怪的脸！

detailed_translations.english: a face
to make silly expressions with your face or behave in a silly way, especially for a photograph or in a play

name: dairy
trans: n. 奶制品；乳牛；制酪场；乳品店；牛奶及乳品业,adj. 乳品的；牛奶的；牛奶制的；产乳的

sentences.english: In my childhood, local dairies bought milk from local farmers.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，本地的乳品公司向当地农场主收购牛奶。

sentences.english: dairy products/produce
sentences.chinese: 乳制品；奶类产品

detailed_translations.english: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made
made from milk

name: shrimp
trans: n. 虾；小虾；矮小的人,adj. 有虾的；虾制的,vi. 捕虾

sentences.english: I also got a microscope set and watched shrimp grow and things like that.
sentences.chinese: 我还得到过一个显微镜，观察小虾的成长和这些类似的事情。

sentences.english: The host generally pays, and no one needs to hear you gripe about appetizer prices or shrimp count.
sentences.chinese: 主人通常都会支付账单，没人想要听到你抱怨关于开胃菜的价格或者小虾的个数。

sentences.english: In summer midnight snack time, if you come across the Baisha street intersection, a big line of persons sitting by the avenue for taste the spicy shrimp .
sentences.chinese: 夏天里消夜时间你如果经过白沙路口就可以看到这儿林荫道上坐了一大排人，没错，他们就是冲着口味虾来的。

detailed_translations.english: a small sea creature that you can eat, which has ten legs and a soft shell

name: chop
trans: n. 砍；排骨；商标；削球,(俚)丑人,vt. 剁碎；砍

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces

name: beverage
trans: n. 饮料

sentences.english: Beer is a beverage of the remotest time.
sentences.chinese: 啤酒是一种最古老的饮料。

sentences.english: And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.
sentences.chinese: 而且不仅仅为了食物，还常常必须有饮料。

sentences.english: In this case, you want to provide the user with a way to say the desired beverage.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，您想为用户提供一种方法，让他们说出自己想要的饮料。

name: snack
trans: n. 小吃，快餐；一份，部分,vi. 吃快餐，吃点心

sentences.english: I grabbed a quick snack.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧吃了点零食。

sentences.english: Drinks and light snacks are served at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧里供应饮料和小吃。

sentences.english: snack foods like crisps and peanuts
sentences.chinese: 炸薯片和花生之类的小吃

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal

name: trash
trans: n. 垃圾；废物,vt. 丢弃；修剪树枝

sentences.english: Will someone take out the trash (= take it outside the house ) ?
sentences.chinese: 谁把垃圾拿出去好吗？

sentences.english: Just put it in the trash .
sentences.chinese: 就把它扔到垃圾桶里吧。

detailed_translations.english: things that you throw away, such as empty bottles, used papers, food that has gone bad etc

name: address
trans: n. 地址；演讲；致辞；说话的技巧；称呼,vt. 演说；从事；忙于；写姓名地址；向…致辞；与…说话；提出；处理

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: point
trans: n. 要点；得分；标点； 尖端,vt. 指向；弄尖；加标点于,vi. 表明；指向

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: fish
trans: n. 鱼，鱼类,vt. 钓鱼，捕鱼；搜寻,vi. 捕鱼，钓鱼；用钩捞取

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝

sentences.english: Dad really loves to fish.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

name: pond
trans: n. 池塘,vt. 筑成池塘,vi. 筑成池塘

sentences.english: The path descends to  the pond.
sentences.chinese: 小路下斜通到池塘。

sentences.english: This pond often catches in winter.
sentences.chinese: 这个池塘在冬天常常结冰。

sentences.english: Wild flowers and grasses rimmed the little pond.
sentences.chinese: 各种野花和野草环绕着这个小池塘。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

name: check
trans: n. <美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对,vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；将一军,vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: attraction
trans: n. 吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

name: draw
trans: n. 平局；抽签,vi. 拉；拖,vt. 画；拉；吸引

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: port
trans: n. 港口，口岸；（计算机的）端口；左舷；舱门,vt. 持（枪）；左转舵,vi. 转向左舷

sentences.english: Britain’s largest port
sentences.chinese: 英国最大的港口城市

detailed_translations.chinese: 港口，口岸；（计算机的）端口；左舷；舱门
detailed_translations.english: a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded
to turn or be turned towards the port

name: airport
trans: n. 机场；航空站

sentences.english: The plane landed at Heathrow Airport.
sentences.chinese: 飞机降落在希思罗机场。

sentences.english: Her family went to see her off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人去机场送她。

detailed_translations.english: a place where planes take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait in

name: export
trans: n. 输出，出口；出口商品,vt. 输出，出口,vi. 输出物资

sentences.english: Italian food has been exported all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利食品已传遍世界。

detailed_translations.english: to sell goods to another country
to sell goods to another country
the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

name: exporter
trans: n. 出口商；输出国

sentences.english: France is the world's second-biggest exporter of agricultural products.
sentences.chinese: 法国是世界第二大农产品出口国。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that sells goods to another country

name: import
trans: n. 进口，进口货；输入；意思，含义；重要性,vt. 输入，进口；含…的意思,vi. 输入，进口

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: opportunity
trans: n. 时机，机会

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

name: passport
trans: n. 护照，通行证；手段

sentences.english: I have an Irish passport.
sentences.chinese: 我持爱尔兰护照。

sentences.english: They need to check that your passport is in order.
sentences.chinese: 他们要检查一下你的护照是否有效。

detailed_translations.english: a small official document that you get from your government, that proves who you are, and which you need in order to leave your country and enter other countries

name: porter
trans: n. 门房；服务员；行李搬运工；守门人

sentences.english: Our taxi pulled up at Old Delhi station and a porter sprinted to the door.
sentences.chinese: 我们的出租车停在老德里车站，一个搬运工疾步跑向车门。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to carry people’s bags at railway stations, airports etc

name: portable
trans: n. 手提式打字机,adj. 手提的，便携式的；轻便的

sentences.english: a portable radio
sentences.chinese: 便携式收音机

detailed_translations.english: able to be carried or moved easily

name: porter
trans: n. 门房；服务员；行李搬运工；守门人

sentences.english: Our taxi pulled up at Old Delhi station and a porter sprinted to the door.
sentences.chinese: 我们的出租车停在老德里车站，一个搬运工疾步跑向车门。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to carry people’s bags at railway stations, airports etc

name: transport
trans: n. 运输；运输机；狂喜；流放犯,vt. 运输；流放；使狂喜

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: offer
trans: vt. 提供；出价；试图,n. 提议；出价；意图；录取通知书,vi. 提议；出现；献祭；求婚

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: infer
trans: vi. 推断；作出推论,vt. 推断；推论

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: inference
trans: n. 推理；推论；推断

sentences.english: There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.
sentences.chinese: 从她的来信可以得到两种推论。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

name: prefer
trans: vt. 更喜欢；宁愿；提出；提升,vi. 喜欢；愿意

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preferable
trans: adj. 更好的，更可取的；更合意的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，倾向；优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: refer
trans: vt. 涉及；委托；归诸于；使…求助于,vi. 参考；涉及；提到；查阅

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: reference
trans: n. 参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书,vt. 引用,vi. 引用

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: referee
trans: n. 裁判员；调解人；介绍人,vt. 为…当裁判；调停,vi. 仲裁；担任裁判

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

name: suffer
trans: vi. 遭受，忍受；受痛苦；经验；受损害,vt. 遭受；忍受；经历

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: suffering
trans: n. 受难；苦楚,v. 受苦；蒙受（suffer的ing形式）,adj. 受苦的；患病的

sentences.english: the suffering of the refugees after the war
sentences.chinese: 战后难民所遭受的苦难

sentences.english: the pain and suffering caused by road accidents
sentences.chinese: 交通事故造成的痛苦

detailed_translations.english: serious physical or mental pain

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户,vt. 使转移；调任,vi. 转让；转学；换车

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: transference
trans: n. 转移；转让；调任

name: notice
trans: n. 通知，布告；注意；公告,vt. 通知；注意到；留心,vi. 引起注意

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

name: noticeable
trans: adj. 显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的

sentences.english: Alcohol has a noticeable effect on the body.
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体有明显的影响。

sentences.english: It was noticeable that many of them avoided answering the question.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，他们中的许多人对这个问题都避而不答。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: notify
trans: vt. 通告，通知；公布

sentences.english: You will be notified of any changes in the system.
sentences.chinese: 系统中有任何变化都会通知你。

sentences.english: In August we were notified that our article had been rejected.
sentences.chinese: 8月份我们接到通知，说我们的文章不予采用。

detailed_translations.english: to formally or officially tell someone about something

name: notion
trans: n. 概念；见解；打算

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉,vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售,vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: saint
trans: 找不到解释

sentences.english: Saint Patrick
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克

sentences.english: Statues of saints lined the walls of the church.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的墙边立着一排圣徒像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 圣人；圣徒；道德崇高的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy

name: ambulance
trans: n.  救护车；战时流动医院

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: ambition
trans: n. 野心，雄心；抱负，志向,vt. 追求；有…野心

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: ambitious
trans: adj. 野心勃勃的；有雄心的；热望的；炫耀的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: ambassador
trans: n. 大使；代表；使节

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

name: embassy
trans: n. 大使馆；大使馆全体人员

sentences.english: the American Embassy in Paris
sentences.chinese: 美国驻巴黎大使馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 大使馆； 大使馆全体成员
detailed_translations.english: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

name: sum
trans: n. 金额；总数,vt. 总结；合计,vi. 概括

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: summary
trans: n. 概要，摘要，总结,adj. 简易的；扼要的

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

name: summarize
trans: vt. 总结；概述,vi. 作总结；作概括

sentences.english: The authors summarize their views in the introduction.
sentences.chinese: 作者在序言里概述了他们的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc

name: summarise
trans: vt. 总结，概述

sentences.english: The decline and fall of the American car industry is relatively easy to summarise, and the Hummer is its reductio.
sentences.chinese: 美国汽车业的衰亡相对比较容易概括总结，悍马正是美国汽车业的缩影。

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要； 履历，简历,vi. 重新开始，继续,vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: summit
trans: n. 顶点；最高级会议；最高阶层,adj. 最高级的；政府首脑的

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: assume
trans: vt. 僭取；篡夺；夺取；擅用；侵占,vi. 假定；设想；承担；采取

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: consume
trans: vt. 消耗，消费；使…着迷；挥霍,vi. 耗尽，毁灭；耗尽生命

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: consumer
trans: n. 消费者；用户，顾客

sentences.english: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
sentences.chinese: 不久消费者就要支付更高的机票价了。

sentences.english: It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (= consumers in general ).
sentences.chinese: 它将为消费者提供更多的商品选择。

sentences.english: Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
sentences.chinese: 消费者需求促使制造商品的进口量增加了。

sentences.english: Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月消费支出下降了0.1%。

sentences.english: sources of consumer advice
sentences.chinese: 给予消费者建议的信息来源

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and uses products and services

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要； 履历，简历,vi. 重新开始，继续,vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: consumption
trans: n. 消费；消耗；肺痨

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: reply
trans: n. 回答； 答辩,vt. 回答；答复,vi. 回答； 答辩；回击

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

name: imply
trans: vt. 意味；暗示；隐含

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: implication
trans: n. 含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: implicit
trans: adj. 含蓄的；暗示的；盲从的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: explicate
trans: vt. 说明，解释

sentences.english: It is essentially a simple notion, but explicating it is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 它实质上是一个简单的概念，但要详细解释还是很难。

detailed_translations.english: to explain an idea in detail

name: explication
trans: n. 说明；阐明；展开（花瓣、叶子等的）

name: explicit
trans: adj. 明确的；清楚的；直率的；详述的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: simple
trans: n. 笨蛋；愚蠢的行为；出身低微者,adj. 简单的；单纯的；天真的

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

name: simplicity
trans: n. 朴素；简易；天真；愚蠢

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

name: simplify
trans: vt. 简化；使单纯；使简易

sentences.english: an attempt to simplify the tax system
sentences.chinese: 简化税制的尝试

sentences.english: The law needs to be simplified.
sentences.chinese: 这部法律需要简化。

sentences.english: a simplified version of the game
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏的简化版

detailed_translations.english: to make something easier or less complicated

name: complicated
trans: adj. 难懂的，复杂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: complicate
trans: vt. 使复杂化；使恶化；使卷入

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: complex
trans: n. 复合体；综合设施,adj. 复杂的；合成的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: display
trans: n. 显示；炫耀,vt. 显示；表现；陈列,adj. 展览的；陈列用的,vi.  作炫耀行为

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: employ
trans: n. 使用；雇用,vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: ancient
trans: n. 古代人；老人,adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: antique
trans: n. 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格,adj. 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的,vi. 觅购古玩

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

name: battle
trans: n. 战役；斗争,vt. 与…作战,vi. 斗争；作战

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: bat
trans: n. 蝙蝠；球棒；球拍；批处理文件的扩展名,vt. 用球棒击球；击球率达…,vi. 轮到击球；用球棒击球

sentences.english: A bat echolocates the direction.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠凭回声测定方向。

sentences.english: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.chinese: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。

sentences.english: It is technically incorrect to talk about bat ‘radar’, since they do not use radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 严密来说，说蝙蝠有“雷达”系统是错误的，因为他们并不使用无线电波。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

name: battery
trans: n.  电池，蓄电池,n. 殴打,n. 炮台，炮位

sentences.english: You have to take the top off to change the batteries .
sentences.chinese: 你得把顶盖拿掉才能更换电池。

sentences.english: When the red light comes on, you should recharge the battery .
sentences.chinese: 红灯亮起的时候你就应该给电池充电了。

sentences.english: The car’s got a flat battery .
sentences.chinese: 汽车的蓄电池没电了。

sentences.english: a battery-operated hairdryer
sentences.chinese: 使用电池的吹风机

detailed_translations.english: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

name: combat
trans: n. 战斗；争论,adj. 战斗的；为…斗争的,vi. 战斗；搏斗,vt. 反对；与…战斗

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；辩论会,vt. 辩论，争论，讨论,vi. 辩论，争论，讨论

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: count
trans: n. 计数；计算；伯爵,vt. 计算；认为,vi. 计数；有价值

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述,vt. 认为；把…视为,vi. 解释；导致；报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accountant
trans: n. 会计师；会计人员

sentences.english: The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: She’s got the flu .
sentences.chinese: 她得了流感。

sentences.english: I couldn’t go because I had flu .
sentences.chinese: 我得了流感，去不了。

sentences.english: Doctors now fear a flu epidemic .
sentences.chinese: 医生现在担心会出现流感大爆发。

detailed_translations.english: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

name: influence
trans: n. 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事,vt. 影响；改变

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的；有势力的,n. 有影响力的人物

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动；涨落；动摇,vt. 使波动；使动摇

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: refuse
trans: n. 垃圾；废物,vi. 拒绝,vt. 拒绝；不愿；抵制

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: refusal
trans: n. 拒绝；优先取舍权；推却；取舍权

sentences.english: Her country suffered through her refusal to accept change.
sentences.chinese: 她的国家因为她拒绝接受变革而受了害。

detailed_translations.english: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something

name: confuse
trans: vt. 使混乱；使困惑

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: confusion
trans: n. 混淆，混乱；困惑

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: hard
trans: adj. 努力的；硬的；困难的；辛苦的；确实的；严厉的；猛烈的；冷酷无情的,adv. 努力地；困难地；辛苦地；接近地；猛烈地；牢固地

sentences.english: a hard wooden chair
sentences.chinese: 一把硬木椅

sentences.english: the hardest substance known to man
sentences.chinese: 已知的最硬物质

sentences.english: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
sentences.chinese: 数月无雨，土地坚硬难犁。

sentences.english: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
sentences.chinese: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。

detailed_translations.english: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

name: harden
trans: vi. 变硬，变坚固；变坚强；变冷酷,vt. 使…变硬；使…坚强；使…冷酷；使…麻木不仁

sentences.english: It will take about 24 hours for the glue to harden.
sentences.chinese: 胶水干透大约需要24小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变硬，变坚固；变坚强；变冷酷
detailed_translations.english: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff

detailed_translations.chinese: (Harden)人名；(英、德、罗、瑞典)哈登；(法)阿尔当

name: hardware
trans: n. 计算机硬件；五金器具

sentences.english: 英文例句:To be totally secure, you need a piece of hardware that costs about $200.
sentences.chinese: 为保证绝对安全，你需要一个花费约为两百美元的硬件。

sentences.english: ...a shop from which an uncle had sold hardware and timber.
sentences.chinese: …一家叔叔曾经在那里卖五金器具和木材的店铺。

detailed_translations.english: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work

name: hardship
trans: n. 困苦；苦难；艰难险阻

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

name: measure
trans: n. 测量；措施；程度；尺寸,vt. 测量；估量；权衡,vi. 测量；估量

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

name: measurement
trans: n. 测量； 度量；尺寸；量度制

sentences.english: What’s your waist measurement?
sentences.chinese: 你腰围是多少？

sentences.english: accurate measurement of body temperature
sentences.chinese: 体温的精确测量

detailed_translations.english: the length, height etc of something

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面; 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸,adj. 规格的

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: dimensional
trans: adj. 空间的；尺寸的

sentences.english: Of particular note is the deviation threshold parameter and the dimensional shift parameters.
sentences.chinese: 需要特别注意的是偏差阈值参数和空间移位参数。

sentences.english: The formula on definite proportion exists not only in plane figure but also in three-dimensional figure.
sentences.chinese: 平面图形中有定比分点公式，在空间图形中也存在同样的定比分点公式。

sentences.english: If the dimensional shift in either direction is greater than our previously set threshold, increment the total deviation by the amount moved in both directions.
sentences.chinese: 如果在任意方向上的空间移位大于我们先前设定的阈值，就按照两个方向上移动的量增加总偏差。

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: metre
trans: n. 米；公尺；韵律

sentences.english: She's running the 1,500 metres here.
sentences.chinese: 她正在这儿跑1500米。

sentences.english: A man came to read the electricity metre .
sentences.chinese: 有个男的来抄电表。

detailed_translations.english: the basic unit for measuring length in the  metric system

name: meter
trans: n. 米；仪表； 公尺；韵律,vt. 用仪表测量,vi. 用表计量

sentences.english: A man came to read the electricity meter .
sentences.chinese: 有个男的来抄电表。

detailed_translations.chinese: 米；仪表；[计量] 公尺；韵律
detailed_translations.english: a machine that measures the level of something
to measure how much of something is used, and how much you must pay for it, by using a meter

name: centimetre
trans: n. 厘米；公分

sentences.english: ...a tiny fossil plant, only a few centimetres high.
sentences.chinese: …一块小小的植物化石，只有几厘米高。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length. There are 100 centimetres in one metre.

name: centimeter
trans: n.  厘米； 公分

sentences.english: Who guesses one centimeter?
sentences.chinese: 谁觉得是一厘米？

sentences.english: In every square centimeter!
sentences.chinese: 每一平方厘米！

sentences.english: With the profile of a dinosaur and the texture of a rose bush, a thorny devil in Alice Springs Desert Park looks like trouble, but this slow-moving, six-inch [15-centimeter] lizard eats only ants.
sentences.chinese: 长着恐龙的外形和一身的刺犹如一丛玫瑰，这样一个棘手的恶魔在阿丽斯春天的沙漠公园里看似麻烦，但他动作缓慢，六英寸[15厘米]蜥蜴只吃蚂蚁。

name: kilometre
trans: n.  公里； 千米

sentences.english: He was a kilometre out from home when the storm struck.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨袭来时他离家有一公里远。

sentences.english: They ran to the main road and on for a kilometre until ambulances could reach them.
sentences.chinese: 接着他们就向大道跑去，到了以后再跑了一千米，直到碰到救护车。

sentences.english: Every cubic kilometre of the ring contains around 20 tiny particles of dust, making it so tenuous, it would be invisible from the inside.
sentences.chinese: 这个光环每立方公里含有约20颗尘埃微粒，结构非常稀薄，站在光环内部都看不见它本身。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,000 metres

name: kilometer
trans: n.  公里； 千米（等于kilometre）

sentences.english: She had to battle snowstorms, landslides, snakes and loneliness on her 350 kilometer journey.
sentences.chinese: 在350公里的行程中，她要克服暴风雪、滑坡、蛇和孤独寂寞。

sentences.english: But it says food grown and harvested in the 30-kilometer exclusion zone after the emergency might be contaminated and should be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 但是，该组织说，事故发生后，在30公里禁区内种植和收获的食物可能受到污染，应该避免食用。

sentences.english: For example, the researchers last week said they had managed to gather enough energy from a TV station a half-kilometer away to power a small temperature sensor.
sentences.chinese: 例如，研究人员上周说，他们已经设法从半公里远的一座电视发射台收集了足够了能量给一个小型温度传感器供电。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计量] 公里；[计量] 千米（等于kilometre）

name: millimetre
trans: n. 毫米；公厘

sentences.english: The creature is a tiny centipede, just 10 millimetres long.
sentences.chinese: 那个生物是一只很小的蜈蚣，只有10毫米长。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length. There are 1,000 millimetres in one metre.

name: millimeter
trans: n.  毫米

sentences.english: A micrometer is one thousandth of one millimeter.
sentences.chinese: 一微米是一毫米的千分之一。

sentences.english: We're also good at seeing big clouds of small particles of dust. ... But in between dust grains up to a millimeter in size and the smallest planets we can see, we're blind.
sentences.chinese: 我们也同样擅长于发现那些一大堆的尘埃...但是如果要去发现那些毫米级的尘埃，和那些我们能看到的最小的行星，我们几乎就成了盲人。

sentences.english: On average these mosses grow at the glacial speed of 1 millimeter per year—and some of the turfs are meters thick.
sentences.chinese: 平均来说，这些苔藓以每年大约1毫米的极慢速度生长，而某些草皮有数米厚。

name: metric
trans: adj. 公制的；米制的；公尺的,n. 度量标准

sentences.english: a metric tonne
sentences.chinese: 一公吨

sentences.english: The parts all come in metric sizes now.
sentences.chinese: 现在配件都采用公制规格。

detailed_translations.english: using or connected with the  metric system  of weights and measures

name: arithmetic
trans: n. 算术，算法

sentences.english: He's not very good at arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 他不太擅长算术。

sentences.english: a quick bit of mental arithmetic
sentences.chinese: 快速心算

detailed_translations.english: the type of mathematics that deals with the adding, multiplying, etc. of numbers

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: geometry
trans: n. 几何学,几何结构

sentences.english: the very ordered way in which mathematics and geometry describe nature
sentences.chinese: 数学和几何学描述自然的条理性

detailed_translations.english: the study in  mathematics  of the angles and shapes formed by the relationships of lines, surfaces, and solid objects in space

name: meter
trans: n. 米；仪表； 公尺；韵律,vt. 用仪表测量,vi. 用表计量

sentences.english: A man came to read the electricity meter .
sentences.chinese: 有个男的来抄电表。

detailed_translations.chinese: 米；仪表；[计量] 公尺；韵律
detailed_translations.english: a machine that measures the level of something
to measure how much of something is used, and how much you must pay for it, by using a meter

name: thermometer
trans: n. 温度计；体温计

sentences.english: The thermometer registered over 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 温度计显示高于100摄氏度。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

name: country
trans: n. 国家，国土；国民；乡下，农村；乡村；故乡,adj. 祖国的，故乡的；地方的，乡村的；国家的；粗鲁的；乡村音乐的

sentences.english: the Scandinavian countries
sentences.chinese: 斯堪的纳维亚国家

sentences.english: developing countries
sentences.chinese: 发展中国家

sentences.english: travelling to a foreign country
sentences.chinese: 到国外旅行

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to live in the country.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想住在乡下。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land that is controlled by its own government, president, king etc

name: counter
trans: n. 柜台；对立面；计数器；（某些棋盘游戏的）筹码,vi. 逆向移动，对着干；反驳,adj. 相反的,vt. 反击，还击；反向移动，对着干；反驳，回答,adv. 反方向地；背道而驰地

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: encounter
trans: n. 遭遇，偶然碰见,vi. 遭遇；偶然相遇,vt. 遭遇，邂逅；遇到

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触,vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: contradiction
trans: n. 矛盾；否认；反驳

sentences.english: apparent contradictions in the defendant’s testimony
sentences.chinese: 被告证词中的明显矛盾

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾， 不一致； 否认， 反驳
detailed_translations.english: a difference between two statements, beliefs, or ideas about something that means they cannot both be true

name: contrary
trans: n. 相反；反面,adj. 相反的；对立的,adv. 相反地

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: contrast
trans: n. 对比；差别；对照物,vt. 使对比；使与…对照,vi. 对比；形成对照

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: controversy
trans: n. 争论；论战；辩论

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: controversial
trans: adj. 有争议的；有争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: band
trans: n. 带，环； 波段；(演奏流行音乐的) 乐队,n. n.乐队；队；一群,vi. 用带绑扎；给...镶边

sentences.english: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.
sentences.chinese: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。

sentences.english: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
sentences.chinese: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。

sentences.english: interviews with band members
sentences.chinese: 对乐队成员的采访

detailed_translations.english: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music

name: bandage
trans: n. 绷带,vt. 用绷带包扎

sentences.english: We put some ointment and a bandage on his knee.
sentences.chinese: 我们在他的膝盖上涂了些药膏，还缠了一条绷带。

sentences.english: The nurse bandaged up his sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 护士用绷带包扎他扭伤的脚踝。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of cloth that you tie around a wound or around a part of the body that has been injured
to tie or cover a part of the body with a bandage

name: bind
trans: n. 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓,vt. 绑；约束；装订；包扎；凝固,vi. 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: bond
trans: n. 债券；结合；约定；粘合剂；纽带,vt. 使结合；以…作保,vi. 结合，团结在一起

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

name: bound
trans: n. 范围；跳跃,adj. 有义务的；必定的；受约束的；装有封面的,vt. 束缚；使跳跃,vi. 限制；弹起

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: boundary
trans: n. 边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: bundle
trans: n. 束；捆,vt. 捆,vi. 匆忙离开

sentences.english: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
sentences.chinese: 一个小包袱，里面主要是衣服

sentences.english: He was bundled into a car and driven 50 miles to a police station.
sentences.chinese: 他被塞进一辆小汽车，被带到50英里外的警察局。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things such as papers, clothes, or sticks that are fastened or tied together

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集， 归拢； 把…塞入
detailed_translations.english: If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way

name: bound
trans: n. 范围；跳跃,adj. 有义务的；必定的；受约束的；装有封面的,vt. 束缚；使跳跃,vi. 限制；弹起

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: bounce
trans: n. 跳；弹力；活力,vt. 弹跳；使弹起,vi. 弹跳；弹起，反跳；弹回

sentences.english: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

detailed_translations.english: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it
the action of moving up and down on a surface

name: class
trans: n. 阶级；班级；种类；班；等级,adj. 极好的；很好的，优秀的，出色的,vt. 分类；把…分等级；把…归入某等级，把…看作（或分类、归类）；把…编入某一班级,vi. 属于…类（或等级），被列为某类（或某级）

sentences.english: Gary came top of the class in English.
sentences.chinese: 加里的英文是班里顶尖的。

sentences.english: a member of the landed class
sentences.chinese: 地主阶级的一员

sentences.english: He’s not in the same class (= not as good ) as her at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他的网球水平并不如她。

detailed_translations.english: a group of students who are taught together

name: classic
trans: n. 名著；经典著作；大艺术家,adj. 经典的；古典的，传统的；最优秀的

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

name: classical
trans: n. 古典音乐,adj. 古典的；经典的；传统的；第一流的

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: classify
trans: vt. 分类；分等

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: classification
trans: n. 分类；类别，等级

sentences.english: the classification of wines according to quality
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒按品质的分类

sentences.english: There are five job classifications.
sentences.chinese: 有五种工作类别。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

name: decide
trans: vi. 决定，下决心,vt. 决定；解决；判决

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

name: decision
trans: n. 决定，决心；决议

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

name: suicide
trans: n. 自杀；自杀行为；自杀者,adj. 自杀的,vt. 自杀,vi. 自杀

sentences.english: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.english: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲多次试图自杀。

sentences.english: He apparently left a suicide note (= letter explaining his reasons for killing himself ) on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of killing yourself

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: precision
trans: n. 精度， 精密度；精确,adj. 精密的，精确的

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: during
trans: prep. 在…的时候，在…的期间

sentences.english: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
sentences.chinese: 夏天她当过救生员。

sentences.english: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
sentences.chinese: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。

sentences.english: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

detailed_translations.english: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

name: durable
trans: n. 耐用品,adj. 耐用的，持久的

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: duration
trans: n. 持续，持续的时间，期间,音长，音延

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍,vi. 忍耐；持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: endurance
trans: n. 忍耐力；忍耐；持久；耐久

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: grace
trans: n. 优雅；恩惠；魅力；慈悲,vt. 使优美

sentences.english: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.english: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive

name: graceful
trans: adj. 优雅的；优美的

sentences.english: Her movements were graceful and elegant.
sentences.chinese: 她举手投足优雅而高贵。

sentences.english: The branches formed a graceful curve.
sentences.chinese: 那些树枝形成一条优美的曲线。

detailed_translations.english: moving in a smooth and attractive way, or having an attractive shape or form

name: disgraceful
trans: adj. 不名誉的，可耻的

sentences.english: It’s a disgraceful waste of taxpayers’ money.
sentences.chinese: 这样浪费纳税人的钱真是可耻。

sentences.english: It is disgraceful that anyone should have to live in such conditions.
sentences.chinese: 竟有人在这种条件下生活，真是太不像话了。

detailed_translations.english: bad, embarrassing, or unacceptable

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: gratitude
trans: n. 感谢（的心情）；感激

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: sure
trans: adj. 确信的；可靠的；必定的,adv. 当然；的确

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

name: assure
trans: vt. 保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: ensure
trans: vt. 保证，确保；使安全

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: insure
trans: vt. 确保，保证；给…保险,vi. 确保；投保

sentences.english: Have you insured the contents of your home?
sentences.chinese: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

sentences.english: facilities to insure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

name: assurance
trans: n. 保证，担保；（人寿）保险；确信；断言；厚脸皮，无耻

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险；保险费；保险契约；赔偿金

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: moral
trans: adj. 道德的；精神上的；品性端正的,n. 道德；寓意

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: morality
trans: n. 道德；品行，美德

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

name: virtue
trans: n. 美德；优点；贞操；功效

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: virtual
trans: adj.  虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: virtually
trans: adv. 事实上，几乎；实质上

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: proper
trans: adj. 适当的；本身的；特有的；正派的,adv. 完全地

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: propriety
trans: n. 适当；礼节；得体

sentences.english: strict in observing the proprieties
sentences.chinese: 严格遵守礼节的

detailed_translations.english: correctness of social or moral behaviour

name: property
trans: n. 性质，性能；财产；所有权

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的,vt. 占用，拨出

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的,vt. 占用，拨出

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: raise
trans: n. 高地；上升；加薪,vt. 提高；筹集；养育；升起,vi. 上升

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: rise
trans: n. 上升；高地；增加；出现,vt. 使…飞起；使…浮上水面,vi. 上升；增强；起立；高耸

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

name: arise
trans: vi. 出现；上升；起立

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: rouse
trans: n. 觉醒；奋起,vt. 唤醒；激起，使振奋；惊起,vi. 醒来；奋起

sentences.english: His banging roused the neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

detailed_translations.english: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

name: arouse
trans: vt. 引起；唤醒；鼓励,vi. 激发；醒来；发奋

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

name: own
trans: vt. 拥有；承认,vi. 承认,adj. 自己的；特有的,n. 自己的

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: owner
trans: n.  所有者；物主

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: ownership
trans: n. 所有权；物主身份

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

name: owe
trans: vt. 欠；感激；应给予；应该把……归功于,vi. 欠钱

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: owing
trans: adj. 未付的；欠着的,v. 欠；把…归功于（owe的ing形式）

sentences.english: You need to pay the amount owing, plus the interest.
sentences.chinese: 你需要付清欠款，外加利息。

detailed_translations.english: if money is owing, it has not yet been paid to the person who should receive it

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染,vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: communicable
trans: adj. 可传达的；会传染的；爱说话的

detailed_translations.chinese: 可传达的；会传染的；爱说话的
detailed_translations.english: a communicable disease can be passed on to other people

name: communication
trans: n. 通讯， 通信；交流；信函

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: telecommunications
