sentences.english: a new telecommunications system
sentences.chinese: 新的电信系统

sentences.english: the telecommunications industry
sentences.chinese: 电信业

detailed_translations.english: the sending and receiving of messages by telephone, radio, television etc

name: immune
trans: n. 免疫者；免除者,adj. 免疫的；免于……的，免除的

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: immunity
trans: n. 免疫力；豁免权；免除

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: immunize
trans: vt. 使免疫；赋予免疫性

sentences.english: We should require that every student is immunized against hepatitis B.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该要求每一位学生都注射乙肝疫苗。

detailed_translations.english: to protect someone from a particular illness by giving them a vaccine

name: immunise
trans: vt. 使某人免疫

name: commune
trans: n. 公社,vi. 谈心，亲密交谈；密切联系

sentences.english: a hippie commune
sentences.chinese: 嬉皮士群体

detailed_translations.chinese: 谈心，亲密交谈；密切联系
detailed_translations.english: to talk or converse intimately
a group of people who live together and who share the work and their possessions

sentences.chinese: 给我从自动饮料机里买一罐咖啡好吗？

sentences.chinese: 传真机坏了。

sentences.english: Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine (= washing machine ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你把我的脏衬衫放进洗衣机里了吗？

sentences.english: I left a message for you on your machine (= telephone answering machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 我在你的电话答录机里留了言。

sentences.english: The machine wouldn’t let me have any money (= cash machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 自动取款机不让我取钱。

name: machinery
trans: n. 机械；机器；机构；机械装置

sentences.chinese: …优质工具和机械。

detailed_translations.english: You can use machinery to refer to machines in general, or machines that are used in a factory or on a farm

trans: n. 技工，机修工,adj. 手工的

sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂的技工

detailed_translations.english: someone who is skilled at repairing motor vehicles and machinery

trans: adj. 机械的；力学的；呆板的；无意识的；手工操作的

sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids

trans: vt. 使机械化；机动化；用机械装置

sentences.chinese: 渐渐地科技才发展到能使这项任务机械化。

name: mechanise
trans: vt. 使……用机械装置；使……机械化

detailed_translations.chinese: 使……用机械装置；使……机械化

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；原理，途径；进程；机械装置；技巧

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

trans: n. 释放；发布；让与,vt. 释放；发射；让与；允许发表

sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.

sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.chinese: 她的脖子上松松地系着一条漂亮的围巾。

sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful

sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

trans: n. 危机；危险期；决定性时刻,adj. 危机的；用于处理危机的

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

name: drama

sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: intangible

detailed_translations.chinese: 无形的，触摸不到的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: an intangible quality or feeling is difficult to describe exactly

name: heritage

sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权

name: staple
trans: n. 主要产品；订书钉；主题；主食,adj. 主要的，大宗生产的；常用的；纺织纤维的,vt. 把…分级；钉住

sentences.chinese: 石油是尼日利亚的主要出口产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的； 经常需要的

name: cereal

sentences.english: a bowl of breakfast cereal
sentences.chinese: 一碗早餐麦片

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷类，谷物；谷类食品；谷类植物
detailed_translations.english: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

name: thrive

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: render
trans: n. 打底；交纳；粉刷,vt. 致使；提出；实施；着色；以…回报,vi. 给予补偿

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: mortgage
trans: vt. 抵押,n. 抵押,房屋抵押贷款

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: fit
trans: n. 合身；发作；痉挛,adj. 健康的；合适的；恰当的；准备好的,vt. 安装；使……适应；使……合身；与……相符,vi. 符合，配合；适合；合身

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: function
trans: n. 功能； 函数；职责；盛大的集会,vi. 运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: shot
trans: n. 发射；炮弹；射手；镜头,v. 射击（shoot的过去式和过去分词）,adj. 用尽的；破旧的；杂色的，闪光的

sentences.english: In the opening shot, we see Travolta’s feet walking down the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 在开场的镜头中，我们看到特拉沃尔塔的脚在人行道上行走。

detailed_translations.english: the view of something in a film or television programme that is produced by having the camera in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 用尽的；破旧的；杂色的，闪光的
detailed_translations.english: in bad condition because of being used too much or treated badly

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击（shoot的过去式和过去分词）

name: factor
trans: n. 因素；要素； 因数；代理人,vt. 把…作为因素计入；代理经营；把…分解成,vi. 做代理商

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: set
trans: n.  集合；一套；布景； 装置,adj. 固定的；规定的；固执的,vi. (日,月)落沉；凝固；结果,vt. 树立；点燃；点缀；

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: post
trans: n. 岗位；邮件；标杆,vt. 张贴；公布；邮递；布置,vi. 快速行进

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

name: sign
trans: n. 迹象；符号；记号；手势；指示牌,vt. 签署；示意,vi. 签署；签名

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: signal
trans: n. 信号；暗号；导火线,adj. 显著的；作为信号的,vt. 标志；用信号通知；表示,vi. 发信号

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

name: signify
trans: vt. 表示；意味；预示,vi. 有重要性；要紧；冒充内行

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: significant
trans: n. 象征；有意义的事物,adj. 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: significantly
trans: adv. 显著地；相当数量地

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

name: significance
trans: n. 意义；重要性；意思

sentences.english: a decision of major political significance
sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

name: assign
trans: vt. 分配；指派； 赋值,vi. 将财产过户（尤指过户给债权人）

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: resign
trans: n. 辞去职务,vi. 辞职,vt. 辞职；放弃；委托；使听从

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

trans: n. 辞职；放弃；辞职书；顺从

sentences.chinese: 她无奈地叹了一口气。

sentences.english: He accepted her decision with resignation.
sentences.chinese: 他无可奈何地接受了她的决定。

detailed_translations.english: when someone calmly accepts a situation that cannot be changed, even though it is bad

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

name: mark
trans: n. 标志；马克；符号；痕迹；分数,vi. 作记号,vt. .标志；做标记于；打分数,n. . 标志；做标记于；打分数

sentences.english: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
sentences.chinese: 小猫身体基本为白色，背上有黑色斑点。

sentences.english: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在页末做个记号。

sentences.chinese: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。

to show where something is

name: remark
trans: n. 注意；言辞,vt. 评论；觉察,vi. 谈论

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: margin
trans: n. 边缘；利润，余裕；页边的空白,vt. 加边于；加旁注于

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

name: marginal
trans: adj. 边缘的；临界的；末端的

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

name: explode
trans: vi. 爆炸，爆发；激增,vt. 使爆炸；爆炸；推翻

sentences.english: The device was thrown at an army patrol but failed to explode.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.english: Far sooner than anyone thought possible, the Russians exploded an atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

detailed_translations.english: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

name: explosion
trans: n. 爆炸；爆发；激增

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

name: explosive
trans: n. 炸药；爆炸物,adj. 爆炸的；爆炸性的；爆发性的

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

name: applaud
trans: vt. 赞同；称赞；向…喝彩,vi. 喝彩；鼓掌欢迎

sentences.english: The audience applauded loudly.
sentences.chinese: 观众掌声雷动。

sentences.english: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
sentences.chinese: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

detailed_translations.english: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc
to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc

name: applause
trans: n. 欢呼，喝采；鼓掌欢迎

sentences.english: She got a round of applause (=  a short period of applause  ) when she finished.
sentences.chinese: 她结束的时候获得一阵掌声。

detailed_translations.english: the sound of many people hitting their hands together and shouting, to show that they have enjoyed something

name: plausible
trans: adj. 貌似可信的，花言巧语的；貌似真实的，貌似有理的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: light
trans: n. 光；光线；灯；打火机；领悟；浅色；天窗,adj. 轻的；浅色的；明亮的；轻松的；容易的；清淡的,vi. 点着；变亮；着火,vt. 照亮；点燃；着火,adv. 轻地；清楚地；轻便地

sentences.english: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿这个袋子——它很轻。

sentences.english: You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该穿轻便舒适的鞋子。

sentences.english: The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
sentences.chinese: 这辆卡车很轻，容易驾驶。

sentences.english: people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
sentences.chinese: 只受到轻度辐射的人

detailed_translations.english: not very heavy

name: daylight
trans: n. 白天；日光；黎明；公开

sentences.english: The park is open to the public during daylight hours .
sentences.chinese: 公园白天对公众开放。

sentences.english: If possible, it’s better to work in natural daylight.
sentences.chinese: 如果条件允许的话，最好在自然日光下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the light produced by the sun during the day

name: sunlight
trans: n. 日光

sentences.english: The water sparkled in the bright sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 水面在灿烂的阳光下闪闪发亮。

sentences.english: (= came in large amounts ) through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光从窗户流泻进来。

sentences.english: a shaft of sunlight
sentences.chinese: 一束阳光

detailed_translations.english: natural light that comes from the sun

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区,vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: lighten
trans: vi. 减轻；发亮,vt. 使照亮；使轻松

sentences.english: She took one of the parcels from her father to lighten his load.
sentences.chinese: 她从父亲那儿拿过一个包以减轻他的负担。

sentences.english: This will lighten your spirit and give you strength and motivation.
sentences.chinese: 这样会减轻你的精神压力并会给你能力和动力。

sentences.english: I told you at the beginning of this article that I needed to lighten up my bike without sacrificing my suspension.
sentences.chinese: 在本文开始的部分，我告诉您我需要在不牺牲自行车避震系统的前提下，减轻自行车的重量。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the amount of work, worry, debt etc that someone has

name: lightning
trans: adj. 闪电的；快速的,n. 闪电,vi. 闪电

sentences.english: a lightning attack
sentences.chinese: 闪电式突袭

detailed_translations.english: very fast, and often without warning
a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder

name: enlighten
trans: vt. 启发，启蒙；教导，开导；照耀

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: glory
trans: n. 光荣，荣誉；赞颂,vi. 自豪，骄傲；狂喜

sentences.english: She dreamt of future glory as an Olympic champion.
sentences.chinese: 她梦想着将来能得到奥运冠军的荣誉。

sentences.english: Goran’s moment of glory came when he defeated Rafter.
sentences.chinese: 戈兰击败拉夫特，迎来了荣耀的一刻。

sentences.english: He began the season in a blaze of glory , scoring seven goals in as many games.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛季一开始他便光芒四射，七场比赛进了七个球。

detailed_translations.english: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot

name: glorious
trans: adj. 光荣的；辉煌的；极好的

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: glow
trans: n. 灼热；色彩鲜艳；兴高采烈,vi. 发热；洋溢；绚丽夺目

sentences.english: The bedside lamp glowed dimly.
sentences.chinese: 床头灯发出暗淡的光。

sentences.english: The fireplace was still glowing with the remains of last night’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉中，隔夜的余烬依然在微微发光。

sentences.english: The red tip of his cigarette was glowing in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他那红红的烟头在黑暗中幽幽发光。

sentences.english: The moisturizer gave my face a healthy glow that lasted all day.
sentences.chinese: 这种润肤霜给我脸上带来了持续整天的一种健康的红光。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or  reflect  a soft steady light
A glow is a pink colour on a person's face, usually because they are healthy or have been exercising

name: glance
trans: n. 一瞥；一滑；闪光,vt. 扫视；瞥见；擦过,vi. 扫视，匆匆一看；反光；瞥闪，瞥见

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

name: glimpse
trans: n. 一瞥，一看,vt. 瞥见,vi. 瞥见

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: hand
trans: n. 手，手艺；帮助；指针；插手,vt. 传递，交给；支持；搀扶

sentences.english: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.english: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.english: the hour hand
sentences.chinese: 时针

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things

name: beforehand
trans: adj. 提前的；预先准备好的,adv. 事先；预先

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: handicap
trans: n. 障碍；不利条件，不利的因素,vt. 妨碍，阻碍；使不利

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: left-handed
trans: adj. 左撇的；用左手的；笨拙的

name: right-handed
trans: adj. 用右手的，惯用右手的；向右转的

name: second-hand
trans: adj. 旧的，二手的,adv. 间接地，第二手地

sentences.english: second-hand clothes
sentences.chinese: 旧衣服

sentences.english: a second-hand car
sentences.chinese: 二手车

detailed_translations.english: second-hand things are not new when you get them, because they were owned by someone else before you

name: handful
trans: n. 少数；一把；棘手事

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

name: handle
trans: n.  把手；柄；手感；口实,vt. 处理；操作；运用；买卖；触摸,vi. 搬运；易于操纵

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: handy
trans: adj. 便利的；手边的，就近的；容易取得的；敏捷的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵；操作；巧妙地处理；篡改

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: manoeuvre
trans: vi. 调动；演习；用策略,vt. 诱使；操纵；耍花招,n. 策略（等于maneuvre）

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

sentences.english: I manoeuvred my way among the tables to the back corner of the place.
sentences.chinese: 我在那些桌子间穿行，来到那地方后面的角落。

detailed_translations.english: If you manoeuvre something into or out of an awkward position, you skilfully move it there
a skilful or carefully planned action intended to gain an advantage for yourself

name: manual
trans: adj. 手工的；体力的,n. 手册，指南

sentences.english: People in manual occupations have a lower life expectancy.
sentences.chinese: 干体力活的人预期寿命较短。

detailed_translations.english: manual work involves using your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind
a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine

name: comprehend
trans: vt. 理解；包含；由…组成

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehension
trans: n. 理解；包含

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: comprehensive
trans: n. 综合学校；专业综合测验,adj. 综合的；广泛的；有理解力的

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: commend
trans: vt. 推荐；称赞；把…委托,vi. 称赞；表扬

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付,vi. 推荐；建议

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recommendation
trans: n. 推荐；建议；推荐信

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: claim
trans: n. 要求；声称；索赔；断言；值得,vt. 要求；声称；需要；认领,vi. 提出要求

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: exclaim
trans: vt. 大声说出,vi. 呼喊，惊叫；大声叫嚷

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: proclaim
trans: vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: society
trans: n. 社会；交往；社团；社交界

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

name: associate
trans: n. 同事，伙伴；关联的事物,adj. 副的；联合的,vt. 联想；使联合；使发生联系,vi. 交往；结交

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: association
trans: n. 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: social
trans: n. 联谊会；联欢会,adj. 社会的，社交的；群居的

sentences.english: social issues, such as unemployment and education
sentences.chinese: 失业和教育之类的社会问题

sentences.english: the country’s serious social problems
sentences.chinese: 该国严重的社会问题

sentences.english: a challenge to the social order
sentences.chinese: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

detailed_translations.chinese: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
detailed_translations.english: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

name: socialism
trans: n. 社会主义

sentences.english: They declared for socialism.
sentences.chinese: 他们表示拥护社会主义。

sentences.english: We should rally under the banner of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当在社会主义的旗帜下团结起来。

sentences.english: From the Left: Yes! Yes, exactly what socialism is.
sentences.chinese: 从左边的回答：是的，这就是社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens

name: socialist
trans: n. 社会主义者；社会党党员,adj. 社会主义的

sentences.english: Esperanto has always been popular among socialists.
sentences.chinese: 世界语在社会主义者中一直很受欢迎。

sentences.english: ...members of the ruling Socialist Party.
sentences.chinese: …执政的社会主义党成员。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in socialism, or who is a member of a political party that supports socialism
based on socialism or relating to a political party that supports socialism

name: sociology
trans: n. 社会学；群体生态学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: sociologist
trans: n. 社会学家

sentences.english: The findings of this sociologist are very interesting because they illustrate once again the relationship that exists between what we do in the present and the results we obtain in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这个社会学家的发现是非常有趣的，因为他们在一次的说明我们现在做的和我们未来获得的结果有关系。

sentences.english: Not only is social class supposed not to exist in America, it is almost a dirty word—“America's forbidden thought”, in the words of one sociologist.
sentences.chinese: 美国不仅不应该存在社会阶级，而且那几乎是一个肮脏的词——用一位社会学家的话来说就是“美国所禁忌的思想”。

name: receive
trans: vt. 收到；接待；接纳,vi. 接收

sentences.english: All the children will receive a small gift.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.english: Lee received 324 votes (= 324 people voted for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

sentences.english: If you would like to receive further information , return the attached form.
sentences.chinese: 欲收到详细资料，请交回所附表格。

sentences.english: She isn’t well enough to receive visitors yet.
sentences.chinese: 她身体还不是很好，不能见客。

detailed_translations.english: to be given something

name: receiver
trans: n. 接收器；接受者；收信机；收款员，接待者

sentences.english: a satellite receiver
sentences.chinese: 卫星信号接收器

sentences.english: She picked up the receiver and dialled his number.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起听筒，拨了他的电话号码。

sentences.english: The business is in the hands of the receivers .
sentences.chinese: 公司现在由破产管理人接管。

detailed_translations.chinese: 电话听筒；接收器；〔破产企业或公司的〕管理人，接管人
detailed_translations.english: the part of a telephone that you hold next to your mouth and ear

name: receipt
trans: n. 收到；收据；收入,vt. 收到

sentences.english: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
sentences.chinese: 保留收据以备退货之需。

sentences.english: Can you give me a receipt?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我一个收条吗？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

name: recipient
trans: n. 容器，接受者；容纳者,adj. 容易接受的，感受性强的

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: reception
trans: n. 接待；接收；招待会；感受；反应

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: receptionist
trans: n. 接待员；传达员

sentences.english: You tell the receptionist that you are expecting a call from this client and to put them through.
sentences.chinese: 你告诉传达员你正在等待一个来自这个客户的电话，并允许将他们接进来。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to welcome and deal with people arriving in a hotel or office building, visiting a doctor etc

name: accept
trans: vi. 承认；同意；承兑,vt. 接受；承认；承担；承兑；容纳

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: acceptable
trans: adj. 可接受的；合意的；可忍受的

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: acceptance
trans: n. 接纳；赞同；容忍

sentences.english: He wrote a letter of acceptance (=  a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc  ) to the university.
sentences.chinese: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接受， 承认； 容忍
detailed_translations.english: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

name: conceive
trans: vi. 怀孕；设想；考虑,vt. 怀孕；构思；以为；持有

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: concept
trans: n. 观念，概念

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: conception
trans: n. 怀孕；概念；设想；开始

sentences.english: the conception of parliamentary democracy
sentences.chinese: 议会民主的概念

sentences.english: changing conceptions of the world
sentences.chinese: 这个世界不断变化的观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea about what something is like, or a general understanding of something

name: misconception
trans: n. 误解；错觉；错误想法

sentences.english: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 说佩吉以前极其富有，这是一个错误的看法。

detailed_translations.english: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly

name: deceive
trans: v. 欺骗；行骗

sentences.english: He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人骗了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true
to make someone believe something that is not true

name: deception
trans: n. 欺骗，欺诈；骗术

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知,vi. 感到，感知；认识到

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: perception
trans: n. 知觉； 感觉；看法；洞察力；获取

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

name: force
trans: n. 力量；武力；军队；魄力,vt. 促使，推动；强迫；强加

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力

name: forceful
trans: adj. 强有力的；有说服力的；坚强的

sentences.english: a forceful attack on government policy
sentences.chinese: 对政府政策的有力抨击

detailed_translations.chinese: 强有力的；有说服力的；坚强的
detailed_translations.english: a forceful person expresses their opinions very strongly and clearly and people are easily persuaded by them

name: forcible
trans: adj. 强制的；暴力的；有说服力的；强有力的

sentences.english: the forcible overthrow of the government
sentences.chinese: 暴力推翻政府

sentences.english: signs of forcible entry into the building
sentences.chinese: 强行入楼的迹象

detailed_translations.chinese: 强制的；暴力的；有说服力的；强有力的
detailed_translations.english: done using physical force

name: enforce
trans: vt. 实施，执行；强迫，强制

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料,vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充,vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: land
trans: n. 国土；陆地；地面,vt. 使…登陆；使…陷于；将…卸下,vi. 登陆；到达

sentences.english: They own a lot of land.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥有许多土地。

sentences.english: He bought a piece of land.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一块地。

sentences.english: After 21 days at sea, we sighted land.
sentences.chinese: 经过21天的海上航行，我们见到了陆地。

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground, especially when used for farming or building

name: inland
trans: n. 内地；内陆,adj. 内陆的；内地的；国内的,adv. 在内地；向内地；向内陆；在内陆

sentences.chinese: 第二天，我们乘车开往内陆。

sentences.english: We beached the boat and headed inland.
sentences.chinese: 我们想使船靠岸，朝内陆方向驶去。

sentences.english: In 1985 a glacier buried this shore; since then the ice has retreated a half mile inland.
sentences.chinese: 1985年，一座冰川在海滨融化，自那时起冰川已经向内陆退缩了半英里。

detailed_translations.english: an inland area, city etc is not near the coast

detailed_translations.chinese: 在内地；向内地；向内陆；在内陆

name: mainland
trans: n. 大陆；本土,adj. 大陆的；本土的

detailed_translations.english: the main area of land that forms a country, as compared to islands near it that are also part of that country

name: landlord
trans: n. 房东，老板；地主

sentences.chinese: 他的房东把房租提高了一倍。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone

name: landscape
trans: n. 风景；风景画；景色；山水画；乡村风景画；地形；（文件的）横向打印格式,vt. 对…做景观美化，给…做园林美化；从事庭园设计,vi. 美化（环境等），使景色宜人；从事景观美化工作，做庭园设计师

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: letter
trans: n. 信；字母，文字；证书；文学，学问；字面意义,vt. 写字母于,vi. 写印刷体字母

sentences.chinese: 今天我收到梅拉妮的一封信。

sentences.english: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet.
sentences.chinese: 英语字母表有26个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail

trans: adj. 文字的；逐字的；无夸张的

trans: adv. 照字面地；逐字地；不夸张地；正确地；简直

sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

trans: n. 读写能力；精通文学

sentences.english: a new adult literacy campaign
sentences.chinese: 新一轮成人识字[扫盲]运动

detailed_translations.chinese: 识字， 有文化， 读写能力
detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to read and write

name: literary
trans: adj. 文学的；书面的；精通文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: literature
trans: n. 文学；文献；文艺；著作

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: in

sentences.english: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 碗橱里有一些糖。

sentences.english: My mother was in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里。

sentences.english: He took us for a drive in his new car.
sentences.chinese: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。

sentences.english: I found her sitting up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。

sentences.english: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。

sentences.english: a hole in the ground
sentences.chinese: 地上的一个洞

sentences.english: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
sentences.chinese: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。

sentences.english: My parents live in New Zealand now.
sentences.chinese: 我父母现住在新西兰。

sentences.english: I never went in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 我从不进酒吧。

detailed_translations.english: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

trans: adv. 出现；在外；出局；出声地；不流行地,adj. 外面的；出局的；下台的,n. 出局,prep. 向；离去,vi. 出来；暴露,vt. 使熄灭；驱逐

sentences.chinese: 她打开手提箱，拿出一双鞋。

sentences.english: Lock the door on your way out.

sentences.english: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.
sentences.chinese: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。

sentences.english: Out you go (= used to order someone to leave a room )!

sentences.english: When the sun came out, a rainbow formed in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 太阳出来时，天空中出现了一道彩虹。

detailed_translations.english: from inside an object, container, building, or place

name: inner
trans: n. 内部,adj. 内部的；内心的；精神的

sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.

trans: adj. 外面的，外部的；远离中心的,n. 环外命中

sentences.chinese: 内心的满足感

sentences.chinese: 内心的恐慌

sentences.chinese: 他推开前门，门呀的一声向里开了。

name: outward

sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

name: interior
trans: n. 内部；本质,adj. 内部的；国内的；本质的

sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

trans: n. 外部；表面；外型；外貌,adj. 外部的；表面的；外在的

sentences.english: an intimate relationship

sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

trans: n. 内脏；本质,adj. 内部的；里面的；体内的；（机构）内部的

sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: outdated
trans: adj. 过时的；旧式的,v. 使过时（outdate的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: outdated teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 不合时宜的教学方法

sentences.english: a factory with outdated equipment
sentences.chinese: 设备陈旧的工厂

sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

name: outdoors
trans: adv. 在户外,n. 户外,adj. 户外的（等于outdoor）

sentences.chinese: 今晚很暖和，可以在户外用餐。

sentences.chinese: 他喜欢在户外工作。

name: outlet

sentences.chinese: 污水排放口

sentences.english: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
sentences.chinese: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？

name: outlook
trans: n. 展望；观点；景色,vt. 比……好看；用目光压倒,vi. 朝外看

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: output
trans: n. 输出，输出量；产量；出产,vt. 输出

sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: outsider

sentences.english: I’m an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.
sentences.chinese: 我是个外人，是这群人里唯一的外国女人。

trans: adj. 完全的；彻底的；无条件的,vt. 发出，表达；发射

sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.chinese: 当务之急是弄清楚这些人出了什么事。

sentences.english: Security matters are treated with the utmost seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 安全问题受到极为严肃的对待。

sentences.english: The medical staff did their utmost(= tried as hard as they could ) to save the patient’s life.
sentences.chinese: 医护人员竭尽全力挽救那位病人的生命。

sentences.chinese: 我关掉电视时，孩子们都发出不满的抱怨声。

sentences.english: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
sentences.chinese: 理查德的笑话让你哭笑不得。

name: whisper
trans: n. 私语；谣传；飒飒的声音,vi. 耳语；密谈；飒飒地响,vt. 低声说出

sentences.chinese: 你不必轻声轻语，没人听得到我们说话。

sentences.english: ‘I’ve missed you,’ he whispered in her ear.
sentences.chinese: “我想你了。”他在她耳边低语道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice
to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice

name: howl
trans: n. 嗥叫；怒号；嚎哭,vt. 狂喊着说；对…吼叫,vi. 咆哮；怒吼；狂吠

sentences.english: wind howling in the trees
sentences.chinese: 在林间呼啸的风

sentences.chinese: 某个地方的一只狗突然嗥叫起来，对着月亮狂吠。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind howls, it makes a loud high sound as it blows
If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗥叫； 呼啸；吼叫； 哀号

name: roar
trans: n. 咆哮；吼；轰鸣,vi. 咆哮；吼叫；喧闹,vt. 咆哮；呼喊；使……轰鸣

sentences.chinese: 我们听到狮子在吼叫。

sentences.english: The engines roared.
sentences.chinese: 引擎轰鸣。

sentences.english: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
sentences.chinese: “从我家里滚出去！”他吼道。

sentences.english: the roar of the crowd
sentences.chinese: 人群的喊叫声

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep, very loud noise

trans: n. 渴望；抱负；送气；吸气；吸引术

trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.

sentences.chinese: 由于地理上的隔绝，该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

name: draw
trans: n. 平局；抽签,vi. 拉；拖,vt. 画；拉；吸引

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.chinese: 对外行的人来说，这些植物看起来都很相似。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

sentences.chinese: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

sentences.english: The game was relayed by satellite to audiences all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛通过卫星向全世界的观众进行了转播。

trans: conj. 仍然；但是；尽管如此,n. 寂静；剧照；蒸馏室,adj. 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的,adv. 仍然；更；静止地,vt. 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来,vi. 静止；平静；蒸馏

sentences.english: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
sentences.chinese: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。

sentences.chinese: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

detailed_translations.english: up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment

a photograph of a scene from a film

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来

name: stale

sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权； 优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: prioritize
trans: vt. 把…区分优先次序,vi. 把事情按优先顺序排好

sentences.english: You need to prioritize your tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first

name: prioritise
trans: vt. 给予...优先权；按优先顺序处理,vi. 把事情按优先顺序排好（等于prioritize）

name: primary
trans: n. 原色；最主要者,adj. 主要的；初级的；基本的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: prime
trans: n. 初期；青年；精华；全盛时期,adj. 主要的；最好的；基本的,vt. 使准备好；填装,vi. 作准备,adv. 极好地

sentences.english: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。

sentences.english: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。

sentences.english: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Good management is of prime importance in business.
sentences.chinese: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: most important
the time in your life when you are strongest and most active
to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

name: primitive
trans: n. 原始人,adj. 原始的，远古的；简单的，粗糙的

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: move
trans: n. 移动；步骤；迁居；策略,vi. 移动；搬家，迁移；离开,vt. 移动；感动

sentences.english: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.english: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

name: remove
trans: n. 移动；距离；搬家,vt. 移动，迁移；开除；调动,vi. 移动，迁移；搬家

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: removal
trans: n. 免职；移动；排除；搬迁

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: motor
trans: n. 发动机，马达；汽车,adj. 汽车的；机动的,vi. 乘汽车,vt. 以汽车载运

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: motorbike
trans: n. 摩托车

sentences.english: The motorbike is supposed to make annoying noise.
sentences.chinese: 摩托车当然会发出令人感到烦恼的噪音。

sentences.english: Some earlier witness reports cited by police or security officials had explosives being thrown from a motorbike or the upper storey's of an adjacent hotel.
sentences.chinese: 一些更早的证词报道引用警方或安全部门的话说，爆炸物从摩托车上扔下，或是从领进旅馆的楼上扔下来。

detailed_translations.english: a small fast two-wheeled vehicle with an engine

name: motorway
trans: n. 高速公路，汽车高速公路

sentences.english: They were bowling along the motorway at sixty miles per hour.
sentences.chinese: 他们以每小时60英里的速度在高速公路上飞驰。

sentences.english: Several cars piled up after ignoring the fog warning on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 由于无视高速公路上的大雾警告，有好几辆汽车相撞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 高速公路，汽车高速公路
detailed_translations.english: a very wide road for travelling fast over long distances, especially between cities

name: motel
trans: n. 汽车旅馆

sentences.english: Stay at a cheap motel.
sentences.chinese: 住便宜的汽车旅馆。

sentences.english: We can stay in a motel overnight, then continue on to Copenhagen tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在一家汽车旅馆过夜，然后明天再继续出发到哥本哈根。

sentences.english: A wide range of hotel, motel and apartment accommodation is available in most cities, major resorts and many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分城市、主要旅游点和许多农村地区，都能找到各种类型的旅馆、汽车旅馆和公寓住所。

detailed_translations.english: a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room

name: emotion
trans: n. 情感；情绪

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: emotional
trans: adj. 情绪的；易激动的；感动人的

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: motion
trans: n. 动作；移动；手势；请求；意向；议案,vi. 运动；打手势,vt. 运动；向…打手势

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的；主题,adj. 发动的；成为动机的,vt. 使产生动机，激起

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: motivation
trans: n. 动机；积极性；推动

name: motivated
trans: adj. 有动机的；有积极性的,v. 使产生动机；激发…的积极性（motivate的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The students are all highly motivated .
sentences.chinese: 学生们都有很高的积极性。

sentences.english: The key to a successful modern economy is a well-educated and motivated workforce.
sentences.chinese: 成功的现代经济关键是要有受过良好教育、积极主动的劳动力。

sentences.english: They are motivated by a need to achieve.
sentences.chinese: 他们被成功的需要激励着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen to do something or achieve something, especially because you find it interesting or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 使产生动机；激发…的积极性（motivate的过去式和过去分词）
detailed_translations.english: If you are motivated by something, especially an emotion, it causes you to behave in a particular way

name: promote
trans: vi. 成为王后或其他大于卒的子,vt. 促进；提升；推销；发扬

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: promotion
trans: n. 提升， 晋升；推销，促销；促进；发扬，振兴

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: remote
trans: n. 远程,adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: automate
trans: vt. 使自动化，使自动操作,vi. 自动化，自动操作

sentences.english: Cash machines automate two basic functions of a bank – deposits and withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 柜员机使银行的两个基本功能——存款和取款自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

name: automated
trans: adj. 自动化的；机械化的,v. 自动化（automate的过去分词）；自动操作

sentences.english: a highly automated factory
sentences.chinese: 高度自动化的工厂

sentences.english: The production process is now fully automated .
sentences.chinese: 生产流程现在全部自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

name: automatic
trans: n. 自动机械；自动手枪,adj. 自动的；无意识的；必然的

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: mobile
trans: adj. 可移动的；机动的；易变的；非固定的,n. 运动物体

sentences.english: mobile air-conditioners
sentences.chinese: 移动式空调器

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)
sentences.chinese: 流动商店 / 图书馆

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

name: automobile
trans: n. 汽车,vt. 驾驶汽车,

sentences.english: the automobile industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业

detailed_translations.english: a car

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: protection
trans: n. 保护；防卫；护照

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: protective
trans: adj. 防护的；关切保护的；保护贸易的

sentences.english: protective clothing
sentences.chinese: 防护服

sentences.english: Sunscreen provides a protective layer against the sun’s harmful rays.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜提供了一层抵挡阳光中有害光线的防护层。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended for protection

name: detect
trans: vt. 察觉；发现；探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: detection
trans: n. 侦查，探测；发觉，发现；察觉

sentences.english: ...the early detection of breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: …乳腺癌的早期发现。

detailed_translations.english: when something is found that is not easy to see, hear etc, or the process of looking for it

name: detective
trans: n. 侦探,adj. 侦探的

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

name: architect
trans: n. 建筑师,缔造者

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: architecture
trans: n. 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: clear
trans: n. 清除；空隙,adj. 清楚的；清澈的；晴朗的；无罪的,vt. 通过；清除；使干净；跳过,vi. 放晴；变清澈,adv. 清晰地；完全地

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

name: clearly
trans: adv. 清晰地；明显地；无疑地；明净地

sentences.english: Please speak clearly.
sentences.chinese: 请说得清楚点。

sentences.english: The economy was clearly failing.
sentences.chinese: 经济很明显在走下坡路。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is easy to see, hear, or understand

name: clear-cut
trans: adj. 清晰的；轮廓鲜明的

name: clarify
trans: vt. 澄清；阐明,vi. 得到澄清；变得明晰；得到净化

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: clarity
trans: n. 清楚，明晰；透明

sentences.english: Letters may be edited for length and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 信件可能要加以修改以求篇幅合适，意思明了。

sentences.english: a lack of clarity in the law on property rights
sentences.chinese: 产权法律含糊不清

detailed_translations.english: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

name: declare
trans: vt. 宣布，声明；断言，宣称,vi. 声明，宣布

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: declaration
trans: n. （纳税品等的）申报；宣布；公告；申诉书

sentences.english: to issue/sign a declaration
sentences.chinese: 发布 / 签署公告

sentences.english: the declaration of war
sentences.chinese: 宣战

sentences.english: the Declaration of Independence (= of the United States)
sentences.chinese: （美国）独立宣言

detailed_translations.english: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement

name: model

sentences.chinese: 他因有违职业道德的行为被停职六个月。

trans: vi. 免除，豁免,vt. 分配，分发；免除；执行

sentences.chinese: 取款机

detailed_translations.english: to give something to people, especially in fixed amounts
