sentences.chinese: 穿着考究的老妇人

sentences.english: The elderly are a formidable force in any election.
sentences.chinese: 老年人在任何选举中都是一股强大的力量。

detailed_translations.english: used as a polite way of saying that someone is old or becoming old

detailed_translations.chinese: 到了晚年的人， 老年人
detailed_translations.english: The elderly are people who are old

name: adolescent
trans: n. 青少年,adj. 青春期的；未成熟的

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除，废止；取消，革除

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: abolition
trans: n. 废除；废止

sentences.english: The abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean closely followed the pattern of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 巴西和加勒比海地区对奴隶制的废除很大程度上遵循了美国的模式。

detailed_translations.english: when a law or a system is officially ended

name: sheer
trans: n. 偏航；透明薄织物,adj. 绝对的；透明的；峻峭的；纯粹的,vt. 使偏航；使急转向,adv. 完全；陡峭地,vi. 偏航

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

name: drown
trans: vt. 淹没；把…淹死,vi. 淹死；溺死

sentences.english: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。

sentences.english: Jane was drowned in the river.
sentences.chinese: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

detailed_translations.english: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

name: moist
trans: adj. 潮湿的；多雨的；含泪的,n. 潮湿

sentences.english: Make sure the soil is moist before planting the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 播种之前要确保土壤湿润。

sentences.english: a rich, moist chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 香浓软润的巧克力蛋糕

sentences.english: warm moist air
sentences.chinese: 温暖湿润的空气

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist (= she was almost crying ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛湿润了。

detailed_translations.english: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

name: moisture
trans: n. 水分；湿度；潮湿；降雨量

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: odds
trans: n. 几率；胜算；不平等；差别

sentences.english: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.english: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.chinese: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.english: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.chinese: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

detailed_translations.english: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

name: slap
trans: n. 掴；侮辱；掌击；拍打声,vt. 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光,vi. 掴；拍击,adv. 直接地；猛然地；恰好

sentences.english: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光
detailed_translations.english: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound
a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

name: thrust
trans: n.  推力；刺,vt. 插；插入；推挤,vi. 插入；用向某人刺去；猛然或用力推

sentences.english: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
sentences.chinese: 他往后一闪，躲避再次捅来的一刀。

sentences.english: She thrust her way into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她挤进了人群。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way

name: sphere
trans: n. 范围；球体,adj. 球体的,vt. 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

name: bet
trans: n. 打赌，赌注；被打赌的事物,vt. 打赌；敢断定，确信,vi. 打赌

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

detailed_translations.english: to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event
an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

name: cue
trans: n. 提示，暗示；线索,vt. 给…暗示

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

name: phase
trans: n. 月相,n. （月亮的）盈亏,n. 时期

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: cope
trans: n. 长袍,vi. 处理；对付；竞争

sentences.english: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

name: grab
trans: n. 攫取；霸占；夺取之物,vt. 攫取；霸占；将…深深吸引,vi. 攫取；夺取

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: gross
trans: n. 总额，总数,adj. 总共的；粗野的；恶劣的；显而易见的,vt. 总共收入

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: leap
trans: vi. 跳，跳跃,n. 飞跃；跳跃,vt. 跳跃，跳过；使跃过

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

name: melt
trans: vi. 熔化，溶解；渐混,vt. 使融化；使熔化；使软化；使感动,n. 熔化；熔化物

sentences.english: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.english: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

detailed_translations.english: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

name: mere
trans: adj. 仅仅的；只不过的,n. 小湖；池塘

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

name: nasty
trans: adj. 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的,n. 令人不快的事物,性的吸引力

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: rod
trans: n. 棒；惩罚；枝条；权力

sentences.english: a measuring rod
sentences.chinese: 测量杆

detailed_translations.english: a long thin pole or bar

name: soak
trans: n. 浸；湿透；大雨,vi. 浸泡；渗透,vt. 吸收，吸入；沉浸在（工作或学习中）；使……上下湿透

sentences.english: Soak the clothes in cold water.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。

sentences.english: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
sentences.chinese: 把锅泡着吧，我过一会儿再洗。

detailed_translations.english: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

name: industry
trans: n. 产业；工业；勤勉

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: break
trans: vi. 打破；折断；弄坏；削弱,vt. （使）破；打破（纪录）；（常指好天气）突变；开始,vi. （嗓音）突变；突破；破晓；（价格）突然下跌,n. 破裂；间断；（持续一段时间的状况的）改变；间歇

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: drive
trans: n. 驱动器；驾车； 内驱力，推进力；快车道,vi. 开车；猛击；飞跑,vt. 推动，发动（机器等）；驾驶（马车，汽车等）；驱赶

sentences.english: Can you drive?
sentences.chinese: 你会开车吗？

sentences.english: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。

sentences.english: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.chinese: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

detailed_translations.english: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

name: head
trans: n. 头；头痛；上端；最前的部分；理解力,adj. 头的；主要的；在顶端的,vt. 前进；用头顶；作为…的首领；站在…的前头；给…加标题,vi. 出发；成头状物；船驶往

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的头顶。

sentences.english: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们一头跳进水中。

sentences.english: She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
sentences.chinese: 他依然满头浓发。

sentences.english: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

name: wake
trans: n. 尾迹；守夜；守丧,vt. 叫醒；激发,vi. 醒来；唤醒；警觉

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: rank
trans: n. 排；等级；军衔；队列,adj. 讨厌的；恶臭的；繁茂的,vt. 排列；把…分等,vi. 列为；列队

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: wake
trans: n. 尾迹；守夜；守丧,vt. 叫醒；激发,vi. 醒来；唤醒；警觉

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: hold
trans: n. 控制；保留,vi. 支持；有效；持续,vt. 持有；拥有；保存；拘留；约束或控制,又作“Hold住”使用，中英混用词汇，表示轻松掌控全局。,

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

name: capital
trans: n. 首都，省会；资金；大写字母；资本家,adj. 首都的；重要的；大写的

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: cape
trans: n.  海角，岬；披肩

sentences.english: ...a woollen cape.
sentences.chinese: …一件羊毛披肩。

sentences.english: Cape Cod
sentences.chinese: 科德角

detailed_translations.english: a long loose piece of clothing without sleeves that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

name: captain
trans: n. 队长，首领；船长；上尉；海军上校,vt. 指挥；率领

sentences.english: The captain and crew welcome you aboard.
sentences.chinese: 机长和全体机组人员欢迎各位乘坐本次航班。

sentences.english: He captained the winning team in 1991.
sentences.chinese: 他于1991年率队夺得胜利。

detailed_translations.english: the sailor in charge of a ship, or the pilot in charge of an aircraft
If you captain a team or a ship, you are the captain of it

name: caption
trans: n. 标题；字幕；说明；逮捕,vt. 加上说明；加上标题

sentences.english: The local paper featured me standing on a stepladder with a caption, "Wendy climbs the ladder to success."
sentences.chinese: 当地的报纸刊登了一幅我站在活梯上的特写，下面写着：“温迪登上了成功之梯。”

detailed_translations.english: words printed above or below a picture in a book or newspaper or on a television screen to explain what the picture is showing

name: escape
trans: n. 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏,vi. 逃脱；避开；溜走；（气体，液体等）漏出；（未受伤或只受了一点伤害而）逃脱；声音（不自觉地）由…发出,vt. 逃避，避开，避免；被忘掉；被忽视

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: capture
trans: n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏,vt. 俘获；夺得；捕捉，拍摄,录制

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: capable
trans: adj. 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: capability
trans: n. 才能，能力；性能，容量

sentences.english: the country’s manufacturing capability
sentences.chinese: 该国的生产能力

sentences.english: I can speak French, but simultaneous translation is beyond my capabilities (= too difficult ).
sentences.chinese: 我能讲法语，但是同声传译我做不了。

detailed_translations.english: the natural ability, skill, or power that makes a machine, person, or organization able to do something, especially something difficult

name: capacity
trans: n. 能力；容量；资格，地位；生产力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: cabin
trans: n. 小屋；客舱；船舱,vt. 把…关在小屋里,vi. 住在小屋里

sentences.english: a log cabin
sentences.chinese: 原木小屋

sentences.english: 英文例句He showed her to a small cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他把她带到一间小房舱。

sentences.english: He sat quietly in the first class cabin of the flight looking tired.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地坐在班机的头等舱内，看上去有些疲惫。

detailed_translations.english: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

name: cabinet
trans: n. 内阁；橱柜；展览艺术品的小陈列室,adj. 内阁的；私下的，秘密的

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: prison
trans: n. 监狱；监禁；拘留所,vt. 监禁，关押

sentences.english: He visits his dad in prison every week.
sentences.chinese: 他每周都去探望狱中的父亲。

sentences.english: Ricky has been out of prison for three years now.
sentences.chinese: 里基现已出狱三年。

sentences.english: They’ll probably put him in prison for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他们很可能会让他在监狱里待很长时间。

sentences.english: Helen was sent to prison for attacking a man with a knife.
sentences.chinese: 海伦因持刀袭击一名男子而被送入监狱。

sentences.english: The two men were arrested only a week after they were released from prison .
sentences.chinese: 那两名男子从监狱获释后仅仅一周就被捕了。

sentences.english: Three terrorists escaped from Brixton Prison .
sentences.chinese: 有三名恐怖分子从布里克斯顿监狱越狱了。

sentences.english: an increase in the number of women going to prison
sentences.chinese: 入狱女性人数的增多

sentences.english: Mr Gunn received a ten year prison sentence .
sentences.chinese: 冈恩先生获刑十年。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime, or while they are waiting to go to court for their  trial

name: prisoner
trans: n. 囚犯，犯人；俘虏；刑事被告

sentences.english: He was being held prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他正遭囚禁。

sentences.english: Our pilot was taken prisoner .
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员被抓起来了。

sentences.english: The army advanced, taking 200,000 prisoners .
sentences.chinese: 军队向前推进，抓获20万名俘虏。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taken by force and kept somewhere

name: comprise
trans: vt. 包含；由…组成

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: enterprise
trans: n. 企业；事业；进取心；事业心

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: distinguish
trans: vi. 区别，区分；辨别,vt. 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinct
trans: adj. 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 有特色的，与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: extinguish
trans: vt. 熄灭；压制；偿清

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的,vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: succeed
trans: vi. 成功；继承；继任；兴旺,vt. 继承；接替；继…之后

sentences.english: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性，而且差一点就成功了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you tried or wanted to do
to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else

name: success
trans: n. 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: succession
trans: n. 连续；继位；继承权； 演替

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

name: successful
trans: adj. 成功的；一帆风顺的

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: successive
trans: adj. 连续的；继承的；依次的；接替的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: success
trans: n. 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

trans: n. 继承者；后续的事物

sentences.chinese: 他制定出了几条原则,希望能指导其继任者。

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
detailed_translations.english: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

trans: n. 工匠；技工；男工

sentences.chinese: 在大学广场工人们正在筑一个钢栅栏。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does physical work such as building, repairing things etc

trans: n. 同事；工友

sentences.chinese: 超过80%的有过偷情史的人都是从跟一些人以“仅仅是朋友”开始的，并且多数是同事。

sentences.english: The link between a positive workmate relationship and the risk of mortality was most notable among those aged between 38 and 43.
sentences.chinese: 与同事建立积极关系和死亡风险之间的联系在38到43岁人群当中最为显著。

sentences.english: The report found more than a fifth of employees have recently confided in a colleague, while a similar number said they would turn to a workmate first.
sentences.chinese: 研究报告指出，超过五分之一的员工最近曾向一位同事倾吐秘密，另外有同样数量的人说他们会最先向同事倾诉。

name: workplace
trans: n. 工作场所；车间

sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

trans: n. 车间；研讨会；工场；讲习班

sentences.english: a modestly equipped workshop.
sentences.chinese: 一个装备普通的车间。

detailed_translations.english: a room or building where tools and machines are used for making or repairing things

name: artwork
trans: n. 艺术品；插图；美术品

sentences.chinese: 该博物馆藏有6000件现当代艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: paintings and other objects produced by artists

trans: n. 框架，骨架；结构，构架

sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

name: network
trans: n. 网络；广播网；网状物

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

trans: n. 锻炼；练习；试验

trans: vi. 团结；联合；混合,vt. 使…混合；使…联合；使…团结

sentences.english: Our goal is to unite the opposition parties and defeat the President.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是联合各反对党挫败总统。

detailed_translations.english: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

trans: vi. 重聚；再结合；再联合,vt. 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合

sentences.chinese: 乐队将重聚作美国巡演。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合
detailed_translations.english: to come together again or to bring people, parts of an organization, political party, or country together again

name: union
trans: n. 联盟，协会；工会；联合

sentences.english: Are you planning to join the union?
sentences.chinese: 你打算加入工会吗？

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["union members"]}
sentences.chinese: 工会会员

detailed_translations.english: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

name: reunion
trans: n. 重聚；（班级或学校的）同学会，同窗会

sentences.chinese: 一年一度的聚会

sentences.english: a family reunion
sentences.chinese: 家庭聚会

sentences.english: a high-school reunion
sentences.chinese: 高中同学联谊聚会

detailed_translations.english: a social meeting of people who have not met for a long time, especially people who were at school or college together

name: unify
trans: vt. 统一；使相同，使一致

sentences.english: Strong support for the war has unified the nation.
sentences.chinese: 对战争的坚决支持使这个国家团结了起来。

sentences.english: His music unifies traditional and modern themes.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐结合了传统和现代的主题。

detailed_translations.english: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit

name: unification
trans: n. 统一；一致；联合

sentences.chinese: …欧洲统一进程。

detailed_translations.english: the act of combining two or more groups, countries etc to make a single group or country

trans: vt. 使重新统一；再统一，再联合

name: reunification
trans: n. 重新统一；重新团结

name: unity
trans: n. 团结；一致；联合；个体

sentences.english: economic unity
sentences.chinese: 经济统一

sentences.english: European unity
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的一体化

detailed_translations.english: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物,adj. 独特的，稀罕的； 唯一的，独一无二的

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

name: close
trans: n. 结束,adj. 紧密的；亲密的；亲近的,vt. 关；结束；使靠近,vi. 关；结束；关闭,adv. 紧密地

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.english: She closed the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.english: Let me do the car door – it won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.english: Beth closed her eyes and tried to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

detailed_translations.english: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

name: closure
trans: n. 关闭；终止，结束,vt. 使终止

sentences.english: Several military bases are threatened with closure .
sentences.chinese: 几处军事基地面临关闭。

detailed_translations.english: when a factory, school, hospital etc has to close permanently

name: closet
trans: n. 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间,adj. 秘密的，私下的；空谈的,vt. 把…关在私室中

sentences.english: a closet full of beautiful clothes
sentences.chinese: 满是漂亮衣服的壁橱

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间
detailed_translations.english: a cupboard built into the wall of a room from the floor to the ceiling
to shut someone in a room away from other people in order to discuss something private, to be alone etc

name: disclose
trans: vt. 公开；揭露

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: enclose
trans: vt. 围绕；装入；放入封套

sentences.english: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
sentences.chinese: 请随订单附上支票。

sentences.english: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
sentences.chinese: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。

name: include
trans: vt. 包含，包括

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: inclusion
trans: n. 包含；内含物

sentences.english: With the recent inclusions, there will be 28 delegates in all.
sentences.chinese: 连同新近加入的成员，总共将有28位代表。

name: inclusive
trans: adj. 包括的，包含的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: exclusion
trans: n. 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: exclusive
trans: n. 独家新闻；独家经营的项目；排外者,adj. 独有的；排外的；专一的

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: conclude
trans: vi. 推断；断定；决定,vt. 推断；决定，作结论；结束

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: conclusion
trans: n. 结论；结局；推论

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: conclusive
trans: adj. 决定性的；最后的；确实的；确定性的

sentences.english: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师们声称没有任何发生过谋杀的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的； 最后的； 决定性的
detailed_translations.english: showing that something is definitely true

name: inconclusive
trans: adj. 不确定的；非决定性的；无结果的

sentences.english: The evidence against the two men was inconclusive.
sentences.chinese: 针对这两个人的不利证据并不令人信服。

sentences.english: A coalition government was formed after inconclusive elections.
sentences.chinese: 选举没有结果，于是成立了一个联合政府。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不确定的；非决定性的；无结果的
detailed_translations.english: not leading to a clear decision or result

name: sit
trans: vi. 坐；位于,vt. 使就座

sentences.english: The parliament building sits in a large square.
sentences.chinese: 议会大楼位于一个大广场上。

sentences.english: He’s got a computer sitting on his desk, but he doesn’t use it.
sentences.chinese: 他有一台电脑放在书桌上，但他不用。

sentences.english: My climbing boots were sitting unused in a cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 我的登山靴在橱柜里，一直没有穿。

sentences.english: The house has sat empty for two years.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子已经空置两年了。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or condition

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sit)人名；(东南亚国家华语)硕；(罗)西特

name: site
trans: n. 地点；位置；场所,vt. 设置；为…选址

sentences.english: an archaeological site
sentences.chinese: 考古现场

detailed_translations.english: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

name: website
trans: n. 网站（全球资讯网的主机站）

sentences.english: For more information on weight loss and healthy eating, visit our website.
sentences.chinese: 有关减肥和健康饮食的更多信息，请访问我们的网站。

detailed_translations.chinese: 网站（全球资讯网的主机站）
detailed_translations.english: a place on the Internet where you can find information about something, especially a particular organization

name: situate
trans: adj. 位于…的,vt. 使位于；使处于

sentences.english: How do we situate Christianity in the context of modern physics and psychology?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何将基督教置于现代物理学和心理学的背景中呢？

detailed_translations.english: If you situate something such as an idea or fact in a particular context, you relate it to that context, especially in order to understand it better

name: situation
trans: n. 情况；形势；处境；位置

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: reside
trans: vi. 住，居住；属于

sentences.english: He spent most of his time in Rutherglen, where his family resided.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分时间都在拉瑟格伦度过，他的家人就在那里居住。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: residence
trans: n. 住宅，住处；居住

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: resident
trans: n. 居民；住院医生,adj. 居住的；定居的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: residential
trans: adj. 住宅的；与居住有关的

sentences.english: a quiet residential neighbourhood
sentences.chinese: 安静的住宅区

detailed_translations.chinese: 居住的， 住宅的； 寄宿的， 住在住所的
detailed_translations.english: a residential part of a town consists of private houses, with no offices or factories

name: saddle
trans: n. 鞍，鞍状物；车座；拖具,vt. 承受；使负担；装以马鞍,vi. 跨上马鞍

sentences.english: It is no surprise that she could saddle the horses.
sentences.chinese: 她能给马备鞍并没有什么值得惊讶的。

sentences.english: Thee bike's frame, wheels, handlebars and saddle are all made of cardboard in this way, and then fitted together.
sentences.chinese: 自行车的车架、车轮、车把和车座都用以此方式制造的纸板制成，然后组装在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a leather seat that you sit on when you ride a horse
to put a saddle on a horse

name: lift
trans: vt. 举起；提升；鼓舞；空运；抄袭,vi. 消散；升起；耸立,n. 电梯；举起；起重机；搭车

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: elevate
trans: vt. 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: elevator
trans: n. 电梯；升降机；升降舵；起卸机

sentences.english: We’ll have to take the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好坐电梯了。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building

name: alleviate
trans: vt. 减轻，缓和

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: relief
trans: n. 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: grave
trans: n. 墓穴，坟墓；死亡,adj. 重大的；严肃的；黯淡的,vt. 雕刻；铭记

sentences.english: Matthew’s life is in grave danger .
sentences.chinese: 马修的生命危在旦夕。

sentences.english: The report expressed grave concern over the technicians’ lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 报告中对技术人员缺乏培训深表忧虑。

sentences.english: I have grave doubts about his ability.
sentences.chinese: 我十分怀疑他的能力。

sentences.english: The situation is becoming very grave.
sentences.chinese: 形势变得非常严峻。

detailed_translations.english: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad
the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: gravitation
trans: n. 重力；万有引力；地心吸力

sentences.english: Newton’s law of gravitation
sentences.chinese: 牛顿万有引力定律

detailed_translations.chinese: 重力；万有引力；地心吸力
detailed_translations.english: the force that causes two objects such as  planets  to move towards each other because of their  mass

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: shift
trans: n. 移动；变化；手段；轮班,vt. 转移；改变；替换,vi. 移动；转变；转换

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: grant
trans: n. 拨款； 授予物,vt. 授予；允许；承认,vi. 同意

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: spill
trans: n. 溢出，溅出；溢出量；摔下；小塞子,vi. 溢出，流出；摔下；涌流,vt. 使溢出，使流出；使摔下

sentences.english: Katie almost spilled her milk.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂差点把牛奶洒出来。

detailed_translations.english: if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container
if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container

name: cling
trans: vi. 坚持，墨守；紧贴；附着

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: reap
trans: vt. 收获，获得；收割,vi. 收割，收获

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

name: spite
trans: n. 不顾；恶意；怨恨,vt. 刁难；使恼怒

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.english: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.chinese: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.english: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.english: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.chinese: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or prevented by something
to deliberately annoy or upset someone

name: gaze
trans: n. 凝视；注视,vi. 凝视；注视

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: penetrate
trans: vi. 渗透；刺入；看透,vt. 渗透；穿透；洞察

sentences.english: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
sentences.chinese: 穿过厚装甲的子弹

sentences.english: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

name: jail
trans: n. 监狱；监牢；拘留所,vt. 监禁；下狱

sentences.english: He’s been in jail for three months already.
sentences.chinese: 他已经入狱三个月。

detailed_translations.english: a place where criminals are kept as part of their punishment, or where people who have been charged with a crime are kept before they are judged in a law court

name: reckon
trans: vi. 估计；计算；猜想，料想,vt. 测算，估计；认为；计算

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: ultimate
trans: n. 终极；根本；基本原则,adj. 最终的；极限的；根本的

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: ultimately
trans: adv. 最后；根本；基本上

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

name: harsh
trans: adj. 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: triumph
trans: n. 胜利，凯旋；欢欣,vi. 获得胜利，成功

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: innocent
trans: n. 天真的人；笨蛋,adj. 无辜的；无罪的；无知的

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

name: tie
trans: n. 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负,vi. 打结；不分胜负；被用带（或绳子等）系住,vt. 系；约束；打结；与…成平局

sentences.english: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.
sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points

detailed_translations.chinese: 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men

name: means
trans: n. 手段；方法；财产,v. 意思是；打算（mean的第三人称单数）

sentences.english: The only means of communication was sign language.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.english: The window was our only means of escape .
sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.english: Do you have any means of identification ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: art as a means of expression
sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: monitor
trans: n. 监视器；监听器；监控器；显示屏；班长,vt. 监控

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；时髦人物,vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: cross
trans: n. 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物,adj. 交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的,vt. 杂交；渡过；使相交,vi. 交叉；杂交；横过

sentences.english: The by-pass crosses Wilton Lane shortly after a roundabout.
sentences.chinese: 这条旁道绕过环岛后不久就和威尔顿巷相交。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物
detailed_translations.english: an upright post of wood with another crossing it near the top, that people in the past were fastened to with nails and left to die on as a punishment
if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的
detailed_translations.english: angry or annoyed

name: bill
trans: n.  法案；广告；账单； 票据；钞票；清单,vt. 宣布；开账单；用海报宣传

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: tip
trans: n. 小费；尖端；小建议，小窍门；轻拍,vt. 给小费；倾斜；翻倒；装顶端,vi. 给小费；翻倒；倾覆

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
