sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: competitive
trans: adj. 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: competitiveness
trans: n. 竞争力，好竞争

sentences.english: New machinery has enhanced the company’s productivity and competitiveness.
sentences.chinese: 新机器帮助公司提高了生产力，增强了竞争力。

sentences.english: Europe’s competitiveness in international markets
sentences.chinese: 欧洲在国际市场上的竞争力

detailed_translations.english: the ability of a company, country, or a product to compete with others

name: complain
trans: vi. 投诉；发牢骚；诉说,vt. 抱怨；控诉

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨；诉苦；疾病；委屈

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: confirmation
trans: n. 确认；证实；证明；批准

sentences.english: There has still been no official confirmation of the report.
sentences.chinese: 这则报道仍未得到官方证实。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, document etc that says that something is definitely true

name: continue
trans: vt. 继续说…；使…继续；使…延长,vi. 继续，延续；仍旧，连续

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

name: continual
trans: adj. 持续不断的；频繁的

sentences.english: five weeks of continual rain
sentences.chinese: 持续了五个星期的降雨

sentences.english: the Japanese business philosophy of continual improvement
sentences.chinese: 日本人精益求精的经营哲学

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time without stopping

name: cost
trans: n. 费用，代价，成本；损失,vt. 花费；使付出；使花许多钱,vi. 花费

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

name: costly
trans: adj. 昂贵的；代价高的

sentences.english: Such a database would be extremely costly to set up.
sentences.chinese: 建立这样一个数据库要花很多钱。

sentences.english: His delay in making a decision could prove costly in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 他的优柔寡断长久下去要付出巨大代价。

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, especially wasting a lot of money

name: cover
trans: n. 封面，封皮；盖子；掩蔽物;幌子，借口,vt. 包括；采访，报导；涉及,vi. 覆盖；代替

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: uncover
trans: vt. 发现；揭开；揭露,vi. 发现；揭示；揭去盖子

sentences.english: When the seedlings sprout, uncover the tray.
sentences.chinese: 幼苗发芽后，揭开盘上的遮盖物。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something

name: create
trans: vt. 创造，创作；造成

sentences.english: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为引起了很多问题。

sentences.english: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这家新工厂预计能创造400多个新的就业机会。

sentences.english: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
sentences.chinese: 那通告反而引起了混乱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: creative
trans: adj. 创造性的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: creativity
trans: n. 创造力；创造性

sentences.english: artistic creativity
sentences.chinese: 艺术创造力

sentences.english: Teachers have been attacked for stifling creativity in their pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师被批评压抑了学生的创造力。

sentences.english: Editors complain about the lack of creativity in the ideas put to them.
sentences.chinese: 编辑们抱怨说交给他们的选题缺乏创意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things etc

name: creation
trans: n. 创造，创作；创作物，产物

sentences.english: a job creation scheme
sentences.chinese: 创造就业机会的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创建； 创造的作品， 产物； 宇宙， 天地万物
detailed_translations.english: the act of creating something

name: credible
trans: adj. 可靠的，可信的

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: incredible
trans: adj. 难以置信的，惊人的

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: criticize
trans: vi. 批评；评论；苛求,vt. 批评；评论；非难

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: criticise
trans: vt. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难,vi. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

name: criticism
trans: n. 批评；考证；苛求

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: cruel
trans: adj. 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

name: cruelty
trans: n. 残酷；残忍；残酷的行为

sentences.english: The children had suffered cruelty and neglect.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子遭受虐待，无人照管。

sentences.english: There was a hint of cruelty in Brian’s smile.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩的微笑里流露出一丝残暴。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培,vt.  培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: cultural
trans: adj. 文化的；教养的

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

name: curious
trans: adj. 好奇的，有求知欲的；古怪的；爱挑剔的

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: curiosity
trans: n. 好奇，好奇心；珍品，古董，古玩

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

name: custom
trans: n. 习惯，惯例；风俗；海关，关税；经常光顾；（经常性的）顾客,adj. （衣服等）定做的，定制的

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

name: accustom
trans: vt. 使习惯于

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

name: danger
trans: n. 危险；危险物，威胁

sentences.english: Danger! No boats beyond this point.
sentences.chinese: 危险！船只不可越过此处。

sentences.english: The refugees believe that their lives are in danger .
sentences.chinese: 难民认为他们有生命危险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed

name: endanger
trans: vt. 危及；使遭到危险

sentences.english: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

name: dead
trans: n. 死者,adj. 无生命的；呆板的；废弃了的,adv. 完全地

sentences.english: Her mother had been dead for ten years.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲去世十年了。

sentences.english: Police are trying to contact the family of the dead man.
sentences.chinese: 警方在设法与死者的家属联系。

sentences.english: a pile of dead leaves
sentences.chinese: 一堆枯叶

sentences.english: the dead body of a young soldier
sentences.chinese: 一名年轻士兵的尸体

sentences.english: Two men were shot dead by terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子遭恐怖分子枪杀。

sentences.english: Magnus was found dead in his car.
sentences.chinese: 马格纳斯被人发现死在他自己的车里。

sentences.english: One man is still missing, presumed dead .
sentences.chinese: 仍有一人失踪，被推定已经死亡。

sentences.english: He suddenly had a heart attack and dropped dead .
sentences.chinese: 他突发心脏病猝死。

sentences.english: She was pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 到达医院时她被宣告已经死亡。

sentences.english: His fellow climbers had left him for dead on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 他的登山伙伴以为他已死，便把他留在山上走了。

sentences.english: We didn’t know if she was dead or alive.
sentences.chinese: 我们不知道她是死是活。

sentences.english: When they found him he was more dead than alive .
sentences.chinese: 他们发现他的时候，他已奄奄一息。

sentences.english: Her parents were long dead .
sentences.chinese: 她父母早就去世了。

detailed_translations.english: no longer alive

name: deadly
trans: adj. 致命的；非常的；死一般的,adv. 非常；如死一般地

sentences.english: a deadly poison
sentences.chinese: 致命的毒药

sentences.english: a deadly weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命武器

sentences.english: His face had a deadly paleness.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸死一般的苍白。

detailed_translations.english: likely to cause death

name: delight
trans: n. 高兴,vt. 使高兴,vi. 高兴

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: delightful
trans: adj. 可爱的，可喜的；讨人喜欢的；令人愉快的

sentences.english: a delightful little girl
sentences.chinese: 讨人喜欢的小女孩

sentences.english: The whole house is delightful.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子舒适宜人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可爱的，可喜的；讨人喜欢的；令人愉快的
detailed_translations.english: very pleasant

name: democracy
trans: n. 民主，民主主义；民主政治

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: democratic
trans: adj. 民主的；民主政治的；大众的

sentences.english: a democratic government
sentences.chinese: 民主政府

sentences.english: the role of the media in the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 民主进程中媒体的作用

detailed_translations.english: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

name: dense
trans: adj. 稠密的；浓厚的；愚钝的

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: density
trans: n. 密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: condense
trans: vt. 使浓缩；使压缩,vi. 浓缩；凝结

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: desire
trans: n. 欲望；要求，心愿；性欲,vt. 想要；要求；希望得到…,vi. 渴望

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

name: desirable
trans: n. 合意的人或事物,adj. 令人满意的；值得要的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: different
trans: adj. 不同的；个别的，与众不同的

sentences.english: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.english: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.english: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.english: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.chinese: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.english: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.english: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: not like something or someone else, or not like before

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: disappoint
trans: vt. 使失望

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: disappointing
trans: adj. 令人失望的；令人扫兴的,v. 令人失望（disappoint的ing形式）；辜负…的期望

sentences.english: disappointing profit figures
sentences.chinese: 令人失望的盈利数字

sentences.english: The Lakers’ loss in the playoffs was very disappointing.
sentences.chinese: 湖人队在季后赛中的失利令人十分失望。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人失望的；令人扫兴的
detailed_translations.english: not as good as you hoped or expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人失望（disappoint的ing形式）；辜负…的期望

name: do
trans: vi. 行，足够；生长,n. 要求；规定；C大调音阶中的第一音,v. 做；干；学习；研究；进行；完成；解答；整理；算出；引起；行过,aux. 助动词（构成疑问句和否定句）；（代替动词）；（用于加强语气）,n. （口语）事件；（主英国口语）诈骗；（主英国、新西兰口语）宴会；（口语）必须做到的事情

sentences.english: ‘Will Kay come?’ ‘She may do.’
sentences.chinese: “凯来吗？” “或许吧。”

sentences.english: So now you know as much as I do.
sentences.chinese: 那么现在你知道的和我一样多了。

sentences.english: ‘You forgot all about it.’ ‘No, I didn’t.’
sentences.chinese: “你把这事忘记得一干二净。” “没有，我没忘记。”

sentences.english: ‘I want to go home.’ ‘So do I.’
sentences.chinese: “我想回家。” “我也是。”

sentences.english: I didn’t believe the story and neither did he.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信这个故事，他也不信。

detailed_translations.english: used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used
used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used

name: undo
trans: vt. 取消；解开；破坏；扰乱,vi. 撤消

sentences.english: The screws can be undone by hand.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。

sentences.english: I undid the package carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地打开包裹。

sentences.english: He undid most of the good work of the previous manager.
sentences.chinese: 他把前任经理的大部分功绩都毁掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

name: donate
trans: n. 捐赠；捐献,vt. 捐赠；捐献,vi. 捐赠；捐献

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: donation
trans: n. 捐款，捐赠物；捐赠

sentences.english: There have been generous donations from EU funds.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟基金给予了慷慨的捐款。

detailed_translations.english: something, especially money, that you give to a person or an organ-ization in order to help them

name: doubt
trans: n. 怀疑；疑问；疑惑,v. 怀疑；不信；恐怕；拿不准

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: doubtful
trans: adj. 可疑的；令人生疑的；疑心的；不能确定的

sentences.english: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 持久和平的前景难料。

sentences.english: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful .
sentences.chinese: “一切都会顺顺当当的，你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

detailed_translations.english: probably not true or not likely to happen

name: undoubtedly
trans: adv. 确实地，毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: drama
trans: n. 戏剧，戏剧艺术；剧本；戏剧性事件

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: dramatic
trans: adj. 戏剧的；急剧的；引人注目的；激动人心的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: dry
trans: n. 干涸,adj. 干的；口渴的；枯燥无味的；禁酒的,vt. 把…弄干,vi. 变干

sentences.english: I need to change into some dry clothes .
sentences.chinese: 我要换上干衣服。

sentences.english: Make sure that the surface is clean and dry before you start to paint.
sentences.chinese: 油漆之前一定先要确保表面清洁干燥。

sentences.english: You should store disks in a cool, dry place.
sentences.chinese: 你应该把磁盘存放在阴凉干燥的地方。

sentences.english: The path is dry as a bone (= very dry ) .
sentences.chinese: 这条小道很干燥。

detailed_translations.english: without water or liquid inside or on the surface

name: dryer
trans: n. 烘干机； 干燥剂

sentences.english: Unlike other clothes, you cannot use a dryer for fireproofing a cloth.
sentences.chinese: 不像其他的衣服，你不能用烘干机把防火衣烘干。

sentences.english: Oh, that sweet day when I moved into an apartment with a washer/dryer connection!
sentences.chinese: 哦，当我搬进一座有洗衣机/烘干机连接着的公寓时，是多少甜蜜的一天。

detailed_translations.chinese: 烘干机；[助剂] 干燥剂
detailed_translations.english: a machine that dries things, especially clothes

name: drought
trans: n. 干旱；缺乏

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: easy
trans: adj. 容易的；舒适的,vt. 发出停划命令,adv. 不费力地，从容地,vi. 停止划桨

sentences.english: The test was easy.
sentences.chinese: 考试很容易。

sentences.english: Finishing the task will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.english: There must be an easier way to do that.
sentences.chinese: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

sentences.english: instructions that are easy to follow
sentences.chinese: 易于掌握的使用说明

sentences.english: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

sentences.english: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

sentences.english: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，爸爸过着安逸舒适的生活。

sentences.english: You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们都离开了家，你日子可以过得轻松了。

detailed_translations.english: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

name: uneasy
trans: adj. 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: ease
trans: n. 轻松，舒适；安逸，悠闲,vt. 减轻，缓和；使安心,vi. 减轻，缓和；放松；灵活地移动

sentences.english: She lived a life of ease.
sentences.chinese: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划对城里的交通拥挤状况应该有所缓解。

detailed_translations.english: lack of difficulty
to become or to make sth less unpleasant, painful, severe, etc.

name: editor
trans: n. 编者，编辑；社论撰写人；编辑装置

sentences.english: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编

detailed_translations.english: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

name: edit
trans: vt. 编辑；校订,n. 编辑工作

sentences.english: a collection of essays edited by John Gay
sentences.chinese: 由约翰·盖伊编辑的论文集

sentences.english: I know that this draft text will need to be edited.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这篇草稿需要校订。

detailed_translations.english: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable

name: editorial
trans: n. 社论,adj. 编辑的；社论的

sentences.english: an editorial assistant
sentences.chinese: 编辑助理

detailed_translations.english: relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: elementary
trans: adj. 基本的；初级的； 元素的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: emphases
trans: n. 重点（emphasis的复数形式）

name: emphasize
trans: vt. 强调，着重

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: emphasise
trans: vt. （英）强调；加强…的语气（等于emphasize ）

sentences.english: I would emphasise three criteria.
sentences.chinese: 我想强调三条标准。

sentences.english: Many candidates go into interviews and are keen to emphasise their skills.
sentences.chinese: 在面试中，更多的候选人倾向于强调他们的专业技能。

sentences.english: They emphasise the significance of economic stability and social equality.
sentences.chinese: 他们强调了经济稳定、社会平等的重要性。

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励，怂恿；激励；支持

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: encouragement
trans: n. 鼓励

sentences.english: With encouragement, Sally is starting to play with the other children.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉受到了鼓励，开始和其他孩子玩起来。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["words of encouragement"]}
sentences.chinese: 鼓励的话

detailed_translations.english: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合,vt. 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: engagement
trans: n. 婚约；约会；交战；诺言,n. 参与度（指用户点赞、转发、评论、下载文档、观看视频、咨询等交互行为）

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: entertain
trans: vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳,vi. 款待

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: entertainment
trans: n. 娱乐；消遣；款待

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

name: envy
trans: n. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕,vt. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕,vi. 感到妒忌；显示出妒忌

sentences.english: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.chinese: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.english: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.english: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

detailed_translations.english: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

name: enviable
trans: adj. 值得羡慕的；引起忌妒的

sentences.english: Now he was in the enviable position of not having to work for a living.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已不必为生计而工作，着实令人羡慕。

detailed_translations.english: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it

name: envious
trans: adj. 羡慕的；嫉妒的

sentences.english: envious looks
sentences.chinese: 妒忌的神色

detailed_translations.english: wanting something that someone else has

name: eraser
trans: n. 橡皮；擦除器； 清除器

sentences.english: Yes, I have your eraser, too.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我还拿了你的橡皮。

sentences.english: That is an eraser.
sentences.chinese: 那是一块橡皮擦。

sentences.english: I have an eraser.
sentences.chinese: 我有一块橡皮。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of rubber that you use to remove pencil or pen marks from paper

name: erase
trans: vt. 抹去；擦除,vi. 被擦去，被抹掉

sentences.english: The computer crashed, and all our records were erased.
sentences.chinese: 计算机瘫痪了，我们所有的记录都被删除了。

detailed_translations.english: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape

name: erode
trans: vt. 腐蚀，侵蚀,vi. 侵蚀；受腐蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: erosion
trans: n. 侵蚀，腐蚀

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质；精华；香精

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: essential
trans: n. 本质；要素；要点；必需品,adj. 基本的；必要的；本质的；精华的

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: evil
trans: n. 罪恶，邪恶；不幸,adj. 邪恶的；不幸的；有害的；讨厌的

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: devil
trans: n. 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼,vt. 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

sentences.english: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

detailed_translations.chinese: 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼
detailed_translations.english: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

detailed_translations.chinese: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

name: example
trans: n. 例子；榜样,vt. 作为…的例子；为…做出榜样,vi. 举例

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

name: exemplify
trans: vt. 例证；例示

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: excellence
trans: n. 优秀；美德；长处

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: excel
trans: vt. 超过；擅长,vi. (在某方面)胜过(或超过)别人

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: except
trans: conj. 除了；要不是,prep. 除…之外,vt. 不计；把…除外,vi. 反对

sentences.english: They were all there except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外他们都在那里。

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: They all howled with laughter except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。

name: exception
trans: n. 例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: exhaust
trans: n. 排气；废气；排气装置,vt. 排出；耗尽；使精疲力尽；彻底探讨,vi. 排气

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

name: exhausted
trans: v. 耗尽；用尽；使…精疲力尽（exhaust的过去式）,adj. 疲惫的；耗尽的

sentences.english: You look absolutely exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 你看上去一副疲惫不堪的样子。

sentences.english: Don't exhaust him.
sentences.chinese: 别让他精疲力竭了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽；用尽；使…精疲力尽（exhaust的过去式）
detailed_translations.english: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left

name: exhausting
trans: v. 耗尽；使…精疲力竭；排出（exhaust的ing形式）,adj. 使筋疲力尽的；使耗尽的

name: exhaustive
trans: adj. 详尽的；彻底的；消耗的

sentences.english: an exhaustive investigation
sentences.chinese: 彻底的调查

sentences.english: The list is by no means exhaustive.
sentences.chinese: 清单一点也不详尽。

detailed_translations.english: extremely thorough and complete

name: exhibition
trans: n. 展览，显示；展览会；展览品

sentences.english: All visitors to the exhibition must report to the main service desk.
sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

name: exhibit
trans: n. 展览品；证据；展示会,vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等）,vi. 展出；开展览会

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试,vi. 尝试；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: experimental
trans: adj. 实验的；根据实验的；试验性的

sentences.english: experimental teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 试验性教学方法

detailed_translations.english: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have

name: expert
trans: n. 专家；行家；能手,adj. 熟练的；内行的；老练的,vt. 当专家；在…中当行家

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识；专门技术；专家的意见

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: fair
trans: n. 展览会；市集；美人,adj. 公平的；美丽的，白皙的； 晴朗的,vi. 转晴,adv. 公平地；直接地；清楚地

sentences.english: a fair maiden
sentences.chinese: 美丽的少女

detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attractive

name: fairly
trans: adv. 相当地；公平地；简直

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: faith
trans: n. 信仰；信念；信任；忠实

sentences.english: People have lost faith in the government.
sentences.chinese: 人们已失去了对政府的信心。

sentences.english: deep religious faith
sentences.chinese: 坚定的宗教信仰

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

name: faithful
trans: adj. 忠实的，忠诚的；如实的；准确可靠的

sentences.english: a faithful friend
sentences.chinese: 忠诚的朋友

sentences.english: years of faithful service to the company
sentences.chinese: 为公司多年忠诚的服务

sentences.english: our faithful family dog, Bogey
sentences.chinese: 我家的忠犬博吉

sentences.english: a faithful member of the church
sentences.chinese: 教会的忠实信徒

sentences.english: a faithful account of what had happened
sentences.chinese: 对所发生之事的如实报道

detailed_translations.english: remaining loyal to a particular person, belief, political party etc and continuing to support them

name: famous
trans: adj. 著名的；极好的，非常令人满意的

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说,vt. 使闻名，使有名望

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: fascinate
trans: vt. 使着迷，使神魂颠倒,vi. 入迷

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: fascinating
trans: adj. 迷人的；吸引人的；使人神魂颠倒的,v. 使…着迷；使…陶醉（fascinate的ing形式）

sentences.english: a fascinating book
sentences.chinese: 一本引人入胜的书

sentences.english: That sounds absolutely fascinating .
sentences.chinese: 那听起来极具吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 有极大吸引力的
detailed_translations.english: extremely interesting

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；时髦人物,vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: fashionable
trans: adj. 流行的；时髦的；上流社会的

sentences.english: Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下流行艳丽的色彩。

detailed_translations.english: popular, especially for a short period of time

name: fate
trans: n. 命运,vt. 注定

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: fatal
trans: adj. 致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: federal
trans: adv. 联邦政府地,adj. 联邦的；同盟的；联邦政府的； 联邦制的

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: federation
trans: n. 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府

sentences.english: the National Federation of Women’s Institutes
sentences.chinese: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府
detailed_translations.english: a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group

name: finance
trans: n. 财政，财政学；金融,vt. 负担经费，供给…经费,vi. 筹措资金

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

detailed_translations.chinese: 财政，金融；财源，财务情况
detailed_translations.english: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

name: financial
trans: adj. 金融的；财政的，财务的

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: fortune
trans: n. 财富；命运；运气,vt. 给予财富,vi. 偶然发生

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

name: misfortune
trans: n. 不幸；灾祸，灾难

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

name: frighten
trans: vt. 使惊吓；吓唬…,vi. 害怕，惊恐

sentences.english: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.english: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.english: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid

name: frightened
trans: v. 害怕；使吃惊；吓走（frighten的过去分词）,adj. 害怕的；受惊的；受恐吓的

sentences.english: Don’t be frightened. We’re not going to hurt you.
sentences.chinese: 别害怕，我们不会伤害你的。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, I was frightened to death (= very frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 说实话，我怕得要命。

sentences.english: a frightened horse
sentences.chinese: 一匹受惊的马

detailed_translations.chinese: 害怕的；受惊的；受恐吓的
detailed_translations.english: feeling afraid

detailed_translations.chinese: 害怕；使吃惊；吓走（frighten的过去分词）

name: frightening
trans: adj. 令人恐惧的；引起突然惊恐的

sentences.english: Going into hospital can be very frightening for a child.
sentences.chinese: 去医院对小孩子来说可能是很可怕的。

sentences.english: It was the most frightening experience of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中最可怕的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel afraid or nervous

name: front
trans: n. 前面；正面；前线,adj. 前面的；正面的,vt. 面对；朝向；对付,vi. 朝向,adv. 在前面；向前

sentences.english: Two of his front teeth had been knocked out.
sentences.chinese: 他有两颗门牙被打落了。

sentences.english: the front cover of ‘Hello!’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 《Hello!》杂志的封面

sentences.english: the front wheel of his bicycle
sentences.chinese: 他自行车的前轮

sentences.english: the dog’s front legs
sentences.chinese: 狗的前腿

sentences.english: Ricky stepped forward to the front of the stage and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 里基走到舞台的最前面，开始唱了起来。

detailed_translations.english: at, on, or in the front of something
the part of something that is furthest forward in the direction that it is facing or moving

name: confront
trans: vt. 面对；遭遇；比较

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: fruit
trans: n. 水果；产物,vt. 使……结果实,vi. 结果实

sentences.english: Try to eat plenty of fresh fruit .
sentences.chinese: 尽量多吃新鲜水果。

sentences.english: fruit and vegetables
sentences.chinese: 水果和蔬菜

sentences.english: a glass of fruit juice
sentences.chinese: 一杯果汁

sentences.english: a large garden with fruit trees
sentences.chinese: 种了果树的大花园

sentences.english: I’m looking forward to retirement and having time to enjoy the fruits of my labour (= the results of my hard work ) .
sentences.chinese: 我盼望着退休，好有时间来享受自己的劳动成果。

detailed_translations.english: something that grows on a plant, tree, or bush, can be eaten as a food, contains seeds or a stone, and is usually sweet

name: fruitful
trans: adj. 富有成效的；多产的；果实结得多的

sentences.english: Today’s meeting proved more fruitful than last week’s.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明今天的会议比上星期的更有成效。

sentences.english: a busy and fruitful time
sentences.chinese: 忙碌而有成效的一段时间

sentences.english: a fruitful source of information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息来源

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有成效的；多产的；果实结得多的

trans: n. 家具；设备；储藏物

sentences.chinese: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。

trans: vt. 提供；供应；装备

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

trans: n. 游戏；比赛,adj. 勇敢的,vi. 赌博

sentences.english: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在后院里玩游戏。

sentences.english: game birds
sentences.chinese: 被捕猎的鸟

detailed_translations.english: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules

name: gamble
trans: n. 赌博；冒险；打赌,vi. 赌博；孤注一掷；投机；打赌,vt. 赌博；孤注一掷；冒险假设

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

sentences.chinese: 3个巨大的地球仪立在地板上。

sentences.chinese: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

detailed_translations.english: the world

name: global
trans: adj. 全球的；总体的；球形的

sentences.chinese: 全球气候变化

sentences.english: the global economy
sentences.chinese: 全球经济

name: govern
trans: vt. 管理；支配；统治；控制,vi. 居支配地位；进行统治

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

trans: n. 主管人员；统治者，管理者； 调节器；地方长官

sentences.chinese: 他是20世纪70年代末爱荷华州的州长。

sentences.english: the prison governor

sentences.chinese: 我们在导游的带领下参观了博物馆。

trans: n. 指导，引导；领导

trans: adj. 有罪的；内疚的

sentences.chinese: 关于警员琼斯的死，他被判无罪。

trans: n. 犯罪，过失；内疚

sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

trans: adj. 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的

sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯又像往常习惯的那样绕花园作晨间散步去了。

name: habitat
trans: n.  栖息地，产地

sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

trans: vt. 栖息；居住于；占据,vi. （古）居住；栖息

sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

trans: n. 居民；居住者

sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

sentences.chinese: 从古至今，妇女的成就都被大大地忽视了。

sentences.chinese: 他对重建民主党的贡献在近代史上无人能及。

sentences.chinese: 苏格兰的早期历史

sentences.chinese: 在有记载的历史上发生过其他的流星暴。

sentences.english: a museum devoted to local history

sentences.english: an interesting period in Egyptian history

sentences.chinese: 一所历史悠久的学院

sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

sentences.english: a four-bedroom house
sentences.chinese: 一幢有四间卧室的房子

sentences.english: America’s oldest publishing house
sentences.chinese: 美国历史最悠久的出版社

sentences.english: a small independent software house
sentences.chinese: 一家小型的独立软件公司

sentences.english: an auction house
sentences.chinese: 一家拍卖行

sentences.english: a famous Italian fashion house

sentences.chinese: 住房条件差引起的健康问题

sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

sentences.chinese: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。

sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

trans: n. 开始；新加入者，接受初步知识者,vt. 开始，创始；发起；使初步了解,adj. 新加入的；接受初步知识的

sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

trans: n. 主动权；首创精神,adj. 主动的；自发的；起始的

sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

name: interfere
trans: vi. 干涉；妨碍；打扰,vt. 冲突；介入

sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.chinese: 一种可能的解释是，他们想要你辞职。

sentences.chinese: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。

sentences.english: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation (= able to be understood or explained in different ways ).

name: invade

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: invest

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

name: investment
trans: n. 投资；投入；封锁

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: large
trans: adj. 大的；多数的；广博的,adv. 大大地；夸大地,n. 大
