sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶是美国的第二大城市。

sentences.english: The T-shirt comes in Small, Medium and Large.
sentences.chinese: 这种T恤有小号、中号和大号。

sentences.english: a large ovenproof pan
sentences.chinese: 一只耐热的大烤盘

sentences.english: large sums ofmoney
sentences.chinese: 大笔的钱

sentences.english: those who drink large amounts of coffee
sentences.chinese: 咖啡喝得很多的人

sentences.english: A large number of students have signed up for the course.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生报名读这门课程。

detailed_translations.english: big in size, amount, or number

name: enlarge
trans: vt. 扩大；使增大；扩展,vi. 扩大；放大；详述

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

name: lead
trans: n. 领导；铅；导线；榜样,vt. 领导；致使；引导；指挥,vi. 领导；导致；用水砣测深,adj. 带头的；最重要的

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: leader
trans: n. 领导者；首领；指挥者

sentences.english: the largest ever gathering of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 全世界领导人史无前例的大聚会

detailed_translations.english: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导能力；领导阶层

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

name: mislead
trans: vt. 误导；带错

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: legal
trans: adj. 法律的；合法的；法定的；依照法律的

sentences.english: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。

sentences.english: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.english: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。

sentences.english: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
sentences.chinese: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

detailed_translations.english: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

name: illegal
trans: n. 非法移民，非法劳工,adj.  非法的；违法的；违反规则的

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

name: legislate
trans: vt. 用立法规定；通过立法,vi. 立法；制定法律

sentences.english: Most member countries have already legislated against excessive overtime.
sentences.chinese: 大部分成员国已经立法禁止过度加班。

detailed_translations.english: to make a law about something

name: legislation
trans: n. 立法；法律

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: locate
trans: vt. 位于；查找…的地点,vi. 定位；定居

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: location
trans: n. 位置（形容词locational）；地点；外景拍摄场地

sentences.english: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

detailed_translations.english: the act of finding the position of something

name: loose
trans: adj. 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的,vt. 释放；开船；放枪,vi. 变松；开火,adv. 松散地,n. 放纵；放任；发射

sentences.english: a loose floorboard
sentences.chinese: 松动的地板

sentences.english: This tooth feels very loose.
sentences.chinese: 这颗牙感觉松动得厉害。

sentences.english: The screw has come loose (= become loose ) .
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的
detailed_translations.english: not firmly fastened in place
to make something unpleasant begin

name: loosen
trans: vt. 放松；松开,vi. 放松；松开

sentences.english: You’ll need a spanner to loosen that bolt.
sentences.chinese: 你需要扳手来拧开那个螺栓。

sentences.english: The screws have loosened.
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

sentences.english: Harry loosened his tie.
sentences.chinese: 哈里松开了领带。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

name: love
trans: n. 恋爱；亲爱的；酷爱；喜爱的事物；爱情，爱意；疼爱；热爱；爱人，所爱之物,v. 爱，热爱；爱戴；赞美，称赞；喜爱；喜好；喜欢；爱慕

sentences.english: I love you, Tracy.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，特雷西。

sentences.english: He was the only man she had ever loved.
sentences.chinese: 他是她唯一爱过的男人。

sentences.english: What these kids need is love and support.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要的是关心和支持。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong feeling of  affection  for someone, combined with sexual attraction
a strong feeling of caring about someone, especially a member of your family or a close friend

name: beloved
trans: n. 心爱的人；亲爱的教友,adj. 心爱的；挚爱的

sentences.english: He never recovered from the death of his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他一直没有走出失去爱女的阴影。

sentences.english: He’s always talking about his beloved computer!
sentences.chinese: 他老是在谈论他的宝贝电脑！

sentences.english: It was a gift from her beloved.
sentences.chinese: 那是她心爱的人送的礼物。

detailed_translations.english: loved very much by someone
someone who is loved very much

name: low
trans: adj. 低的，浅的；卑贱的；粗俗的；消沉的,adv. 低声地；谦卑地，低下地,n. 低；低价；低点；牛叫声,vi. 牛叫

sentences.english: a low wall/building/table
sentences.chinese: 矮墙 / 建筑物 / 桌子

sentences.english: low clouds
sentences.chinese: 低云

sentences.english: jobs with low status
sentences.chinese: 社会地位低下的职业

detailed_translations.english: not high or tall

name: lower
trans: vt. 减弱，减少；放下，降下；贬低,vi. 降低；减弱；跌落,adj. 下游的；下级的；下等的

sentences.english: Temperatures will be lower over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 周末气温会下降。

sentences.english: She lowered her newspaper and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她放低报纸往四下看了看。

detailed_translations.english: smaller in number or amount
to let or make sth/sb go down

name: loyal
trans: adj. 忠诚的，忠心的；忠贞的,n. 效忠的臣民；忠实信徒

sentences.english: a loyal supporter of the team
sentences.chinese: 球队的忠实支持者

sentences.english: her many years of loyal service to the company
sentences.chinese: 她在公司多年的忠诚服务

sentences.english: loyal customers
sentences.chinese: 忠实客户

detailed_translations.english: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

name: loyalty
trans: n. 忠诚；忠心；忠实；忠于…感情

sentences.english: Elizabeth understood her husband’s loyalty to his sister.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country etc

name: manage
trans: vt. 管理；经营；控制；设法,vi. 处理；应付过去

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: management
trans: n. 管理；管理人员；管理部门；操纵；经营手段

sentences.english: a lack of management skills
sentences.chinese: 缺乏管理技巧

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 一个管理顾问

sentences.english: management training courses
sentences.chinese: 管理培训课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理； 处理； 管理部门， 管理人员
detailed_translations.english: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

name: mass
trans: n. 块，团；群众，民众；大量，众多；质量,adj. 群众的，民众的；大规模的，集中的,vi. 聚集起来，聚集,vt. 使集合

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

name: massive
trans: adj. 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: misery
trans: n. 痛苦，悲惨；不幸；苦恼；穷困

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: miserable
trans: adj. 悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: miserably
trans: adv. 贫困地；可悲地；糟糕地；非常不幸地

name: most
trans: adv. 最；非常，极其；最多；几乎,adj. 大部分的，多数的；最多的,n. 大部分，大多数

sentences.english: Which class has the most children in it?
sentences.chinese: 哪个班级孩子最多？

sentences.english: She’s one of the most experienced teachers in the district.
sentences.chinese: 她是该地区最有经验的教师之一。

detailed_translations.english: a larger amount or number than anyone or anything else
having the greatest amount of a particular quality

name: mostly
trans: adv. 主要地；通常；多半地

sentences.english: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
sentences.chinese: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。

sentences.english: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里大约有15人，大部分是女性。

sentences.english: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
sentences.chinese: 他责怪他的父母，主要是责怪他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

name: mountain
trans: n. 山；山脉

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

name: mount
trans: vt. 增加；爬上；使骑上马；安装，架置；镶嵌，嵌入；准备上演；成立（军队等）,vi. 爬；增加；上升,n. 山峰；底座；乘骑用马；攀，登；运载工具；底座,v. 登上；骑上

sentences.english: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他登上楼梯，慢慢环顾四周。

sentences.english: Mount Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: to go up a step or stairs
used as part of the name of a mountain

name: mystery
trans: n. 秘密，谜；神秘，神秘的事物；推理小说，推理剧；常作 mysteries 秘技，秘诀

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: name
trans: n. 名称，名字；姓名；名誉,vt. 命名，任命；指定；称呼；提名；叫出,adj. 姓名的；据以取名的

sentences.english: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.english: What’s your name?
sentences.chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentences.english: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

detailed_translations.english: what someone is called
to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

name: namely
trans: adv. 也就是；即是；换句话说

sentences.english: Three students were mentioned, namely John, Sarah and Sylvia.
sentences.chinese: 有三名学生被提到，即约翰、萨拉和西尔维娅。

detailed_translations.english: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

name: surname
trans: n. 姓，姓氏；绰号，别名,vt. 给…起别名；给…姓氏

sentences.english: What is your surname?
sentences.chinese: 你姓什么?

sentences.english: Your surname may be derived from a place, such as Lancaster, for example, or an occupation, such as Weaver, but this is not necessarily of relevance to your family history.
sentences.chinese: 或许，你的姓氏来源于一个地方名，例如兰开斯特，或者来源于职业，例如编织工。 但是，这并不能中肯地说出你家族的历史。

detailed_translations.english: the name that you share with your parents, or often with your husband if you are a married woman, and which in English comes at the end of your full name

name: narrative
trans: n. 叙述；故事；讲述,adj. 叙事的，叙述的；叙事体的

sentences.english: The novel contains more narrative than dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

detailed_translations.english: a description of events in a story, especially in a novel

name: narrate
trans: vt. 叙述；给…作旁白,vi. 叙述；讲述

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: necessary
trans: adj. 必要的；必需的；必然的,n. 必需品

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: necessarily
trans: adv. 必要地；必定地，必然地

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

name: necessity
trans: n. 需要；必然性；必需品

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: negative
trans: adj.  负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的,n. 否定；负数； 底片,vt. 否定；拒绝

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: negate
trans: vt. 否定；取消；使无效,vi. 否定；否认；无效,n. 对立面；反面

sentences.english: Efforts to expand the tourist industry could be negated by reports that the sea is highly polluted.
sentences.chinese: 有关海洋受到严重污染的报道可能会使拓展旅游业的努力完全白费。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from having any effect

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过,vi. 谈判，交涉

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: nervous
trans: adj. 神经的；紧张不安的；强健有力的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: nerve
trans: n. 神经；勇气； 叶脉,vt. 鼓起勇气

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: new
trans: adj. 新的，新鲜的；更新的；初见的,adv. 新近

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

name: anew
trans: adv. 重新；再

sentences.english: I was ready to leave everything behind and start anew in California.
sentences.chinese: 我准备好舍弃一切，在加利福尼亚开始新的生活。

detailed_translations.english: to begin a different job, start to live in a different place etc, especially after a difficult period in your life

name: renew
trans: vt. 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申,vi. 更新；重新开始

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: normal
trans: adj. 正常的；正规的，标准的,n. 正常；标准；常态

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: normally
trans: adv. 正常地；通常地，一般地

sentences.english: The journey normally takes about two hours.
sentences.chinese: 这段旅程通常需要大约两小时。

sentences.english: Normally, I park behind the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 通常我把车停在剧院后面。

sentences.english: The system seems to be working normally now.
sentences.chinese: 目前该系统似乎运行正常。

detailed_translations.english: usually

name: noun
trans: n. 名词

sentences.english: An adjective must agree with  its noun in mumber and case.
sentences.chinese: 形容词在数和格方面必须符合其所修饰的名词。

sentences.english: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.chinese: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.english: On the spines of books shelved in certain libraries and bookstores you will see OATES but this is a descriptive term, this is not a noun.
sentences.chinese: 在某些图书馆或书店里某些图书的书脊上，你会看见“欧茨”，但这里的“欧茨”不能作名词解，它是个描述性的词语。

detailed_translations.english: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).

name: pronoun
trans: n. 代词

sentences.english: Here you should use plural pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 这里你应该用复数代词。

sentences.english: No chance! It was the best of the weak pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 没有机会！这真是弱者的最好代词。

sentences.english: Now if we could only figure out the pronoun problem.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们可以解决这个代词问题了。

detailed_translations.english: a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, such as ‘he’ instead of ‘Peter’ or ‘the man’

name: number
trans: n. 数；（杂志等的）期；号码；数字；算术,vi. 计入；总数达到,vt. 编号；计入；数…的数目；使为数有限

sentences.english: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。

sentences.english: Add all the numbers together.
sentences.chinese: 把所有数字加起来。

sentences.english: Answer question number 4.
sentences.chinese: 回答第4题。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity

name: numerous
trans: adj. 许多的，很多的

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: operate
trans: vi. 运转；动手术；起作用,vt. 操作；经营；引起；对…开刀

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: operation
trans: n. 操作；经营； 手术； 运算

sentences.english: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

detailed_translations.english: an action done by a computer

name: operational
trans: adj. 操作的；运作的

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

name: cooperate
trans: vi. 合作，配合；协力

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: cooperation
trans: n. 合作，协作； 协力

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

name: organ
trans: n.  器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: organic
trans: adj.  有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: organize
trans: vt. 组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等,vi. 组织起来；成立组织

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: organise
trans: vi. 组织起来；组织工会,vt. 组织（等于organize）；有机化；给予生机

sentences.english: Do they organise words around a principle of syntax?
sentences.chinese: 他们会按照一定的句法规则组织单词吗？

sentences.english: And where it is needed—to organise investment in infrastructure, for instance, and to regulate markets—it needs to become more open in its dealings.
sentences.chinese: 而在那些需要政府去组织投资、监管市场的方面（比如说基础设施部门），在管理过程中需要变得更为开放。

sentences.english: The team then started to organise a set of clinical trials of personalised treatments for lung and breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: 于是研究小组开始着手组织一套针对肺癌和乳腺癌病人的个人化治疗临床试验。

name: pay
trans: n. 工资，薪水；付款；报答,vt. 支付，付；偿还，补偿；给予,vi. 付款；偿还,adj. 收费的；需付费的

sentences.english: How would you like to pay?
sentences.chinese: 你想怎么付款？

detailed_translations.english: to give someone money for something you buy or for a service

name: payment
trans: n. 付款，支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

name: repay
trans: vt. 回报；报复；付还,vi. 偿还；报答；报复

sentences.english: Your mortgage will be repaid over 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 你的按揭贷款将在25年内还清。

sentences.english: I’d like to buy them something to repay all their kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我想给他们买点东西来报答他们的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to pay back money that you have borrowed

name: philosophy
trans: n. 哲学；哲理；人生观

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

name: philosopher
trans: n. 哲学家；哲人

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: physical
trans: n. 体格检查,adj.  物理的；身体的；物质的；根据自然规律的，符合自然法则的

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: physicist
trans: n. 物理学家；唯物论者

sentences.english: a nuclear physicist
sentences.chinese: 一位核物理学家

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in physics

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼,vt. 种植；培养；栽培；安置,vi. 种植

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: plantation
trans: n. 栽植；殖民；大农场,adj. 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

sentences.english: a rubber plantation
sentences.chinese: 橡胶园

detailed_translations.chinese: 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

name: transplant
trans: n. 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者,vt. 移植；迁移；使移居,vi. 移植；迁移；移居

sentences.english: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
sentences.chinese: 移植肾脏的手术如今相当常见。

detailed_translations.english: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

detailed_translations.chinese: 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者
detailed_translations.english: the operation of transplanting an organ, piece of skin etc

name: plenty
trans: n. 丰富，大量；充足,adj. 足够的，很多的,adv. 足够

sentences.english: There’s plenty to do and see in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约有很多事可做，很多东西可看。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough

name: plentiful
trans: adj. 丰富的；许多的；丰饶的；众多的

sentences.english: a plentiful supply of food
sentences.chinese: 食物的大量供应

detailed_translations.english: more than enough in quantity

name: poem
trans: n. 诗

sentences.english: You need to touch up the poem.
sentences.chinese: 你需要给这首诗润色一下。

sentences.english: The poem was all the rage then.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗在当时十分流行。

sentences.english: His poem compares poorly with yours.
sentences.chinese: 他的诗做得不如你的好。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing that expresses emotions, experiences, and ideas, especially in short lines using words that  rhyme (= end with the same sound )

name: poetry
trans: n. 诗；诗意，诗情；诗歌艺术

sentences.english: He reads a lot of poetry.
sentences.chinese: 他大量阅读诗歌。

sentences.english: a poetry magazine
sentences.chinese: 诗歌杂志

detailed_translations.english: poems in general, or the art of writing them

name: popular
trans: adj. 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: popularity
trans: n. 普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: possible
trans: n. 可能性；合适的人；可能的事物,adj. 可能的；合理的；合适的

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

name: possibly
trans: adv. 可能地；也许；大概

sentences.english: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。

sentences.english: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
sentences.chinese: 要花三个星期，也许更久。

sentences.english: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
sentences.chinese: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”

sentences.english: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly (= it is very likely ) .’
sentences.chinese: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准,adj. 现在的；出席的,vt. 提出；介绍；呈现；赠送,vi. 举枪瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: presently
trans: adv. （美）目前；不久

sentences.english: The doctor will be here presently.
sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.english: Presently, I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

name: probable
trans: n. 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者,adj. 很可能的；可信的

sentences.english: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
sentences.chinese: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。

sentences.english: Success is highly probable .
sentences.chinese: 成功的希望相当大。

detailed_translations.english: likely to exist, happen, or be true

detailed_translations.chinese: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc

name: probably
trans: adv. 大概；或许；很可能

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: public
trans: n. 公众；社会；公共场所,adj. 公众的；政府的；公用的；公立的

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: publicize
trans: vt. 宣传；公布

sentences.english: television’s failure to publicize the unemployment issue
sentences.chinese: 电视未能报道失业问题

detailed_translations.english: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

name: publicise
trans: vt. 宣传，宣扬；公布，颂

name: publicity
trans: n. 宣传，宣扬；公开；广告；注意

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

name: publish
trans: vi. 出版；发行；刊印,vt. 出版；发表；公布

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: publication
trans: n. 出版；出版物；发表

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

name: punish
trans: vt. 惩罚；严厉对待；贪婪地吃喝,vi. 惩罚

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

name: punishment
trans: n. 惩罚；严厉对待，虐待

sentences.english: ...a group that campaigns against the physical punishment of children.
sentences.chinese: …一个发起运动反对体罚儿童的组织。

detailed_translations.english: Punishment is the act of punishing someone or of being punished

name: qualify
trans: vi. 取得资格，有资格,vt. 限制；使具有资格；证明…合格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格；条件；限制；赋予资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: quote
trans: n. 引用,vi. 报价；引用；引证,vt. 报价；引述；举证

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: quotation
trans: n.  报价单；引用语；引证

sentences.english: The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
sentences.chinese: 下文引自19世纪的一篇旅行日记。

sentences.english: a dictionary of quotations
sentences.chinese: 引语词典，语录汇编

sentences.english: a quotation for car insurance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险的报价单

detailed_translations.english: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

name: rational
trans: n. 有理数,adj. 合理的；理性的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: irrational
trans: n.  无理数,adj. 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的

sentences.english: an irrational fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: ready
trans: n. 现款；预备好的状态,adj. 准备好；现成的；迅速的；情愿的；快要…的,vt. 使准备好,adv. 迅速地；预先

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: readily
trans: adv. 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: real
trans: n. 现实；实数,adj. 实际的；真实的；实在的,adv. 真正地；确实地

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: realistic
trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: realize
trans: vt. 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: realise
trans: vt. 实现, 认识到, 体会到, 了解, 认清, 使显得逼真, 变卖财产为现钱

sentences.english: In the first half they realise their boss is exploiting them and begin to understand the theory of surplus value.
sentences.chinese: 在前半部，工人们认识到他们的老板是在剥削他们，开始了解剩余价值理论。

sentences.english: I hope that as time goes on we will realise that it is important for us to talk openly about Aids, because it is the only way to make it appear normal, like cancer.
sentences.chinese: 我希望随着时间的推移，人们将认识到公开谈论艾滋病是一件重要的事情，因为这是唯一一条使它成为像癌症一样的正常疾病的途径。

name: realization
trans: n. 实现；领悟

sentences.english: the realization of his dreams
sentences.chinese: 他的梦想成真

detailed_translations.english: when you achieve something that you had planned or hoped for

name: realisation
trans: n. 认识，领会; 实现

name: recover
trans: n. 还原至预备姿势,vt. 恢复；弥补；重新获得,vi. 恢复；胜诉；重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: recovery
trans: n. 恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: refresh
trans: vt. 更新；使……恢复；使……清新；消除……的疲劳,vi. 恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: refreshment
trans: n. 点心；起提神作用的东西；精力恢复

sentences.english: Refreshments will be served after the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 会后有茶点招待。

detailed_translations.chinese: 点心；起提神作用的东西；精力恢复
detailed_translations.english: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: reluctance
trans: n.  磁阻；勉强；不情愿

sentences.english: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔斯最终同意了，但很勉强。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing

name: replace
trans: vt. 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: replacement
trans: n. 更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员

sentences.english: Our old car is badly in need of replacement.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旧车急需更换。

sentences.english: replacement windows
sentences.chinese: 新换的窗户

detailed_translations.english: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送,vi. 代表；提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: representation
trans: n. 代表；表现；表示法；陈述

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意,vt. 尊敬，尊重；遵守

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: respectively
trans: adv. 分别地；各自地，独自地

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

name: rich
trans: adj. 富有的；肥沃的；昂贵的,adj. 油腻的，含有很多脂肪

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

name: enrich
trans: vt. 使充实；使肥沃；使富足

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: romance
trans: n. 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事,vi. 虚构；渲染；写传奇

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

name: romantic
trans: n. 浪漫的人,adj. 浪漫的；多情的；空想的,vt. 使…浪漫化

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

name: round
trans: n. 圆；循环；一回合；圆形物,prep. 附近；绕过；大约；在…周围,adj. 圆的；完全的；大概的；肥胖的,vt. 完成；围捕；绕行；弄圆,adv. 在周围；迂回地；朝反方向；挨个,vi. 进展；变圆；环行；发胖

sentences.english: We sat round the table playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 我们围桌而坐玩纸牌。

sentences.english: Gather round! I have an important announcement to make.
sentences.chinese: 大家围拢来！我有重要事情要宣布。

sentences.english: He put his arm gently round her waist.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻地搂着她的腰。

sentences.english: I kept the key on a chain round my neck.
sentences.chinese: 我给钥匙穿了根链子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: The ballroom’s huge, with windows all the way round .
sentences.chinese: 舞厅很大，四周都是窗户。

sentences.english: There was a lovely courtyard with tables all round .
sentences.chinese: 有一个漂亮的庭院，四周都是桌子。

detailed_translations.english: surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
shaped like a circle
a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process
on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it

name: surround
trans: n. 围绕物,vt. 围绕；包围,adj. 环绕立体声的

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: surroundings
trans: n. 环境；周围的事物

sentences.english: I need to work in pleasant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 我需要在舒适的环境下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the objects, buildings, natural things etc that are around a person or thing at a particular time

name: satisfy
trans: vi. 令人满意；令人满足,vt. 满足；说服，使相信；使满意，使高兴

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

name: satisfactory
trans: adj. 满意的；符合要求的；赎罪的

sentences.english: His progress this term has been satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 他这学期的进步令人满意。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for a particular purpose

name: shore
trans: n. 海滨；支柱,vt. 支撑，使稳住；用支柱撑住

sentences.english: We could see a boat about a mile from shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见离岸边大约一英里的地方有一艘船。

sentences.english: Only a few survivors reached the shore.
sentences.chinese: 仅有几个生还者到达岸边。

sentences.english: She began to swim to shore.
sentences.chinese: 她开始朝岸边游去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，使稳住；用支柱撑住
detailed_translations.english: to prop or make safe with or as if with a shore
the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

name: ashore
trans: adj. 在岸上的；在陆上的,adv. 在岸上；向岸

sentences.english: Several dead birds had been washed ashore.
sentences.chinese: 几只死鸟被冲上了岸。

detailed_translations.english: on or towards the shore of a lake, river, sea etc

name: similar
trans: n. 类似物,adj. 相似的

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: similarly
trans: adv. 同样地；类似于

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

trans: n. 一个；单打；单程票,adj. 单一的；单身的；单程的,vt. 选出,vi. 击出一垒安打

sentences.chinese: 唯有一棵树遮阴。

sentences.chinese: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。

sentences.english: a single-sex school

trans: n. 单数,adj. 单数的；单一的；非凡的；异常的

sentences.english: the singular form of the noun
sentences.chinese: 该名词的单数形式

sentences.chinese: 如果主语是单数，就用单数动词。

sentences.english: a singular achievement
sentences.chinese: 非凡的成就

detailed_translations.english: a singular noun, verb, form etc is used when writing or speaking about one person or thing

trans: n. 技能，技巧；本领，技术

sentences.english: Reading and writing are two different skills.
sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.english: Many jobs today require computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

trans: adj. 熟练的；有技能的；需要技能的

sentences.chinese: 对木工之类的熟练工匠需求量很大。

sentences.english: The company is fortunate to have such highly skilled workers.
sentences.chinese: 公司有这样一些技能熟练的工人真是幸运。

name: smell
trans: n. 气味，嗅觉；臭味,vt. 嗅，闻；察觉到；发出…的气味,vi. 嗅，闻；有…气味

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

name: smelly
trans: adj. 有臭味的，发臭的

sentences.english: smelly feet
sentences.chinese: 臭脚

detailed_translations.english: having a strong unpleasant smell

name: source
trans: n. 来源；水源；原始资料

sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: start
trans: n. 开始；起点,vt. 开始；启动,vi. 出发

sentences.english: There’s so much to do. I don’t know where to start.
sentences.chinese: 有那么多的事情要做，我都不知道从哪里开始。

sentences.english: She wanted to start her own catering business.
sentences.chinese: 她想自己创立一家餐饮公司。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

trans: n. 惊愕；惊恐,vt. 使吓一跳；使惊奇,vi. 惊吓；惊跳；惊奇

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

trans: n. 战略，策略

sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

trans: adj. 战略上的，战略的

sentences.english: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。

sentences.english: strategic planning meetings
sentences.chinese: 战略计划会议

sentences.english: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
sentences.chinese: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

detailed_translations.english: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

name: substance
trans: n. 物质；实质；资产；主旨

sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

trans: n. 本质；重要材料,adj. 大量的；实质的；内容充实的

sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

trans: n. 外科；外科手术；手术室；诊疗室

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

trans: n. 外科医生

sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

name: symbol
trans: n. 象征；符号；标志

sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

sentences.chinese: 仪式的每一个元素都具有象征意义。

detailed_translations.english: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect

name: sympathy
trans: n. 同情；慰问；赞同

sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

trans: n. 交感神经；容易感受的人,adj. 同情的；交感神经的；共鸣的；赞同的；和谐的；合意的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

trans: n. 试验；检验,vt. 试验；测试,vi. 试验；测试

sentences.chinese: 你这次测验成绩好吗？

detailed_translations.english: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge
to examine a substance or thing in order to find out its qualities or what it contains

trans: n. 竞赛；争夺；争论,vt. 争辩；质疑,vi. 竞争；争辩

sentences.chinese: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.english: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.english: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.chinese: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.english: the 1975 Liberal leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 1975年自由党的领导权之争

detailed_translations.english: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 争夺， 与…竞争； 对…提出质疑， 辩驳
detailed_translations.english: to say formally that you do not accept something or do not agree with it

trans: n. 竞争者；争辩者

sentences.chinese: 第 5 列只显示了一个竞争者 — 整个锦标赛的获胜者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in a contest

sentences.chinese: 这想法很有趣。

sentences.english: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
sentences.chinese: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

trans: adj. 深思的；体贴的；关切的

sentences.chinese: 保罗非常体贴人。

sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

sentences.chinese: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪，他们就要罢工。

sentences.chinese: 《耐心与萨拉》于1969年以《我们的地方》为书名首次出版。

sentences.chinese: 这支单曲名为《白色之恋》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冠军；标题；头衔；权利；字幕

detailed_translations.english: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a name

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

trans: vi. 理解；懂得；熟悉,vt. 理解；懂；获悉；推断；省略

sentences.english: She doesn’t understand English.
sentences.chinese: 她不懂英语。

sentences.english: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？

sentences.english: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
sentences.chinese: 那女人口音很重，我听不懂她在说些什么。

trans: vt. 误解；误会

sentences.chinese: 雷切尔，你一定是误会她了！埃莉绝不会说那样的话。

sentences.chinese: 不要误解我的意思。你了解她后就会知道她是个很好的人。

sentences.chinese: 我们慢慢地爬上山。

sentences.english: She picked her jacket up off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她从地板上捡起外套。

sentences.english: paths leading up into the mountains
sentences.chinese: 通往山里的小径

sentences.english: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆爬到了树上，以便看得更清楚。

sentences.english: Put up your hand if you know the answer.
sentences.chinese: 如果知道答案就举手。

sentences.english: The water was getting up my nose.
sentences.chinese: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。

sentences.english: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦仰卧着，盯着天花板。

sentences.english: Are you sure you should be up?
sentences.chinese: 你肯定你该起床了吗?

sentences.english: These days they were up at the crack of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 这些天他们在破晓时就起床。

detailed_translations.english: towards a higher place or position
If you are up, you are not in bed

name: upper
trans: adj. 上面的，上部的；较高的

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: use
trans: n. 使用；用途；发挥,vt. 利用；耗费,vi. 使用，运用

sentences.chinese: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

sentences.english: I’ll show you which room you can use.
sentences.chinese: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。

sentences.english: I always use the same shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 我一直用同一种洗发水。

sentences.english: Use your imagination when planning meals.
sentences.chinese: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。

sentences.english: She booked the flight using a false name.
sentences.chinese: 她用化名预订了航班。

detailed_translations.english: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用， 应用； 用途， 效用
detailed_translations.english: the action or fact of using something

name: usage
trans: n. 使用；用法；惯例

sentences.english: land usage
sentences.chinese: 土地的利用

sentences.english: a book on modern English usage
sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something is used or the way in which it is used

name: verb
trans: n. 动词；动词词性；动词性短语或从句,adj. 动词的；有动词性质的；起动词作用的

sentences.english: The German verb is postponed.
sentences.chinese: 德语动词放在句末。

sentences.english: The word is compounded of a preposition and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 这个词是由一个介词和一个动词复合而成的。

sentences.english: The verb agrees with its subject in number and person.
sentences.chinese: 动词的数和人称与主语一致。

detailed_translations.english: a word or group of words that describes an action, experience, or state, such as ‘come’, ‘see’, and ‘put on’

name: adverb
trans: n. 副词,adj. 副词的

sentences.english: Will you please compare the adverb “well”?
sentences.chinese: 请你说出副词“well”的原级、比较级和最高级好吗?

sentences.english: In the class, the professor taught the students how to use an adverb in the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 在课堂上，教授教学生们如何在一个句子里用副词。

sentences.english: For our purposes, we get the definition of a word as well as its pronunciation and type (for example, adjective, noun, verb, adverb).
sentences.chinese: 我们这里只涉及到词汇的定义、音标和词性（如形容词、名词、动词、副词等）。

detailed_translations.english: a word that adds to the meaning of a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or a whole sentence, such as ‘slowly’ in ‘He ran slowly’, ‘very’ in ‘It’s very hot’, or ‘naturally’ in ‘Naturally, we want you to come.’

name: view
trans: n. 观察；视野；意见；风景,vt. 观察；考虑；查看

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: viewer
trans: n. 观察者；观看者；观众； 指示器

sentences.english: The new series has gone down well with viewers.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的电视系列片很受观众欢迎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 观察者；观看者；观众；[仪] 指示器
detailed_translations.english: someone who watches television

name: vigor
trans: n.  活力，精力

sentences.english: If you want to retain youthful vigor,you have to take regular exercise.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想保持青春活力，你就得经常锻炼。

sentences.english: In fact, the huge inheritance does not do him any good, but tends to undermine his vigor and passion for life.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这么大笔的遗产对他不仅没有什么好处，反而会损害他的活力和对生活的激情。

sentences.english: They would be lying there in the tree like, 'Oh, just let me just die up here, ' because they lacked any kind of vigor.
sentences.chinese: 因为它们一点活力都没有, 他们会整天在树下躺着，一付‘噢，实在活不起了，让我死在这里好了’的样子。

name: vigour
trans: n. 活力；气势

sentences.english: He began working with renewed vigour.
sentences.chinese: 他以更加旺盛的精力开始工作。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental energy and determination

trans: adj. 有力的；精力充沛的

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

name: whole
trans: n. 整体；全部,adj. 完整的；纯粹的

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you!
